headlines: Citigroup to fire unvaccinated US employees by month end: Report
text: Citigroup on Friday told its staff in the US that it would terminate the employees who are unvaccinated against COVID-19 as of January 14, enforcing a policy that was announced last year, according to reports. Their last day of employment will reportedly come at the month end. The company reportedly allowed the employees to apply for religious or medical exemptions.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: How much money did Kohli, Ronaldo and other celebrities earn per Instagram post in 2021?
text:
Team India Test captain Virat Kohli earned $680,000 (₹5 crore) per Instagram post in 2021, as per a report by Forbes India. Cristiano Ronaldo earned $1,604,000 (₹12 crore) per post, the highest among all the celebrities. He was followed by Dwayne Johnson ($1,523,000/post) and 
Ariana Grande ($1,510,000/post). Priyanka Chopra earned $403,000 per Instagram post last year.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: CCI orders probe into Google after complaint from news publishers
text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has ordered an investigation into Google following allegations from the Digital News Publishers Association. The watchdog said its initial view was that the company had broken some antitrust laws. Google dominates certain online search services in the country and may have imposed unfair conditions on news publishers, the CCI added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: What is Apple CEO Tim Cook's compensation breakup as he earns $98.7 million in 2021?
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook received $98.73 million in compensation in 2021, the company's SEC filing revealed. This includes his salary of $3 million, $82.3 million in stock awards and $12 million bonus for hitting Apple financial and environmental sustainability goals. He received $1.39 million in other compensations, including $712,488 in personal air travel.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Celebs peddling crypto as safe is quite disgusting: Zerodha CEO
text: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath said in a tweet that famous personalities triggering retail investors to invest in super risky asset classes without talking about the risks is "quite disgusting". He tweeted, "Thanks to crypto, it's been a case of 'never meet your heroes' with so many people I admired, for peddling crypto, NFTs (non-fungible tokens), etc. as safe and guaranteed."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: China fines 7-Eleven ₹17 lakh for listing Taiwan as a country on its website
text: China has issued a warning to convenience store chain 7-Eleven for listing Taiwan as a country on its website and displaying maps containing incorrect borders for Xinjiang and Tibet. It has imposed a fine of $23,500 (₹17.5 lakh) on the company. "This incident is true, and we sincerely accept (the warning and the fine)," a spokesperson for the company said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India’s GDP estimated to rise 9.2% in FY 2021-22 compared to 7.3% contraction in 2020-21
text: In the first advance estimates released by the National Statistical Office, the growth in real GDP during 2021-22 is estimated at 9.2% as compared to the contraction of 7.3% in 2020-21. "Real GDP...in the year 2021-22 is estimated at ₹147.54 lakh crore, as against the Provisional Estimate of GDP for the year 2020-21 of ₹135.13 lakh crore," NSO stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Gupta brothers step down from Ashoka University's board after CBI probe
text: Two of the Co-founders of Ashoka University Vineet Gupta and Pranav Gupta have stepped down from all boards and committees of the varsity. The brothers, who are also directors of Chandigarh-based pharmaceutical company Parabolic Drugs Ltd (PDL), have been booked by the CBI for allegedly cheating the Central Bank of India and other banks to the tune of ₹1,626 crore.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Co-founders of Ashoka University Gupta brothers charged by CBI in ₹1,626-crore bank fraud
text: Co-founders of Ashoka University Pranav Gupta and Vineet Gupta, who also own Chandigarh-based pharmaceutical company Parabolic Drugs Ltd (PDL), have been booked by CBI for alleged bank fraud of around ₹1,626 crore. The case has been registered on complaint from Central Bank of India that PDL and its promoters and directors cheated a consortium of banks led by SBI.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Startup body IndiaTech seeks clarity on crypto tax rules, writes to FM
text: IndiaTech, which represents tech startups, unicorns and investors, has written to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, seeking clarity on cryptocurrency taxation in Union Budget 2022-23, reported ET. "The Budget should ideally offer coherent rules on direct taxation and the GST Council should detail the applicability of taxation, else there will be confusion," IndiaTech CEO Rameesh Kailasam said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Bitcoin falls below $41,000 to lowest level since September
text: The price of the world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell as much as 5% on Friday to its lowest level since late September. Bitcoin was last trading around $40,938, down 40% since hitting a record high of $69,000 in November. Ether, the second largest cryptocurrency by market value, also fell as much as 8.6% to $3,114, its lowest since October 1.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Former Theranos President Ramesh Balwani's fraud trial delayed
text: US blood-testing startup Theranos' former President Ramesh 'Sunny' Balwani's criminal fraud trial will be delayed due to a surge in COVID-19 cases in California, a judge said. Elizabeth Holmes, who dropped out of Stanford to start Theranos, was convicted of investor fraud and conspiracy earlier this week. Balwani faces the same charges as Holmes and has pleaded not guilty.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sony plans to enter electric car market, says CEO
text: Japan's multinational conglomerate Sony Corporation plans to launch a new company named Sony Mobility to examine entering the electric vehicle market, said Sony's CEO Kenichiro Yoshida. ''With our imaging and sensing, cloud, 5G, and entertainment technologies combined with our contents mastery, we believe Sony is well positioned as a creative entertainment company to redefine mobility,'' he said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Forex reserves decline by $1.466 billion: RBI data
text: The country’s foreign exchange reserves declined by $1.466 billion to $633.614 billion during the week ended December 31, 2021, RBI data showed. Notably, the country's forex reserves touched a record high of $642.453 billion in the week ended September 3, 2021. Forex reserves include foreign currency assets (FCAs), gold reserves, SDRs, and the country's reserve position with the IMF.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Vibrant Gujarat Summit postponed amid COVID-19 surge
text: The Gujarat government on Thursday announced that it has postponed the 10th edition of the Vibrant Gujarat Global Investors Summit (VGGIS) due to rise in COVID-19 cases in the state. The event was to be held from January 10 to 12 at Mahatma Mandir in Gandhinagar. Nearly 26 nations were scheduled to join VGGIS as partner countries this year.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Govt approves ₹12,031 crore green power transmission scheme
text: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs on Thursday approved the second phase of the green energy corridor scheme which is estimated to cost ₹12,031 crore. The second phase of green energy corridor scheme will facilitate grid integration and power evacuation of about 20 GW of renewable energy projects in Gujarat, Himachal Pradesh, Karnataka, Kerala, Rajasthan, Tamil Nadu and Uttar Pradesh.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: New York Times to buy sports website The Athletic for $550 mn
text: American daily The New York Times has agreed to buy subscription-based sports site The Athletic in an all-cash deal for $550 million. "We're now in pursuit of a goal meaningfully larger than 10 million subscriptions and believe The Athletic will enable us to expand our addressable market of potential subscribers," said The New York Times Company CEO Meredith Kopit Levien.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Royal Caribbean pauses some cruise operations amid Omicron scare
text: Royal Caribbean Cruises on Friday announced that it has paused some of its cruise operations amid rising numbers of Omicron cases. The sailings of three ships Serenade of the Seas, Jewel of the Seas, Symphony of the Seas have been paused while the return of Vision of the Seas to cruising has been postponed to March 7, the company said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Indonesia to decide over ban on coal exports by weekend
text: Indonesian government aims to take the final decision over lifting the ban on coal exports likely on Saturday after the country faced a domestic supply crisis that sent international prices higher this week. The world's biggest thermal coal exporter suspended coal exports on January 1 after Indonesia's state power utility reported low inventory levels of the fuel, facing power outages.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: JSW Steel to invest ₹15,000 cr to set up 5 MTPA capacity in Vijayanagara
text: JSW Steel on Friday announced that it will invest ₹15,000 crore to set up 5 million tonnes per annual (MTPA) steel-making capacity at its integrated plant in Vijayanagara, Karnataka. Union Steel Minister Ram Chandra Prasad Singh laid the foundation stone of the expansion project on Friday. The company aims to take its Vijayanagara facility to 18 MTPA by FY24.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Govt selects TCS to drive next phase of Passport Seva Programme
text: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) on Friday said it has been selected by the government for the second phase of the Passport Seva Programme. ''Our partnership with MEA over the last decade has become a benchmark in a public-private partnership for citizen services. We are pleased to be selected for the next phase of the Passport Seva Programme,'' said the company.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: FM Nirmala Sitharaman reviews progress on LIC's planned IPO
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Friday reviewed the progress of Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) planned IPO. The Secretary of Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM), Department of Financial Services' Secretary and senior officials of LIC were also present. LIC's IPO is poised to be the biggest ever in India and is expected to hit the markets by March.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: TCS board to consider share buyback proposal on January 12
text: The board of Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) will consider a share buyback proposal on January 12, the company said in an exchange filing. The company's previous buyback offer worth about ₹16,000 crore had opened on December 18, 2020 and closed on January 1, 2021. TCS is due to report its earnings for the third quarter ended December on January 12.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: DPIIT to revise India's FDI policy for LIC disinvestment: Secretary
text: DPIIT Secretary Anurag Jain said that the department will come out with a revised FDI policy to facilitate LIC's disinvestment process. "We are working on further simplification of the FDI policy," Jain said. Currently, 74% foreign investment is permitted in the insurance sector. However, these rules do not apply to LIC as it is administered through a separate LIC Act.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: World food prices jumped 28% in 2021, highest in 10 years
text: World food prices jumped 28% in 2021, which is the highest rise recorded in 10 years, the UN's food agency said on Thursday. Prices for all categories in the food price index except dairy products fell slightly in December but continued to increase during the other months. FAO's vegetable oil price index also hit a record high in 2021.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Tata Steel Q3 output up by 2% to 7.68 MT, sales drop by 3%
text: Tata Steel on Friday reported an over two percent rise in consolidated steel output to 7.68 million tonnes (MT) for the October-December quarter. However, the company's consolidated sales during Q3 fell by around three percent to 6.88 MT, compared to 7.09 MT during the previous year's Q3. Meanwhile, Tata Steel India crude steel production grew by 16% year-on-year.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Xiaomi India evaded ₹653 crore customs duty: Govt
text: The government on Wednesday said that raids at Xiaomi India found that it evaded customs duty of ₹653 crore. "Neither Xiaomi India nor its contract manufactures included the amount of royalty paid by Xiaomi India in the assessable value of the goods imported," the government said. The government also said it sent three show-cause notices to Xiaomi India for recovery.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Musk trolls GM for selling only 26 EVs in Q4 2021 in US, says 'Room to improve'
text: World's richest person and Tesla's CEO Elon Musk trolled rival company General Motors (GM) after it sold only 26 electric vehicles in the US in Q4 of 2021. "Room to improve," tweeted Musk. General Motors' sales numbers come amid the White House promoting it as a "leader" in the electric vehicle market.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Pvt sector should oppose China's genocide: US as Tesla opens showroom in Xinjiang
text: After billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla opened a showroom in Xinjiang, White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said, "We believe the private sector should oppose China's human rights abuses and genocide in Xinjiang." "The international community, including the public and private sectors, cannot look the other way when it comes to what is taking place in Xinjiang," she added.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Reliance Retail buys 25.8% stake in Dunzo for $200 million
text: Reliance Retail on Thursday announced it has acquired a 25.8% stake in delivery services startup Dunzo for $200 million. Bengaluru-based Dunzo raised $240 million in its latest funding round led by Reliance Retail, with participation from existing investors Lightbox, Lightrock, 3L Capital and Alteria Capital. Reliance Retail will also enter into certain business partnerships with Dunzo.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Toyota overtakes GM as US' top-selling automaker for first time since 1931
text: Japan's Toyota Motor outsold General Motors (GM) in the US in 2021, marking the first time since 1931 that GM has not led auto sales in the country. It also marked the first time that a non-domestic automaker has taken the top spot in US. While Toyota sold 2.332 million vehicles in US last year, GM sold 2.218 million vehicles.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Reliance Industries raises $4 billion in India's biggest forex bond deal
text: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries has raised $4 billion in US dollar bonds in India's largest-ever foreign currency bond deal. It raised $1.5 billion in a 10-year tranche, $1.75 billion in a 30-year tranche and $750 million in a 40-year deal. The deal eclipsed the record set by ONGC Videsh in 2014 when it raised $2.2 billion in US dollar bonds.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Maersk dethroned as world's largest shipping company by MSC
text: Danish carrier Maersk is no longer the world's largest shipping company and has been dethroned by Mediterranean Shipping Company (MSC) in terms of capacity. According to data compiled and published by Alphaliner on Wednesday, the Swiss-Italian international shipping line MSC has 4,284,728 standard 20-foot containers, 1,888 more than Maersk. However, both the companies have a 17% market share.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex plunges 800 points amid rising COVID-19 cases; Nifty around 17,700
text: The Indian benchmark indices fell on Thursday with the Sensex plunging more than 800 points. Sensex was trading around 59,400 levels at 10.30am, while the broader Nifty 50 slumped over 200 points to trade around the 17,700-mark. Bharti Airtel was among the gainers, while Sun Pharma and Dr Reddy's Labs were trading in red.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Berkshire Hathaway's stake in Apple hits record $162 bn in value
text: Billionaire Warren Buffett-led Berkshire Hathaway's stake in Apple hit record $162 billion in value on Monday after Apple became the world's first company to briefly breach market capitalisation of $3 trillion. Berkshire owns about 887 million shares of Apple, giving it a stake of 5.4% in the company, Insider reported. Last year, Buffett described Berkshire's Apple holding as "family jewel".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: NCLAT sets Twin Star's plan for Videocon aside, allows fresh bidding
text: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) on Wednesday set aside Twin Star Technologies' plan to buy Videocon Industries for ₹2,962 crore and allowed a fresh round of bidding for the company. While setting aside the plan, NCLAT said the plan had certain defects. Twin Star's plan to buy Videocon had earlier been approved by the National Company Law Tribunal.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: MSME credit guarantee scheme saved 13.5 lakh firms, 1.5 cr jobs: Report
text: The Emergency Credit Line Guarantee Scheme has saved 13.5 lakh MSME firms from going bankrupt and consequently 1.5 crore jobs, a report by SBI Research said. It added that MSME loan accounts worth ₹1.8 lakh crore were saved from becoming NPAs, equivalent to 14% of all outstanding MSME credit during pandemic. "The scheme saved approximately six crore families," it said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Delhi HC stays arbitration proceedings between Amazon, Future Group
text: A two-judge bench of the Delhi High Court today stayed arbitration proceedings between Future Group and Amazon in Singapore until further orders. Future Group had appealed a larger bench of the High Court after its plea was rejected by a single-judge bench of the HC. The appeal on merits will be heard in detail on February 1 by the HC.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Ford Motor's vehicle sales in US fall by 6.8% in 2021
text: Automobile manufacturer Ford Motor reported a 6.8% fall in 2021 US vehicle sales as the company faced issues like lingering supply-chain bottlenecks and a global chip shortage. Ford sold a total of 19,05,955 vehicles in 2021, ending up behind Toyota Motor and General Motors. Ford sold 27,140 units of Mustang Mach-E electric crossover in 2021.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Walmart to hire more than 3,000 US drivers for grocery deliveries
text: Walmart Inc plans to hire more than 3,000 US drivers and build out a fleet of all-electric delivery vans to support its home grocery delivery service, the company said on Tuesday. The retailer which now provides services to six million homes aims to reach 30 million homes by the end of 2022. The company currently has about 100 drivers.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: RBI cancels authorisation certificates of Muthoot Vehicle Finance, Eko India
text: Reserve Bank of India on Tuesday cancelled the Certificate of Authorisation (CoA) of two Payment System Operators (PSOs) - Muthoot Vehicle and Asset Finance and Eko India Financial Services. The CoA were cancelled citing non-compliance with regulatory requirements. "These companies cannot transact the business of issuance and operation of prepaid payment instruments," RBI said in a statement.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Adani wins key tender to supply overseas coal to NTPC: Reports
text: Adani Enterprises Ltd. has won a contract to supply overseas coal to NTPC, according to reports. The top power producer of India in October issued its first tender for coal imports in more than two years, the reports added. Adani will reportedly deliver one million tons of coal to NTPC, the reports further said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Bajaj Finance stock surges after company releases Q3 update
text: Shares of Bajaj Finance Ltd surged on Wednesday after the company reported a 26.3% jump in the assets under management in the third quarter of FY22. The company reported more than 2% jump during the early trade on the BSE. As per company's Q3 report, the assets rose to ₹1,81,300 crore from ₹1,43,550 crore recorded in the Q3 of FY21.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Tur dal imports at new high after govt eased restrictions
text: Tur dal, a key variety in pulses, saw record import this fiscal year after government eased restrictions on import of pulses. As per reports, more than five lakh tonne of Tur dal had been imported till December 31, 2021, and total imports are likely to cross 6.5 lakh tonne by March-end compared to 4.42 lakh tonne in 2020-21.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Darjeeling tea production hit record low in 2021
text: The production of Darjeeling tea declined to 6.19 million kg in 2021, which is the lowest production on record, according to the data provided by the Tea Board. As per tea industry sources, there has been a 50% drop compared with the region's average production capability. Climate change and COVID-19 pandemic are some of the reasons for low tea production.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: SEBI to hire agency to upgrade IT network, communication systems
text: Capital markets regulator SEBI is planning to hire an agency to upgrade and revamp its IT infrastructure network and communication systems as it has invited Expression of Interest (EoI) from solution providers for the same. "The proposed solution should be robust, secure, stable, efficient and easy to manage and should have latest collaborative features,'' said SEBI.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Omicron to hit India's FY22's Q4 GDP by 0.4%, overall GDP by 0.1%: Report
text: Omicron will impact India's GDP in the January-March quarter of FY22 by 0.4% and shave-off 0.1% from FY22's overall GDP growth, according to India Ratings and Research (IRR). In Q4 of FY22, India will register a GDP growth rate of 5.7% against earlier estimates of 6.1%, IRR said. For FY22 overall, GDP is now expected to clock 9.3% growth.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: FMCG distributors suspend boycott of HUL products in Maharashtra
text: FMCG distributors have suspended their boycott of certain Hindustan Unilever Limited (HUL) products in Maharashtra after a six member committee of AICPDF met with HUL's top executives. HUL assured that it will give serious consideration to protecting the interests of its distributors. "If HUL doesn't improve practices after three months, then we'll start the campaign again," the association said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India needs over 8% GDP growth to become $5 tn economy: Ex-SBI head
text: Former SBI Chairman Rajnish Kumar said that India needs to achieve a GDP growth rate of over 8% if it aims to become a $5 trillion economy by 2025. To achieve over 8% growth, India needs lower tax rates, ease of doing business and availability of land, said Rajnish. "We need private sector investment in a big way," he added.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Power CPSEs capex up by 47% to over ₹40,000 cr in April-December
text: Central Public Sector Enterprises (CPSEs) under the Ministry of Power have incurred capital expenditure of ₹40,395.34 crore during April-December 2021, which is 47% higher compared to the corresponding period of FY 2020-21. As per the government data, CPSEs have also collectively met 80% of the capex target of FY 2021-22 which stands at ₹50,690.52 crore.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Jet Airways' CEO Sudhir Gaur steps down ahead of relaunch
text: Jet Airways' CEO Sudhir Gaur stepped down from his position today ahead of the airline's relaunch. He will be replaced by former JetLite Senior VP (Operations) PP Singh. Jet Airways' owner, the Jalan Kalrock Consortium, had said in September that it will restart operations with a New Delhi to Mumbai flight and shift the airline's headquarters from Mumbai to Delhi-NCR.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: OPEC, allied countries decide to increase oil production
text: Members of Organisation of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and its allies (OPEC+) decided on Tuesday to pump more oil amid hopes that travel will not be disrupted despite the rapid spread of Omicron. The 23-member OPEC+ alliance decided to add 4,00,000 barrels of oil per day in February. OPEC+ aims to slowly restore output cuts made during the pandemic.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Apple briefly hits $3 trillion market value, becomes world's first company to do so
text: Apple on Monday briefly hit $3 trillion market value, becoming the world's first publicly-traded company to do so. The iPhone and Mac maker has reported strong earnings since the COVID-19 pandemic began as its products saw higher demand as more people worked from home. Apple's market value crossed the $1-trillion mark in August 2018 and $2-trillion mark in August 2020.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Elon Musk gets $33.8 billion richer on 1st trading day of 2022
text: World's richest person Elon Musk's net worth jumped by $33.8 billion on Monday, the first trading day of 2022, as Tesla's shares rallied. Musk's fortune rose to $304.2 billion, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Tesla's shares surged 13.5% after the company reported record deliveries for the fourth quarter of 2021, taking its market value back above $1 trillion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Musk's Starlink to refund pre-orders for internet services in India
text: Billionaire Elon Musk's Starlink has told customers in India that the government has asked it to refund all pre-orders for its internet services until it receives licences to operate in the country, reported Reuters. Starlink said, "You can receive a refund at any time." The company had received over 5,000 pre-orders and had collected $99 (about ₹7,400) from Indian customers.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Visa, Mastercard will be biggest business losers of 2022: Billionaire Chamath
text: Sri Lankan-born Canadian venture capitalist Chamath Palihapitiya in a podcast said, "My biggest business losers for 2022 are Visa and Mastercard and traditional payment rails and the entire ecosystem around it." The billionaire said these payments systems are a "completely contrived duopoly that doesn't need to exist". He added that these companies will lose out to Web3-based payment projects.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Apple hits $3 trillion m-cap milestone exactly 45 years after its formation
text: Apple on Monday became the world's first company to briefly hit $3 trillion in market capitalisation, exactly 45 years after the company was formed. Apple was incorporated on January 3, 1977, in Cupertino by Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak and Mike Markkula Jr as 'Apple Computer'. In January 2007, Jobs announced 'Apple Computer' is changing its name to 'Apple Inc'.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Tesla criticised for opening showroom in Xinjiang, where China is accused of genocide
text: Billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla has been criticised in the US after opening a showroom in Xinjiang, where China has been accused of genocide against Uighur Muslims. Tesla announced the showroom on its Weibo page on December 31. Alliance for American Manufacturing's President Scott Paul, said, "Any company doing business in Xinjiang is complicit in the cultural genocide taking place there."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Stanford dropout & Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes convicted of fraud in US
text: Blood-testing startup Theranos' Founder Elizabeth Holmes has been found guilty of four charges, including conspiracy to commit fraud against investors and three counts of wire fraud, in US. The 37-year-old could face up to 20 years in prison. Holmes dropped out of Stanford to start Theranos, which was valued at $9 billion before it collapsed in 2018 over fraud allegations.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Shopping on social media to hit $1.2 trillion globally by 2025: Accenture study
text: Shopping on social media platforms such as Facebook, TikTok and WeChat will hit $1.2 trillion worldwide by 2025, according to a study by Accenture. Shopping through social media platforms will grow three times faster than sales from traditional channels, the study predicted. The growth is predicted to be driven primarily by Gen Z and Millennial social media users.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: ACE Group, MD Ajay Chaudhary raided by income tax officials in Delhi, Noida: Reports
text: The I-T Department on Tuesday conducted raids at multiple premises of real estate company ACE Group and its MD Ajay Chaudhary, including in Delhi, Noida and Agra, reports said citing sources. Chaudhary is said to be close to a political leader of Uttar Pradesh, reports added. Last week, I-T officials raided perfume trader and Samajwadi Party MLC Pushpraj Jain's premises.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Who is Alka Mittal, first woman to head ONGC as Chairman & MD?
text: Dr Alka Mittal, who has become the first woman to lead Oil and Natural Gas Corporation as Chairman and MD, had joined ONGC as a graduate trainee in 1985. She was appointed as ONGC's Director (Human Resources) in 2018 and continues to hold this post. Mittal is a postgraduate in Economics, MBA (HRM) and Doctorate in Commerce and Business Studies.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: World's tallest building Burj Khalifa's developer Emaar to build mall in Srinagar
text: Dubai's Emaar Properties, the master developer of the world's tallest building Burj Khalifa, has said that it will develop a 5,00,000 square feet shopping mall in Jammu & Kashmir's Srinagar. An MoU has been signed between the governments of Dubai and J&K to facilitate investments. Emaar is also considering other investments into real estate, hospitality and other projects in J&K.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: SBI, HDFC Bank in RBI's 2021 list of 'Domestic Systemically Important Banks'
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Tuesday said that SBI, ICICI Bank and HDFC Bank continue to be identified as 'Domestic Systemically Important Banks' (D-SIBs). According to the RBI, SIBs are banks that are 'too big to fail' and are, therefore, subjected to additional policy measures to deal with the systemic risks and moral hazard issues posed by them.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: iPhone maker Foxconn's TN plant unlikely to reopen until Jan 7: Report
text: Foxconn is unlikely to reopen its Tamil Nadu facility, which makes Apple's iPhones, until January 7, Reuters reported. The plant was closed on December 18 following protests after more than 250 of its workers were treated for food poisoning. Last week, Apple placed the plant on probation after finding that some worker dormitories and dining rooms didn't meet required standards.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: State Bank of India invests $20 million in Pine Labs
text: Merchant commerce platform Pine Labs on Tuesday announced that the State Bank of India (SBI) has invested $20 million in the startup. Pine Labs had raised $700 million in funding across two rounds last year. "We are thrilled to have the largest bank of India, the State Bank of India, place their trust in us," its CEO Amrish Rau said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Future Group's pleas to end arbitration with Amazon dismissed by HC
text: Delhi High Court has dismissed petitions filed by Future Group companies seeking to quash the arbitration proceedings initiated by Amazon in Singapore. Future Group had asked the court to end proceedings citing a CCI order passed in December, suspending a 2019 deal between Amazon and Future Coupons. Justice Amit Bansal said the filings were dismissed, without giving any further details.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: BMW India sells 8,876 cars in 2021, sales surge by 34%
text: BMW India reported a year-on-year (YoY) growth of 34% with a dispatch of 8,876 units in 2021, recording the highest growth in a decade in India. The automaker dispatched 8,236 BMW and 640 Mini units last year compared to 6,604 units across BMW and Mini brands in 2020. The company generated over 40% sales from its locally assembled SAV range.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: iD Fresh Food raises ₹507 crore from NewQuest, Premji Invest
text: Bengaluru-based iD Fresh Food has raised ₹507 crore in funding led by NewQuest Capital Partners, along with existing investor Premji Invest. Helion Ventures, who had invested in the startup in 2014, exited the company in the current round with 10X return on the investment. The fresh food startup was founded by PC Musthafa, Abdul Nazer and their cousins in 2005.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's exports hit record $299.74 bn in first 9 months of 2021-22
text: India's exports hit a historic high at $299.74 billion in the first nine months of FY 2021-22, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said. The country also recorded highest-ever monthly figure in December as exports surged to $37 billion, 37% higher than the previous year. Meanwhile, the highest quarterly figure of $103 billion exports was recorded in the October-December period, Goyal added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Subramanian Swamy seeks cancellation of Air India disinvestment
text: BJP Rajya Sabha MP Subramanian Swamy has moved the Delhi High Court seeking to quash the Air India disinvestment process. Swamy also sought directions to the CBI to investigate role and functioning of respondent authorities and submit a detailed report to the Court. Tata Sons won the bid for acquiring Air India for ₹18,000 crore on October 8 last year.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Colgate India in talks with sales agents after disruption threats
text: Colgate-Palmolive India said that it is holding talks with sales agents after the latter threatened to disrupt supplies in Maharashtra. The threat came after 'kirana' stores in India partnered with Reliance Industries to secure lower prices of Colgate's products. This led to drop in sales of companies like Unilever, forcing agents to ask for same price deals as corporate distributors.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: No extraordinary increase in trade with China in 2021: Piyush Goyal
text: Union Minister Piyush Goyal has said there was no extraordinary increase in trade with China in 2021. Trade deficit with China has come down to $44 billion in 2021 from $48 billion in 2014-15, he added. This comes after Congress alleged that government was continuing its $100-billion trade with China even as it tried to rename places in Arunachal Pradesh.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: LIC to file IPO papers by 3rd week of January: Report
text: Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) is likely to file the draft papers for its IPO with market regulator SEBI by the third week of January, TOI reported. Earlier, government officials said that the listing would be completed before the end of FY22. LIC IPO size is likely to be around ₹1 lakh crore, making it India's biggest ever public issue.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Central Railway crosses 7MT freight loading in a month for 1st time
text: The Central Railway zone crossed seven million tonnes (MT) freight loading in a month, surpassing the previous record of 6.96 MT. The freight loading of Central Railway in December 2021 was 7.21 MT as against 5.87 MT in December 2020. During April-December 2021, its freight loading was 55.06 MT, which is the highest ever during any April-December period.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Omicron will be short-term disruption for businesses: Piyush Goyal
text: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal said on Monday that the Omicron variant will cause a short-term disruption for businesses. He added that supply chains and industrial activities will continue in full swing. He said this while announcing that India achieved the highest-ever monthly exports worth $37 billion in December 2021, a year-on-year increase of 37%.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Hyderabad-based e-bus maker Olectra's shares surge 540% in a year
text: Shares of Olectra Greentech, India's largest electric bus maker, surged 540% in the last 12 months. The company also recently announced setting up a 150-acre manufacturing unit on the outskirts of Hyderabad. Olectra Chairman KV Pradeep said that the company now wishes to venture into the electric truck market after it announced partnership with a truck maker.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Airtel withdraws corporate restructuring plan announced last year
text: Bharti Airtel has withdrawn its corporate restructuring plan announced in April 2021, saying that its corporate setup will be optimal for implementing telecom sector reforms announced by the government. "[We] are well positioned to invest aggressively in emerging growth opportunities," the company said in a statement on Tuesday. It also plans to achieve vision of converged services to customers.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: BSE receives 362 investor complaints in Dec, fixes 473 grievances
text: Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) said that it received 362 investor complaints against 207 companies pertaining to non-receipt of shares and debt securities in December 2021. During that period, the BSE resolved 473 grievances against 262 listed companies. BSE said that resolved grievances include those brought forward from the previous period. 14 of the 362 complaints were against suspended companies.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Omicron isn't last variant, we need to brace for many variants: Biocon's Shaw
text: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar Shaw told CNBC TV18 that Omicron is not the last variant of COVID-19 and "we need to brace up for many, many variants". She added, "Every pandemic will become endemic at some stage and I think we are veering towards that." She added that India is more prepared this time as more people are vaccinated.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: RBI releases framework for small value digital payments without internet
text: The RBI released a framework for small value offline digital payments that don't require internet or telecom connectivity. Such payments can be carried out face-to-face using instruments like cards, wallets or mobile devices. Transactions are subject to a limit of ₹200 per transaction and an overall limit of ₹2,000 for all transactions until the balance in the account is replenished.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: India's unemployment rate hits four-month high of 7.9% in December: CMIE
text: India's unemployment rate hit a four-month high in December, data from Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy (CMIE) showed. The unemployment rate rose to 7.9% in December from 7.0% in November, its highest since 8.3% in August. Urban unemployment rate rose to 9.3% in December from 8.2% in November while rural unemployment rate was up 7.3% from 6.4%, the data showed.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Sri Lanka could go bankrupt in 2022 due to COVID-19 crisis: Report
text: Sri Lanka is facing a deepening financial and humanitarian crisis due to COVID-19 and it could go bankrupt in 2022, The Guardian reported. It needs to repay an estimated $7.3 billion in domestic and foreign loans in the next 12 months. The World Bank estimates that 5,00,000 Sri Lankans have fallen below the poverty line since the beginning of COVID-19.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex surges 929 points on first trading day of 2022, Nifty ends above 17,600
text: The benchmark indices ended the first day of trading of the new year 2022 with the most gains in more than three weeks. The BSE Sensex ended 929 points higher at 59,183 and the Nifty surged 271 points to close at 17,625 on Monday. All the sectoral indices, barring pharma, closed in the green.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: H&M temporarily shuts NY store after employee shares pics of bugs crawling on clothes
text: H&M temporarily shut a New York store after an employee who worked at the store shared pictures of bugs crawling on hoodies on Twitter. She had tweeted, "A customer discovered lice on a rack of hoodies...The section was just blocked off." After her tweet went viral, she tweeted, "I was annoyed that it was being treated like a minor issue."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Alka Mittal becomes first woman to head ONGC as its Chairman and MD
text: Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (ONGC) on Monday announced that its Director (Human Resources) Dr Alka Mittal has been entrusted with additional charge of Chairman and Managing Director (CMD). She has become the first woman to head the energy major, it added. The state-run company had been functioning without a CMD since the retirement of its former chief Subhash Kumar.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: HC reserves order on Future Group's plea to end arbitration with Amazon
text: The Delhi High Court on Monday reserved its order on Future Group's plea seeking termination of the ongoing arbitration proceedings with Amazon. Future Group cited CCI order passed in December suspending its approval for a 2019 deal between Amazon and Future Coupons. The court said that it will pronounce its order on the plea at 4.30 pm on January 4.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Morgan Stanley to pay $60 mn to settle suit alleging it exposed users' data
text: Morgan Stanley has agreed to pay $60 million to settle a data security lawsuit by customers. The class action suit alleges that the bank exposed customers' personal data when it twice failed to properly retire some of its older information technology. As per the settlement, customers can apply for reimbursement of up to $10,000 each in out-of-pocket losses.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ₹70 cr tax evasion detected after raids on crypto exchanges: Report
text: The Directorate General of GST Intelligence (DGGI) has detected tax evasions worth ₹70 crore after its officials searched half a dozen offices of cryptocurrency service providers, ANI reported citing official sources. "These service providers were charging a commission for their facilitation to indulge in exchange of Bitcoins but were not paying GST tax," an official source was quoted as saying.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla delivers record 308,600 cars worldwide in 4th quarter of 2021
text: Tesla on Sunday said it delivered 308,000 electric cars worldwide in the fourth quarter of 2021, beating its previous single-quarter record. Tesla's total sales for the year stood at more than 936,000, up about 87% over 2020's deliveries of just under half a million vehicles. Notably, Tesla joined the exclusive club of companies with $1 trillion market value in 2021.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Declare arbitration with Amazon illegal: Future Retail to Delhi HC
text: Future Retail has asked Delhi High Court to declare arbitration proceedings in Singapore with Amazon as illegal. It has argued that since the 2019 deal with Amazon no longer has CCI's approval, it has "no legal existence" in India and Amazon can no longer assert its rights. "Continuation of the entire arbitration proceedings is a perpetuation of illegality," it added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla shares surge 10% after it reports record deliveries for Q4
text: World's most valuable carmaker Tesla's shares surged 10% on Monday after the company reported record deliveries for the fourth quarter of 2021. Tesla delivered 308,600 cars in the fourth quarter, topping its previous record of 241,300 cars from the prior quarter. "This is a trophy-case quarter for Tesla as it blew away...bull-case expectations," said Daniel Ives, an analyst at Wedbush.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Negative YoY growth in credit to MSMEs for third straight month: RBI
text: Data released by the Reserve Bank of India showed that year-on-year (YoY) growth in credit to MSMEs remained negative for the third straight month in November 2021. Credit to MSMEs stood at ₹10.99 lakh crore in November 2021, down 2.2% from ₹11.23 lakh crore in November 2020. YoY credit growth to MSMEs was -0.5% in October and -2.6% in September.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: OYO, Delhivery, 21 other firms to raise ₹44,000 cr via IPOs in Jan-Mar
text: Nearly two dozen companies are looking to collectively raise about ₹44,000 crore through initial public offerings (IPOs) between January and March 2022, as per investment bankers. OYO, Delhivery, Adani Wilmar, Emcure Pharmaceuticals, ixigo, Medanta are among the companies expected to raise funds during this period. A large chunk of total fundraising is poised to be garnered by tech-driven firms.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Roll out draft e-commerce rules without dilution: CAIT to Goyal
text: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) asked Union Consumer Affairs Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday to roll-out the draft e-commerce rules without any dilution. "Any dilution in the rules...will percolate a strong feeling that the government has succumbed to some hidden pressures," CAIT said. The draft e-commerce rules intend on tightening the watch on e-commerce companies.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Tata Motors overtakes Hyundai as 2nd largest PV seller in Dec 2021
text: Tata Motors has overtaken Hyundai Motor India to become the second largest seller of passenger vehicles (PVs) in the domestic market for the first time in close to a decade in December 2021. Tata Motors registered sales of 35,299 PV units in December 2021, whereas Hyundai dispatched 32,312 units. Tata Motors said it dispatched close to 99,000 vehicles between October-December.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India seeks emergency WTO meeting to discuss COVID-19 package: Official
text: India has sought an emergency meeting at the World Trade Organisation's (WTO) General Council this month to discuss WTO's proposed COVID-19 response package, an official said. The package includes a Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights (TRIPS) waiver proposal to deal with the pandemic. The waiver proposal was first submitted by India and South Africa in October 2020.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Jet fuel price hiked by 2.75% to over ₹76,000/kilolitre
text: Prices of aviation turbine fuel (ATF), or jet fuel, have increased by ₹2,039.63, or 2.75%, to ₹76,062.04 per kilolitre in New Delhi, according to a price notification of state-owned fuel retailers. The increase in rate comes on the back of two consecutive price cuts in the month of December 2021 that reflected a drop in international jet fuel prices.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India appeals against WTO panel ruling on sugar export subsidies: Official
text: India has appealed against the ruling of World Trade Organisation's (WTO) trade dispute settlement panel which said that India's support measures for sugar and sugarcane are inconsistent with global trade norms, an official said. On December 14, 2021, the panel recommended India to withdraw alleged prohibited subsidies within 120 days. India stated that the findings are completely "unacceptable".
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Reliance Industries to raise $5 billion to pay-off existing borrowings
text: Reliance Industries Ltd said that it will raise $5 billion in foreign currency-denominated bonds to pay-off existing borrowings of the company. The company said in an exchange filing that its Finance Committee approved the proposal for issuance of US Dollar-denominated fixed-rate notes on Saturday. The bond sale is poised to become the single largest such borrowing by an Indian company.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Vinod Kannan takes over as CEO of Vistara
text: Vistara has announced that Vinod Kannan took over as the Chief Executive Officer (CEO) of the airline on Saturday. "Kannan started his stint with Vistara as the Chief Strategy Officer in June 2019 and took over as Chief Commercial Officer in January 2020," the company said. Kannan replaced Leslie Thng who was the CEO from July 2017 to December 2021.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India on track to achieve export target of $400 billion: Piyush Goyal
text: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal announced on Monday that India has achieved the highest ever monthly exports of $37 billion in December 2021, a 37% year-on-year increase. He added that it is clear that India is well on its way to achieving an export target of $400 billion. "It is a time for Indians to feel proud," Goyal said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Goldman Sachs asks employees in US to work from home: Report
text: Goldman Sachs is asking employees in US to work from home if they can until January 18, Bloomberg reported citing an internal memo. The decision comes amid a rapid surge of COVID-19 cases in US. The bank told its employees last week that anyone entering its offices must get a booster shot of vaccine by February 1, if they're eligible.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Interest rates on small savings schemes unchanged for Q4 of FY 2021-22
text: The Centre has kept interest rates on small savings schemes unchanged for Q4 of financial year (FY) 2021-22, according to a report by PTI. Public Provident Fund and National Savings Certificate will continue to carry an annual interest rate of 7.1% and 6.8% respectively. The decision comes amid elevated inflation rates and increasing cases of Omicron in India.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Will take strict steps: AICPDF to Colgate over price disparity issue
text: FMCG distributors have warned Colgate-Palmolive India of taking strict steps after it failed to respond to the issue of price disparity of products between traditional and B2B distributors. Citing Colgate's "obstinate attitude", AICPDF said no distributors in Maharashtra will sell Colgate's Max Fresh brand in the state. The company said it is looking to address the challenges of its distributors.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RBL Bank sees over 11% drop in retail, small business deposits in Oct-Dec
text: RBL Bank witnessed a quarter-on-quarter (QoQ) drop of 11.3% in retail and small business deposits in the October-December quarter. Retail and small business deposits fell to ₹27,871 crore over the quarter. Total deposits in the quarter also fell 2.58% QoQ to ₹73,637 crore. This comes after the bank's MD and CEO Vishwavir Ahuja exited abruptly, reportedly making depositors nervous.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: World's 2nd richest person Jeff Bezos rings in New Year with a disco party
text: Amazon Founder and the world's second-richest person, Jeff Bezos, celebrated New Year with a disco-themed party with his girlfriend Lauren Sanchez and his family members. He wrote on Instagram, "New year is a great time to take stock and focus on personal growth, renewal, rebirth, and paying careful attention to each moment of your life." He added, "Celebrate and grow."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: CCI orders probe into Apple's business practices in India
text: The Competition Commission of India ordered a detailed probe against Apple for alleged unfair business practices in India with respect to its App Store. The watchdog said that Apple's App Store is the only channel for app developers to distribute their apps to iOS consumers. This prima facie results in denial of market access for potential app distributors, CCI stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Crypto exchange WazirX dodged ₹40.5 crore in tax, ₹49 crore recovered: GST dept
text: Goods and Services Tax department has said that it detected GST evasion of ₹40.5 crore on commission earned by crypto exchange WazirX. "Recovered ₹49.2 crore in cash as GST, interest & penalty...from Zanmai Labs Pvt. Ltd," it tweeted. The indirect tax department reportedly said WazirX issued its own cryptocurrency, WRX coins, through Zanmai Labs but didn't pay GST on it.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Apple, Amazon, 3 other tech giants gain $2.5 trillion in market cap in 2021
text: Five of the US market's technology giants - Apple, Microsoft, Google parent Alphabet, Amazon and Facebook parent Meta Platforms - added $2.5 trillion to their market value in 2021. Shares of Google's parent company surged 65% in the year, while that of Microsoft surged 51%. Shares of iPhone maker rose 34%, taking its market capitalisation to nearly $3 trillion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India sees record ₹8.26 lakh crore UPI transactions in December
text: India saw value of UPI transactions in December rise to a record high of ₹8.26 lakh crore, NPCI data showed. The month also saw the volume of transactions jump to record high at 456 crore. For the year, UPI saw 3,874 crore transactions, up 105% from 2020. The value of these transactions rose by over 130% at ₹71.46 lakh crore.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Xiaomi, Oppo could face ₹1,000 crore fine for violating income tax law: Reports
text: The I-T Department carried out raids across premises of two foreign-controlled mobile phone manufacturers and said they may face fines of over ₹1,000 crore. Reports claimed the two firms are Xiaomi and Oppo. Tax officials found that they didn't comply with certain rules under the Income-tax Act, 1961 and also may have understated taxable profit by over ₹1,400 crore.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: After WazirX, GST officials reportedly search offices of crypto service providers
text: The Directorate General of GST Intelligence officials searched the offices of several cryptocurrency service providers across India on Saturday, ANI reported citing sources. This comes after the GST department detected GST evasion of ₹40.5 crore on commission earned by crypto exchange WazirX. It recovered ₹49.2 crore in cash as GST, interest & penalty from Zanmai Labs, which operates the exchange.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: GST revenue collection rises 13% in December to ₹1.29 lakh crore
text: The goods and services tax (GST) revenue collected in December 2021 saw a 13% rise year-on-year at ₹1.29 lakh crore, the finance ministry revealed. Out of the total revenue, ₹22,578 crore is CGST and ₹28,658 crore is SGST. December is the sixth month in a row when revenue from goods sold and services rendered stood at over ₹1 lakh crore.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Serum Institute applies for Covishield's full market authorisation in India
text: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla has said they have applied for full market authorisation of Covishield in India. "Supplies of the Covishield vaccine in India, have exceeded 1.25 billion doses. The government of India now has enough data for full market authorisation," he said. Serum Institute got approval for Covishield's emergency use at the beginning of the year.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Highway to hopeful future: Mahindra on pics of completed parts of Delhi-Mumbai highway
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra reacted to the pictures of completed sections of Delhi-Mumbai highway and tweeted, "It's an image that made me imagine a Highway into a more Hopeful future." "So glad to see this image on the first day of the New Year...When it's completed, I hope to be one of the first cruising on it," he added.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: How to e-verify income tax return using Aadhaar OTP?
text: To e-verify income tax return (ITR) using Aadhaar OTP, one has to select e-Verify Return option on the income tax portal, select the option to verify using OTP on mobile number registered with Aadhaar and click on continue. Select the option to agree to validate Aadhaar details and generate Aadhaar OTP. Click 'Validate' option after entering the 6-digit OTP.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: LPG cylinder for commercial use becomes cheaper by ₹102.50 from today
text: The price of commercial LPG cylinders have been slashed by ₹102.50 with effect from today. A 19-kg commercial cylinder will now cost ₹1,998.50 in Delhi, ₹1,948.5 in Mumbai, ₹2,076 in Kolkata and ₹2,131 in Chennai. In December, the price for commercial cylinders was increased by ₹100. Oil marketing companies did not cut prices of 14-kg domestic cylinder on January 1.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: No property tax on residential properties up to 500 sq ft in Mumbai: Maha CM
text: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray has announced complete waiver of property tax on residential units of up to 500 square feet in Mumbai. "I promise Mumbaikars that we are able to take care of your health and well-being, just continue to give us your blessings," Thackeray said while announcing the decision, ahead of Mumbai municipal corporation elections due next month.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Revoking FCRA licence will affect humanitarian work during COVID: Oxfam India
text: A day after Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA) refused to renew the registration of Oxfam India under Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act, the organisation said the action would "severely affect" its humanitarian work, including COVID-19 relief work, in 16 states. The licence is needed to receive funding from abroad. "We'll urge the MHA to lift the funding restrictions," Oxfam India stated.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Income tax return filing deadline won't be extended beyond today: Govt
text: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj on Friday said that there's no proposal to extend the deadline for income tax (I-T) return filing for the Assessment Year (AY) 2021-22 beyond December 31, 2021. "Income tax return filing is going on smoothly. By 3pm today, 5.62 crore returns have been filed in total," he added. Over 20 lakh returns filed today, he added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Future Retail misses due date for payment of ₹3,500 crore to banks
text: Kishore Biyani-led Future Retail, which runs the Big Bazaar chain of stores, missed the due date of December 31, 2021, to pay ₹3,494.56 crore to various consortium banks and lenders. The company said it missed the due date "due to ongoing litigation with Amazon". Future Retail would be co-operating with banks and lenders for payment in the next 30 days.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Couldn't find a compelling candy: Musk on not starting candy firm to challenge Buffett
text: World's richest person Elon Musk told Babylon Bee he actually explored creating a candy company but couldn't find a "compelling candy that'd be better" than others. "If a company doesn't provide great products...it shouldn't exist," he said. In 2018, Musk said he's starting a candy company after Warren Buffett said Musk couldn't compete with Berkshire Hathaway-owned candy business, See's Candies.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Over $1 trillion added to net worths of world's 500 richest people in 2021
text: The collective fortune of world's 500 richest people surged by over $1 trillion in 2021 despite the COVID-19 pandemic, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. At least 10 people now have fortunes worth over $100 billion, while over 200 have fortunes worth over $10 billion. Tesla CEO Elon Musk is the world's richest person with over $270 billion net worth.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Harsh Goenka's RPG Group goes back to work from home, closes workplaces
text: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka wrote on Twitter that his company has gone back to work from home and closed its workplaces with effect from Friday. The decision was taken in view of the rise in COVID-19 cases across India. "I hope other organisations also follow suit and try to break the chain," Goenka added in the tweet.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Favourite pic of the year: Mahindra on pic of boy studying on hand cart as man pushes it
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra has shared a picture of a small schoolboy studying while sitting on a hand cart as a man pushes it. "And here's my favourite photo of the year. Apologies, I don't know who took it so cannot acknowledge the photographer...Hope, Hard Work, Optimism. The essence of why we live," he tweeted.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Japanese firms to help Gates' firm build US nuclear reactor: Report
text: The Japan Atomic Energy Agency and Mitsubishi Heavy Industries will be helping the US and Bill Gates' venture company TerraPower to build a high-tech nuclear reactor in Wyoming, US, Reuters reported citing the daily Yomiuri. The parties will sign an agreement as early as January. JAEA and Mitsubishi will provide technical support and data from Japan's own advanced reactors.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: China warns Walmart over non-availability of Xinjiang items on app
text: China has issued a warning to Walmart over alleged removal of Xinjiang products on its members-only grocery chain Sam's Club app. "Walmart must respect China's standpoint and the Chinese people's feelings if they want to 'stand firm' in the Chinese market," the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection said. Chinese users had posted screenshots of no search results for Xinjiang items.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Foreign carmakers interested in India's Ford plant: Tamil Nadu Minister
text: Foreign carmakers have shown interest in acquiring Ford Motor Co's plant in Tamil Nadu, state Industries Minister Thangam Thenarasu said. He added that details of firms interested cannot be disclosed and "it is eventually up to Ford as it'll be a commercial arrangement". Tata Group also showed interest but the government is yet to hear from them, he said further.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Over 5.78 crore income tax returns filed for AY 2021-22: I-T Dept
text: More than 5.78 crore income tax returns for Assessment Year (AY) 2021-22 were filed till 7pm on Friday, including 35.74 lakh filed on December 31 alone, the Income Tax Department said. The returns filed for AY 2021-22 were lesser than 5.95 crore returns filed for AY 2020-21. The last date for filing the returns was December 31, 2021.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Global M&A volumes breach $5 trillion-mark for 1st time in 2021
text: Global merger and acquisition (M&A) volumes crossed $5 trillion in 2021 for the first time ever, surpassing the previous record of $4.55 trillion set in 2007, Dealogic data showed. According to Refinitiv, the overall M&A value stood at $5.8 trillion, which is up by 64% compared to the previous year. There were a total of 62,193 deals made in 2021.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Tech Mahindra to buy Allyis India, Green Investments for $125 million
text: IT services major Tech Mahindra has approved a proposal to acquire 100% stake in Allyis India and Green Investments, a holding company for US-based Allyis Group. The company said it will pay a total consideration of up to $125 million (over ₹900 crore). The acquisition will help bolster business in areas such as cloud and automation engineering, it added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Eight core sectors' output rises by 3.1% in November
text: The output of eight core sectors including coal, crude oil, natural gas, refinery products, fertilisers, steel, cement and electricity grew by 3.1% in November 2021, as per data released by the Ministry of Commerce. The output for these core sectors had grown by 7.5% in October and the growth rate during the April-November period of 2021-22 stood at 13.7%.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Report on $42-billion deal to buy Alzheimer's drug maker Biogen untrue: Samsung
text: Samsung Group's biotech unit Samsung BioLogics said that the report which claimed it was in talks to buy US drugmaker Biogen in a $42-billion deal was "not true". Shares of Biogen, which makes drugs for neurological conditions like Alzheimer's, had surged 9.5% after the report. The deal would have been the biggest overseas acquisition ever by a South Korean company.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: How much wealth did world's 10 richest people add to their fortunes in 2021?
text: As per Bloomberg, world's richest person Elon Musk added $121 billion to his net worth, as of December 29, 2021. Jeff Bezos, the second richest, added $5 billion to his wealth, LVMH CEO Bernard Arnault added $61 billion and Bill Gates added $7 billion. Google Co-founder Larry Page's wealth rose $47 billion and Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg's by $24 billion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 3rd largest crypto Binance Coin gains 1,300% in 2021, outperforms Bitcoin, Ether
text: Binance Coin, the world's third largest cryptocurrency, has outperformed its two larger rivals Bitcoin and Ether this year. The coin by cryptocurrency exchange Binance gained around 1,300% in 2021 as compared to Bitcoin's gain of 65% and Ether's gain of 408%, as per Arcane Research. "We've seen a constant stream of capital trickling down into altcoins," the report said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: It's very worrying: Zoho CEO on record 40+ unicorns created in India in 2021
text: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu said that "anyone who has studied the history of investment bubbles" should find India's unicorn trend "very worrying". He was responding to a report that said, "43 unicorns in 2021 are more than the 30 unicorns created in the entire history of Indian startup scene." Vembu also shared a book "to read to prepare ahead".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Next recession may be in spring 2022, but not later than 2023: Elon Musk
text: World's richest person Elon Musk on Friday said on Twitter that the next recession may be "around spring or summer 2022, but not later than 2023". In an earlier tweet he wrote, "If history's any guide, many [unicorns] may not make it past the next recession." His comment came after a  tech columnist said the world has 936 unicorns.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Try to be useful: World's richest person Elon Musk to young people
text: Tesla CEO and the world's richest person Elon Musk, who appeared on the Lex Fridman Podcast, advised the young people to "try to be useful". He added, "Do things that are useful to your fellow human beings, to the world...It's hard to be useful." Musk also said, "If you're living a useful life, it's a life worth having lived."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Nick Szabo may be behind idea of Bitcoin, don't know real creator: Musk
text: World's richest person Elon Musk in a podcast discussing the identity of Bitcoin creator Satoshi Nakamoto said computer scientist Nick Szabo is "probably, more than anyone else, responsible for the evolution of those ideas". "He claims not to be Nakamoto, but I'm not sure that's neither here nor there," Musk added. However, he said he doesn't know the creator's identity.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Tesla recalls over 4,75,000 cars in US over risk of accidents
text: Elon Musk-led Tesla has recalled over 4,75,000 cars in the US to address rearview camera and trunk issues that increase the risk of crashing. Tesla is recalling 3,56,309 Model 3 cars made between 2017-2020 and 1,19,009 Model S cars assembled from 2014. Tesla is not aware of any crashes, injuries or deaths related to the issues with the cars.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: It wasn't in offer letter: DoorDash engineer making $400,000 on delivering food
text: An engineer working for America's food delivery platform DoorDash opposed the company requiring every employee to deliver food at least once a month from January. The engineer who reported earning $400,000 a year, wrote, "I didn't sign up for this, there was nothing in the offer letter/job description about this." The employee claimed DoorDash will track deliveries for performance reviews.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Carmaker Citroën accused of normalising sexual harassment in Egypt ad, pulls it down
text: French carmaker Citroën has withdrawn a commercial in Egypt and apologised for it after social media users accused it of normalising sexual harassment. The video showed 60-year-old singer Amr Diab using his car's camera to photograph a woman crossing the road without her consent. Women's rights activist Reem Abdellatif referred to it as "creepy" and said, "You're enabling sexual harassment."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Hardeep Puri shares pictures of women workers in oil rigs, calls them 'super women'
text: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Thursday lauded the contribution of women workers at the Oil and Natural Gas Corporation. Sharing pictures of them, he wrote, "The Super Women who 'woman' our oil and gas installations!" "They didn't back down from staying 60-70 days at a stretch on offshore platforms during the pandemic. They're...equal partners in India's progress," he added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Due date to file returns is Dec 31, 2021: I-T Dept amid calls to extend deadline
text: The Income Tax Department on Thursday urged the people to file their income tax returns for the Assessment Year 2021-22 and tweeted, "The due date is December 31, 2021." The department's tweet came as several people on social media requested an extension in the deadline citing glitches on the portal. "24.39 lakh ITRs filed today itself," the department tweeted.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: GST hike on textiles from 5% to 12% deferred by GST Council
text: The GST Council has deferred the decision to hike GST on textiles from 5% to 12%. The hike was to come into effect from January 1, 2022. "The Council will review this matter in its next meeting in February 2022," Himachal Pradesh Industry Minister Bikram Singh said. Several states including Gujarat and Rajasthan were not in favour of the hike.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: After Piyush Jain, Samajwadi Party perfume trader Pushpraj Jain raided by tax officials
text: Samajwadi Party on Friday said that Income Tax authorities are raiding its party MLC Pushpraj 'Pampi' Jain's premises in Uttar Pradesh's Kannauj. This comes days after over ₹200-crore cash was seized from Kanpur-based businessman Piyush Jain. Pushpraj Jain is the perfume trader who launched Samajwadi Party's perfume ahead of the UP elections. Earlier reports linked Piyush Jain to SP's perfume.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Reliance Industries' solar unit to buy UK's Faradion in ₹1,000-crore deal
text: Reliance New Energy Solar Ltd (RNESL), a wholly-owned subsidiary of Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries, has signed an agreement to acquire 100% stake in UK's sodium ion battery firm Faradion. As per filings, RNESL will buy equity shares of Faradion through secondary transactions for a total value of £94.42 million based on an enterprise value of £100 million (over ₹1,000 crore).
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: RBI extends deadline for periodic KYC update till March 31, 2022
text: The RBI on Thursday extended the deadline for periodic KYC update from December 31, 2021, to March 31, 2022. The relaxation was provided "in view of the prevalent uncertainty due to the new variant of COVID-19". Regulated Entities have to carry out periodic updation of KYC of existing customers and accounts failing to comply are subject to restrictions on operations.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Bank accidentally sends ₹1,300 crore to 75,000 accounts in UK on Christmas
text: Spanish-owned bank Santander accidentally transferred £130 million (over ₹1,300 crore) to 75,000 accounts in the UK on Christmas Day. "We're sorry that due to a technical issue, some payments from our corporate clients were incorrectly duplicated on the recipients' accounts," Santander said. It is struggling to recover the money as most of it was deposited in accounts at rival banks.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Alibaba in talks to sell Weibo stake to China-owned firm: Report
text: Alibaba Group is in talks with state-owned Shanghai Media Group about a deal involving the sale of its stake in Weibo, Bloomberg reported. Alibaba is exploring options for its roughly 30% stake in the social-media platform. The discussions between Alibaba and Shanghai Media are at an early stage and there is reportedly no certainty they will result in a transaction.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: China Evergrande's EV unit starts 1st mass production: Report
text: China Evergrande New Energy Vehicle Group started its first mass production on Thursday, Reuters reported citing sources. The mass production of its inaugural Hengchi 5 sport-utility vehicles at its Tianjin production facilities came 12 days ahead of schedule. Earlier in November, the unit had said it's negotiating with potential buyers regarding the disposal of some assets.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: FM holds pre-budget meet, Chhattisgarh demands GST compensation
text: At the pre-Budget meeting convened by Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel demanded GST compensation and reimbursement of expenditure of ₹15,000 crore made by the state for Naxal eradication. "The state's economy has been impacted due to [the] COVID-19 pandemic," Baghel said during the meeting. State finance ministers were also present at the meeting.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ED summons Amazon India VP in forex norms violation case: Report
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) issued summons to Amazon India Vice President Manish Tiwary for alleged forex norms violation by the company, Economic Times reported. ED is investigating alleged violation of Foreign Exchange Management Act when Amazon bought a 49% stake in Future Coupons for ₹1,431 crore in 2019. Amazon had recently moved the Delhi HC seeking relief from the probe.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: BMW plans to create up to 6,000 new jobs in 2022
text: German automaker BMW plans to create up to 6,000 new jobs next year to prepare for growing demand for electric vehicles, CEO Oliver Zipse said. BMW is on a "very good path through the transformation" and has its plants prepared for e-mobility, he added. BMW is aiming for at least 50% of global sales to be fully electric by 2030.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: States demand rollback of hiked GST on textiles, footwear
text: Several states including Telangana, Rajasthan, Kerala and Punjab have demanded the proposed hike in GST rates on textiles and footwear from 5% to 12% be rolled back. Finance ministers of various states voiced their concerns at the pre-Budget consultation held today. Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia said the hike is not good for the industry and must be rolled back.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: CMS Info Systems shares debut at 2% premium in last listing of 2021
text: Shares of cash management company CMS Info Systems listed at a 2% premium over its IPO price of ₹216 per share on Friday. The stock started trading at ₹218.50 on the BSE and at ₹220.20 on the NSE. CMS Info Systems' stock is the last listing of 2021. Its ₹1,100-crore IPO had seen a 1.95 times subscription during December 21-23.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: SBI acquires 9.95% stake in lndia lnternational Exchange (IFSC)
text: State Bank of India (SBI) today announced the acquisition of a 9.95% stake in India International Exchange (IFSC). In a regulatory filing, SBI said the 9.95% stake in IIE (IFSC) is "to be acquired subject to a maximum investment of ₹34.03 crore". IFSC is the first exchange to be set up at the Gujarat International Fin Tec-City.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: RBI approves Rajeev Ahuja's appointment as interim CEO of RBL Bank
text: The RBI has given approval for the appointment of Rajeev Ahuja as RBL Bank's interim MD and CEO for three months with effect from December 25, 2021 or till the appointment of a regular CEO. Rajeev was appointed as the interim CEO by the board after Vishwavir Ahuja, who led the bank since 2010, went on leave abruptly.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Kalpataru Power shares jump 6% as it bags orders worth ₹1,560 crore
text: The shares of Kalpataru Power Transmission surged nearly 6% on December 30 after the company bagged orders worth ₹1,560 crore for power transmission projects from India, Africa, CIS and South America. Its international subsidiary secured new power transmission projects in Europe. The company's MD & CEO Manish Mohnot said that these orders are in their core power T&D business.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Which non-founders of Indian startups own stock options worth over ₹100 crore?
text: As per research by Longhouse Consulting, around 35 non-founder executives of Indian startups have stock options worth over ₹100 crore. OYO's Global COO Abhinav Sinha has shareholdings worth ₹1,100-crore, Paytm Labs' CEO Harinder Takhar has ₹413-crore worth of shareholdings. Zomato's Chief Technology Officer Gunjan Patidar, Nykaa's Chief Product Officer Sanjay Suri are also on the list.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Private cryptos pose immediate risks, prone to frauds: RBI report
text: The RBI's Financial Stability Report said that private cryptocurrencies pose immediate risks to customer protection. "They are also prone to frauds and to extreme price volatility, given their highly speculative nature," it added. "Longer-term concerns relate to capital flow management, financial and macro-economic stability, monetary policy transmission & currency substitution," the report said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Chinese professor set to become ultra-rich with IPO of US-blacklisted AI firm
text: Tang Xiao'ou, Founder of Chinese artificial intelligence start-up SenseTime, is about to become one of the world's richest people after his company lists in Hong Kong this week. The 53-year-old information engineering professor holds 21% stake in SenseTime and is worth $3.4 billion, as per Bloomberg. Earlier, his company was blacklisted by the US over alleged human rights violations.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Older than the independence of India: Rishad Premji on Wipro's 76th birthday
text: Wipro's Chairman Rishad Premji tweeted on Wednesday, "It's Wipro's birthday today. We turn 76. Older than the independence of India." He also shared the company's Certificate of Incorporation. Wipro was founded on December 29, 1945, by Rishad Premji's grandfather as 'Western India Vegetable Products Limited' that made cooking oil.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Apple puts Foxconn's TN facility on 'probation' days after employees' food poisoning
text: Apple has said that Foxconn's facility in Tamil Nadu's Sriperumbudur, which makes iPhones, has been put on 'probation', days after hundreds of employees were hospitalised for food poisoning. Apple's decision came after it found that worker dorms at the plant didn't meet required standards. Foxconn said it's restructuring the local management team to achieve and maintain the standards needed.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Chinese professor's wealth jumps to $4 billion with his AI startup's listing
text: Chinese professor Tang Xiao'ou has become one of the world's richest people after his artificial intelligence (AI) firm SenseTime's shares surged up to 23% on its Hong Kong debut. His fortune surged to nearly $4 billion after the stock ended the morning session 11% above its IPO price. Earlier, SenseTime was blacklisted by the US over alleged human rights violations.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: DoorDash asks all staff, from engineers to CEO, to deliver food once a month
text: American food delivery platform DoorDash has asked all employees, from engineers to the CEO, to deliver food at least once a month from January. DoorDash is bringing back 'WeDash', a program started by founders to make every employee experience different parts of the product and donate the money earned by them. "I didn't sign up for this," an engineer complained.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ford's market value closes above GM's for the 1st time in 5 yrs
text: Ford's market value closed above General Motors' at $83 billion for the first time in over five years. The last time Ford was valued at more than GM was September 14, 2016, when Ford closed the day with a market cap of $48.2 billion. This year, Ford's shares have more than doubled and have reportedly been trading around a 20-year-high.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Chinese people call model's 'slanted eye' makeup in Mercedes ad 'offensive'
text: Mercedes-Benz took down an advertisement from its Weibo account after several Chinese users referred to it as "offensive", state-run Global Times newspaper reported.
