Users claimed that the makeup of a model featured in the ad looked like "slanted eyes" and said it reflected Western stereotypes about Asian people. Snacks retailer Three Squirrels' ad was also criticised for similar reasons.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: IndiaPlaza Founder, whose firm ran out of money in 2012, gets patent for new venture
text: IndiaPlaza Founder K Vaitheeswaran, whose e-commerce company ran out of money in 2012, has received a product patent for Again Drinks, a venture he launched in 2019. He developed milk and yoghurt drinks, which don't contain preservatives, don't require refrigeration and have a 90-day shelf life. "Top FMCG...experts told me it can't be done. That spurred us on," he said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Follow 'No Vaccine-No Sale' policy in shops: CAIT's appeal to 40,000 trade groups
text: Confederation of All India Traders' (CAIT) Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal has said that the trade body has issued an appeal to 40,000 trade associations to follow a 'No Vaccine-No Sale' policy in shops. It has also asked trader members to not sell goods to people who aren't wearing masks. This comes amid a rise in Omicron-related COVID-19 cases in India.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: GST annual return filing deadline for 2020-21 extended till February 28, 2022
text: The government has extended till February 28 the deadline for businesses to file GST annual returns for 2020-21 fiscal ended March 2021, the Central Board of Indirect Taxes & Customs (CBIC) said. The previous deadline was December 31, 2021. Furnishing annual return in Form GSTR-9 is mandatory for registered taxpayers who have an aggregate annual turnover above ₹2 crore.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Taxpayers given time till February 2022 to verify income tax returns of 2019-20
text: The Income Tax Department has announced that taxpayers who haven't verified their income tax return (ITR) for assessment year 2020-21 (fiscal 2019-20) can do so till February 2022. Such returns will be processed by June 30, 2022. As per the law, an ITR filed electronically without a digital signature has to be verified within 120 days of filing the return.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Which are India's biggest mergers & acquisitions of 2021?
text: Piramal Group acquired Dewan Housing and Finance for nearly $4.7 billion, while Prosus' PayU announced a deal to acquire BillDesk for $4.7 billion. Adani Green Energy acquired SB Energy India for $3.5 billion, while Tata Group won the bid to acquire national carrier Air India for $2.4 billion. Zee Entertainment said it's merging with Sony Pictures in a $1.5-billion deal.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ratan Tata celebrates 84th birthday with cupcake, song from 28-yr-old assistant
text: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata celebrated his 84th birthday on Tuesday by blowing out candles on a cupcake. A video posted by Vaibhav Bhoir, a manager at Tata Motors Finance, showed Tata's 28-year-old business assistant Shantanu Naidu singing a birthday song for him and feeding him the cupcake. "Simplicity....Nation's pride and inspiration for all," Bhoir wrote on LinkedIn.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Major edible oil brands cut their MRP by 10-15%
text: Major edible oil brands have reduced their MRP by 10-15% to provide relief to customers, industry body Solvent Extractors' Association of India (SEA) said. The prices were cut after Food Ministry asked companies to act in sync with the reduction in import duties on edible oils. Adani Wilmar, Ruchi Soya, Emami, Gemini and other companies have reduced edible oil prices.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: US-blacklisted AI firm SenseTime shares jump 23% in Hong Kong debut
text: Chinese artificial intelligence startup SenseTime jumped as much as 23% from their IPO price as they debuted on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange. The startup had raised $740 million in its IPO and priced its shares at $0.4937 each. It was earlier blacklisted by the US over allegedly playing a role in human rights abuses against China's Muslim minority groups.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Musk exercises all of his Tesla stock options expiring next year
text: World's richest person Elon Musk has exercised all of the options on 22.8 million shares in Tesla, which are due to expire in August, filings revealed. He has offloaded 15.7 million shares in Tesla, coming close to the 10% stake he has pledged to sell. Out of the 15.7 million shares, 10.3 million were related to the options exercise.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Bajaj Auto to invest ₹300 cr in new EV manufacturing plant in Pune
text: Bajaj Auto will be investing ₹300 crore to commence work at its new electric vehicle plant in Pune. This facility will have a production capacity of five lakh EVs per year and will employ nearly 800 people. The first vehicle from the new unit, spread over half-a-million square feet space, is expected to be rolled out by June 2022.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: India's real GDP in FY2022-23 likely to grow at 9%: ICRA Report
text: India's real gross domestic product (GDP) is likely to maintain growth at 9% in financial year (FY) 2022-23 amid rising Omicron cases in India, according to a report by ICRA Limited. Fresh curbs being imposed by governments due to rising Omicron cases may temporarily interrupt economic recovery in Q4 of FY2021-22, ICRA Chief Economist Aditi Nayar said in the report.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: EPFO aims to achieve 100% e-nomination registration by Feb 2022
text: The Employees Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) is aiming to achieve 100% registrations of e-nominations to PF accounts by February 2022. It underlined that it will be crucial for EPF withdrawals for non-medical purposes. EPFO directed employers and its over 120 offices to ensure e-nomination registrations by subscribers following a government directive, Moneycontrol reported quoting sources.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ED attaches ₹293-cr assets of Tamilnad Mercantile Bank's ex-chairman
text: The Enforcement Directorate on Tuesday said it has seized shares worth ₹293.91 crore belonging to Tamilnad Mercantile Bank's (TMB) former chairman Nesamanimaran Muthu under the FEMA law. According to ED, the shareholdings seized were of four Indian companies, of which three are unlisted entities. The investment was made without RBI's permission and non-disclosure to Indian regulators, ED added.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Tender, contract info is 'material' in insider trading cases: SAT
text: The Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) said that having information on a company's tender bid being the lowest and that it might win the bid is "material information" in insider trading cases. SAT was hearing an appeal against a SEBI order which fined MD of Deep Industries ₹1.74 crore for purchasing shares while in possession of the company's contract-related information.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: 4.86 cr income tax returns filed so far, 19 lakh in a single day
text: Over 4.86 crore income tax returns (ITRs) have been filed so far, including over 18.89 lakh returns filed on December 28, the Income Tax Department informed on Wednesday. The number of ITR-1 returns is over 2.57 crore. The deadline for individual taxpayers to file ITRs is December 31, 2021. The date was extended from original due date of July 31.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Govt's total liabilities rise by ₹4.8 lakh crore in Sept quarter
text: The government’s total liabilities rose by ₹4.8 lakh crore to ₹125.71 lakh crore in the July-September quarter from ₹120.91 lakh crore in the previous quarter, as per Finance Ministry data. Public debt accounted for 91.15% of total outstanding liabilities in the second quarter. The rise reflects a quarter-on-quarter increase of 3.97% in the July-September period of 2021-22.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: 'Intel, welcome to India', says IT Minister as its exec lauds scheme for chipmakers
text: Intel Foundry Services President Randhir Thakur congratulated the Centre after it announced a ₹76,000-crore incentive scheme for designing and manufacturing of semiconductors in India. "Glad to see a plan laid out for all aspects of the supply chain: talent, design, manufacturing, test, packaging and logistics," he tweeted. IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw responded saying, "Intel - welcome to India."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 35 non-founders own ₹100 crore worth ESOPs each in Indian startups: Report
text: As many as 35 non-founder executives of India's recently-listed startups and privately-held technology companies now own stock options worth over ₹100 crore, as per research by Longhouse Consulting. They belong to firms such as Nykaa, Zomato, PolicyBazaar, Paytm, Flipkart, Ola and BYJU'S. Executives in ₹100-crore ESOP club are expected to increase to 100 by end of 2022, Longhouse Consulting said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg buys 110 more acres of land in Hawaii for ₹127 crore
text: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and his wife Priscilla Chan have purchased 110 more acres of land on the island of Kauai, Hawaii for $17 million (₹127 crore). With this, total land holdings in Hawaii by Zuckerberg have reached nearly 1,500 acres. The purchase includes a century-old reservoir whose dam broke in 2006, leading to a flood that killed seven people.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Learned about her for 1st time: Mahindra on India-born CEO of Tinder's parent firm
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra shared an article about Match Group's India-born CEO Shar Dubey on Twitter and wrote, "This is the first time I've learned about her." He questioned whether Dubey is often not cited in the lists of global Indian-origin CEOs because she leads matchmaking sites like Tinder and OKCupid. "She deserves to be in the spotlight," Mahindra said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Lock-in period for anchor investors of IPOs extended to 90 days
text: Market regulator SEBI has cleared several rules to tighten IPO process, including increasing lock-in period for anchor investors to 90 days for IPOs opening from April 1, 2022. The rule will apply to 50% of allocation to anchor investors, while the remaining portion will have 30-day lock-in period. The move will reportedly stabilise share price and prevent retail investors' losses.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 32-yr-old Pankhuri spoke of challenges of evaluating candidates a day before her death
text: Entrepreneur Pankhuri Shrivastava, who died due to a cardiac arrest on December 24, had spoken about challenges of evaluating a candidate's potential in a one-hour job interview, a day before her death. In her last social media post, Shrivastava, 32-year-old Founder of women-focused social community platform Pankhuri, said candidates appear to have read the same articles and "know same hacks".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ex-CEA says his wife received tax refund in 2 days, adds 'such speed unheard of'
text: Former Chief Economic Adviser (CEA) KV Subramanian shared on Twitter that his wife filed her tax return on Sunday evening for a small amount and got her refund on Tuesday itself. "She called in excitement as she was so pleasantly surprised. Such speed from Government of India unheard of before," he wrote. "Kudos to Finance Ministry, Nirmala Sitharaman," he added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Insurer can't refuse claim by citing existing medical condition once policy is issued: SC
text: An insurer cannot refuse a claim by citing an existing medical condition that was disclosed by the insured once the policy is issued, Supreme Court has said. The court added that a proposer is under a duty to disclose to the insurer all material facts within his knowledge and is presumed to know all the facts concerning the proposed insurance.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Which items will get costlier from Jan 1, 2022 due to changes in GST rules?
text: Apparel, footwear and fabrics including blankets, tents and tablecloths, will get more expensive from January 1, 2022, due to a uniform 12% GST. The GST rate on apparel and footwear costing up to ₹1,000 per piece has been hiked from 5% to 12%. Autorickshaw rides booked via aggregators like Ola and Uber will attract 5% GST from January 1, 2022.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Who is Piyush Jain, UP businessman arrested for hoarding over ₹200 crore?
text: Police arrested UP's Kanpur-based businessman Piyush Jain for tax evasion after seizing over ₹200 crore unaccounted cash, 23 kg gold and Dubai property papers. Piyush and his brother Ambrish learned to make perfumes and essences from their chemist father. Their business expanded to Mumbai and Gujarat over the last 15 years as they sold perfume components to pan masala manufacturers.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Direct selling firms like Tupperware, Amway banned from promoting pyramid schemes
text: The Centre has banned direct selling companies like Tupperware, Amway, Oriflame and others from promoting pyramid and money circulation schemes as it notified new rules to regulate the industry. As per the order, companies should also specify details of refund, exchange, guarantee and grievance redressal mechanism on their websites. The entities have to comply with the rules within 90 days.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Tina remembers Dhirubhai Ambani on his birth anniversary, says he was 'magnanimous'
text: Tina Ambani took to Instagram to share a post remembering her father-in-law Dhirubhai Ambani on his birth anniversary. She wrote, he "wasn't just a revolutionary man but one of the most magnanimous, gentle and generous people". "Pappa gave his time, expertise, patience and learnings to us all, leaving us better...and more in tune with the world around us," she added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Record ₹2,600 crore in fees collected by Indian bankers steering IPOs in 2021
text: Indian investment bankers have collected almost ₹2,600 crore ($347 million) in fees from local IPOs in their best year ever, as per Bloomberg. These fees are more than four times the previous record set in 2017. Over 110 companies ranging from food delivery to beauty startups listed their shares in 2021, raising nearly $18 billion (₹1.35 lakh crore).
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: This normalcy is still clouded by uncertainty: Mukesh Ambani
text: Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani said, "We've been through a lot during the last nearly two years...Of course, now a semblance of normality is slowly returning. But this normalcy is still clouded by uncertainty." He added, "We simply cannot afford to lower the guard." He was addressing Reliance Family Day 2021 to mark the 89th birth anniversary of Dhirubhai Ambani.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: We would love to see Intel, TSMC, Samsung invest in India: MoS IT
text: Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar told PTI that the government would love to see Intel, TSMC, Samsung, GlobalFoundries, and other semiconductor technology majors invest in India. "It's clear that interest levels in global majors after PM Narendra Modi's announcement of ₹76,000 crore initiative (to boost semiconductor production) is much higher and much more serious today," he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Shiba Inu becomes most viewed crypto, Bitcoin ranks 2nd: Report
text: Meme-based cryptocurrency Shiba Inu has emerged as the most viewed cryptocurrency of 2021, cryptocurrency price-tracking website CoinMarketCap reported. The cryptocurrency recorded more than 188 million views during the last 12 months, while Bitcoin came in second with 145 million views in 2021. Dogecoin ranked third among the most viewed cryptocurrencies with 107 million views.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Mutual funds must avoid crypto-based investments till there's a law: SEBI
text: SEBI Chairman Ajay Tyagi has said that mutual funds should avoid cryptocurrency-related investments till there is a law for such digital assets in the country. During its board meeting on Tuesday, the markets regulator also made it mandatory for mutual fund trustees to take unitholders' consent before winding up any mutual fund scheme.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Shares of Thai firm that has mined 8 Bitcoin jumps 7,000% in months
text: Thai technology company Jasmine Technology's stock has surged nearly 7,000% since it announced its plan to expand into Bitcoin mining in late July, Bloomberg reported. The firm has generated only eight Bitcoins from its 325 mining machines since operations were started a few months ago. The cryptocurrency project is yet to generate significant earnings for the firm.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Withdraw permissions given to Amazon, Flipkart to operate in India: SJM
text: RSS-affiliated Swadeshi Jagran Manch (SJM) has demanded that all permissions granted to Amazon and Flipkart to operate in India be withdrawn and all their activities be declared illegal. "[They] are blatantly contravening and operating uncontrolled in India...Discounts offered by them are adversely impacting offline markets," SJM said. It further accused Amazon of bribing officials in India.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Elon Musk sells $16 bn worth Tesla shares since Twitter poll in Nov
text: World's richest person Elon Musk has sold over $16 billion worth of Tesla shares since his Twitter poll in November about offloading 10% of his stake. He sold another 934,090 shares for $1.02 billion on Tuesday to pay for taxes on the exercise of his stock options, filings showed. Earlier, Musk had said he is "almost done" with the sale.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Reliance Retail to invest ₹300 cr in robotics firm Addverb: Report
text: Reliance Retail, the retail arm of Reliance Industries, is likely to acquire a minority stake in warehouse robotics company Addverb Technologies for around ₹300 crore, Mint reported citing people familiar with the matter. If the deal goes through, Addverb will be valued at ₹1,590-1,660 crore, the report said. Noida-based Addverb was founded in 2016 by former executives of Asian Paints.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Make flex-fuel vehicles: Gadkari to automobile manufacturers in India
text: Union Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari advised automobile manufacturers in India to begin manufacturing BS-VI compliant flex-fuel vehicles and flex-fuel strong hybrid electric vehicles within a period of six months. "[It] will drastically reduce...emissions from vehicles on Well-to-Wheel basis," Gadkari tweeted. This move is in line with PM Modi's vision of Aatmanirbhar Bharat, added Gadkari.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ITC commissions ₹76-cr solar plant in Tamil Nadu to cut carbon footprint
text: Multi-business company ITC has commissioned its first offsite solar plant in Tamil Nadu's Dindigul, built with an investment of ₹76 crore. The 14.9 MW solar plant will generate over 22 million units of renewable energy annually and help reduce ITC's carbon footprint. It will meet 90% of ITC's power needs in Tamil Nadu from renewable sources, the company said.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Nonperforming loans fell to 6.9% by end-September 2021: RBI Report
text: Non-performing loans (NPLs) of India's scheduled commercial banks fell to 6.9% of its total loans by September-end, the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) said in its "Trends and Progress of Banking" report. Gross NPLs stood at 7.3% in March 2021, the report further noted. Loans are categorised as NPLs when the borrower fails to make scheduled payments to the bank.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's exports jump 36% to $23.8 bn in first 3 weeks of December
text: India's exports rose by 36.2% to $23.82 billion between December 1 and 21 this year, according to data released by the Commerce Ministry. During the same period in 2020-21, the value of exports stood at $17.49 billion, the Ministry said. India's overall exports have risen by 37% to $419 billion in  April-November 2021 as against the year-ago period.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Air India handover to Tata Group to be delayed by a month: Report
text: The government's plan to handover Air India to the Tata Group is most likely to be delayed by a month, PTI reported citing an official. Some regulatory approvals and certain formalities are yet to be completed, the report said, adding that the process is likely to be completed by January. Recently, the CCI approved Tata Group's acquisition of Air India.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Supriya Lifescience debuts with 55% premium over issue price
text: Pharma company Supriya Lifescience made a strong market debut on Tuesday, listing at a premium of 55.1% over the issue price of ₹274 per share. The stock opened at ₹425 on the BSE, while the opening price on the NSE was ₹421. The ₹700-crore IPO of the Mumbai-based company was subscribed 71.51 times from December 16 to 20.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Lost my mother to COVID 2 days before she was due to get 1st vaccine: Branson
text: Virgin Group's billionaire Founder Richard Branson revealed in a blog that he lost his mother, Eve Branson, to COVID-19, two days before she was due to get her first dose of vaccine. "She lived well into her nineties and had the most extraordinary life," Branson wrote. He said vaccines are best way to global recovery, not lockdowns or travel bans.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Pankhuri and Grabhouse founder Pankhuri Shrivastava passes away aged 32
text: Pankhuri Shrivastava, founder of a women-focussed social community platform called Pankhuri, passed away at the age of 32. She had also founded rental startup Grabhouse, which was sold to online classifieds company Quikr in a cash and equity deal in 2016. "Her demise is a loss for our startup ecosystem," Vani Kola, founder of Kalaari Capital, tweeted.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Nexus Venture Partners co-founder Naren Gupta passes away aged 73
text: Nexus Venture Partners co-founder Naren Gupta passed away aged 73 on Saturday, the venture capital firm said in a statement on Sunday. The IIT and Stanford University alumnus founded Nexus Venture Partners along with Suvir Sujan and Sandeep Singhal in 2006 and had been actively investing in Indian startups for last 15 years. He was based in Menlo Park, California.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Anand Mahindra shares video of man with no limbs driving vehicle, offers him job
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra on Monday tweeted a video of a differently-abled man with no limbs driving a modified vehicle fitted with the engine of a scooty in Delhi. Mahindra wrote, "I'm awestruck by this gentleman who's not just faced his disabilities but is GRATEFUL for what he has. Ram, can @Mahindralog_MLL make him a Business Associate for last mile delivery?"
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Piyush Jain accepted ₹200 cr related to sales without GST payment: DGGI
text: The DGGI has said that Kanpur-based businessman Piyush Jain, who was arrested on charges of tax evasion days after more than ₹200 crore cash was seized from his residence, has accepted that the cash is related to the sale of goods without payment of GST.  The overwhelming evidence indicates large scale evasion of GST by Odochem Industries, the DGGI added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ₹11cr gold, sandalwood oil worth ₹6cr & more cash found in raids on Piyush Jain
text: Successive search operations on premises linked to arrested UP perfume industrialist Piyush Jain have revealed ₹17 crore cash and 23 kg gold (worth around ₹11 crore) with foreign markings, the Ministry of Finance said. Huge amount of unaccounted perfume raw materials including 600 kg of sandalwood oil worth ₹6 crore hidden in underground storage, was also found, it added.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 5G services to be rolled out in 13 Indian cities next year, list released
text: India's Metro cities are among the first few cities that will get 5G telecom services from next year, the government said on Monday. The services will be rolled out in Gurugram, Bengaluru, Kolkata, Mumbai, Delhi, Ahmedabad, Hyderabad, Pune, Chennai, Lucknow, Chandigarh, Jamnagar and Gandhinagar. The government plans to hold spectrum auctions for 5G in March-April 2022.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: India imposes anti-dumping duty on 5 Chinese goods for 5 years
text: India has imposed anti-dumping duty on five Chinese goods for five years. The duties have been imposed on certain flat-rolled products of aluminium, sodium hydrosulphite, silicone sealant, hydrofluorocarbon (HFC) component R-32 and hydrofluorocarbon blends. Probes concluded that the products have been exported at a price below normal value in Indian markets, which has resulted in dumping.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Piyush Jain sent to 14-day judicial custody after tax raids recover over ₹200 cr
text: Kanpur-based businessman Piyush Jain, who was arrested on Sunday, has been sent to 14-day judicial custody after raids at his residence led to the recovery of ₹194.45 crore of cash, 23 kg gold and 600 kg of sandalwood oil. As per the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs, this is the biggest cash seizure in their history.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: For the first time ever, world economy will top $100 trillion in 2022: Report
text: The world's economic output will exceed $100 trillion for the first time next year, according to British consultancy Cebr. India is set to overtake France next year and Britain in 2023 to regain its place as the world's sixth biggest economy, Cebr said. Further, Cebr predicted that China will become the world's top economy in dollar terms in 2030.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Mahindra shares pics of Archbishop Tutu wearing 'Bandi' for his love for India
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra took to Twitter to share pictures of Archbishop Desmond Tutu from 2013, where he's seen wearing a 'Bandi' to show his affection for India. "Archbishop Desmond Tutu passed away today...A Titan...We won't forget him," wrote Mahindra. Archbishop Tutu, the Nobel Peace Prize laureate who helped end apartheid in South Africa, has passed away aged 90.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Winning Air India bid most important milestone of 2021: Tata Sons Chairman
text: Tata Sons Chairman N Chandrasekaran in a letter to his employees said, "Our most important milestone this year culminated in our bid to win Air India. It is indeed a historic moment." Noting that second wave of COVID-19 was "a very difficult period", he said, "We rose to the challenge and showed the courage and selflessness in the Tata spirit."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Japan to pay companies to keep sensitive patents secret: Reports
text: Japan will compensate companies to maintain the secrecy of patents with potential military applications under its proposed economic security legislation, the Nikkei reported on Sunday. This will include patents concerning the development of nuclear weapons and innovations like quantum tech, Nikkei said. PM Kishida pledged last month that he will make economic security a priority.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: iPhone maker Foxconn's TN plant to be shut for 3 more days: Report
text: A Foxconn factory in Tamil Nadu which manufactures Apple's iPhone 12 models has extended its week-long closure by an extra three days, reported Reuters. The state government reportedly conducted inspections of workers' hostels after over 150 Foxconn employees were hospitalised for food poisoning. The factory is now expected to resume production with 1,000 workers on December 30, the report said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: iPhone maker Foxconn asked to improve working conditions by TN govt
text: Tamil Nadu government has asked Foxconn to come up with a slew of measures to improve the working conditions of its employees. Several employees had protested after more than 100 employees, who work at the factory that makes Apple's iPhones, were hospitalised due to food poisoning. Foxconn has assured it will urge contractors to provide quality food for all employees.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I started deleting recurring meetings on employees' calendars: Shopify CEO
text: Shopify Co-founder and CEO Tobi Lütke told Bloomberg he started periodically exploiting the "god mode" on his employees' calendars and deleting regularly recurring meetings. "Nothing can become truly resilient when everything goes right," he added. In 2017, he sent his employees home to work virtually for a month as an experiment. "The tools were terrible," he said of the experience.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: IRDAI has no data on insurance coverage of MSMEs: Finance Ministry
text: Replying to a Rajya Sabha question, MoS for Finance Bhagwat Karad said that the Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI) does not have data on MSMEs covered by insurance in India. The IRDAI had revised guidelines for trade credit insurance from November 1. It aimed to promote insurance policies with customised cover to improve business for MSMEs.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Rainbow Children's Medicare files draft papers for over ₹2,000 cr IPO
text: Rainbow Children's Medicare Ltd has filed a draft red herring prospectus with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) to raise over ₹2,000 crore via initial public offering (IPO). The IPO will consist of fresh issue of equity shares totalling ₹280 crore and an offer sale of up to 2.4 crore shares by the selling shareholders, the DRHP stated.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: RBL Bank stable, well capitalised: RBI assures depositors as shares plunge
text: The Reserve Bank of India on Monday said that RBL Bank depositors and investors need not worry about the bank's health after the latter's shares plunged 25% in the first half today. In a statement, RBI said that the bank is "well capitalised" and its "financial health remains stable". It also asked depositors to not react to the speculative reports.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: HDFC Bank partners with India Post Payments Bank for rural reach
text: India Post Payments Bank (IPPB) has signed a memorandum of understanding with HDFC Bank to provide banking services in semi-urban and rural areas, primarily focussing on unbanked and underserved segments. This partnership is reportedly expected to benefit over 4.7 crore IPPB customers, of which 90% reside in rural areas. HDFC aims to strengthen its financial inclusion drive with this partnership.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Centre begins consultation on national database on cooperatives
text: The Centre has started consultation with various stakeholders on setting up of a national database on cooperatives, aiming for convergence of various central and state government schemes. "This will be the most important policy-making tool in the cooperative sector," a senior Cooperation Ministry official told PTI. Currently, there is no authentic data repository of cooperatives in the country.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: RBL Bank's MD & CEO to proceed on leave with immediate effect
text: Private lender RBL Bank's board has approved the request of its MD and CEO Vishwavir Ahuja to "proceed on leave with immediate effect". Current Executive Director Rajeev Ahuja has been named interim MD & CEO with immediate effect, the board said. Vishwavir, who had been leading RBL since 2010, was MD & CEO of Bank of America, India from 2001-2009.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: CAIT urges FM to defer implementation of 12% GST on textiles
text: Indian traders' body CAIT has urged Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman to defer the implementation of GST hike on textiles and footwear from 5% to 12% from January 1, 2022. "It is illogical and beyond the canon of GST tax structure," CAIT said. It also requested that a task force be formed under the Chairmanship of CBIC's Chairman to bring consensus.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 4 employees of Titan, Mindtree fined ₹1 lakh each by SEBI
text: Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has imposed a monetary fine of ₹1 lakh each on two employees of Mindtree, for disclosure lapses, in violation of insider trading norms. Mindtree had informed SEBI regarding instances of violation of code of conduct framed by the company. SEBI also fined two Titan employees ₹1 lakh each for failing to make disclosures.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Medanta owner Global Health gets SEBI's approval for IPO
text: Global Health Private Limited, which operates hospitals under the Medanta brand, has received SEBI's approval to raise funds through an initial public offering (IPO). As per the draft papers, Global Health's IPO consists of a fresh issue of ₹500 crore and an offer-for-sale of 4.84 crore shares. The proceeds will be used to pay debt and for general corporate purposes.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: HP Adhesives shares list at a 16% premium on market debut
text: The shares of HP Adhesives listed at ₹319 on BSE on their market debut on Monday, a premium of 16% over the issue price of ₹274 apiece. After the debut, the company's market capitalisation stood at more than ₹615 crore. HP Adhesives raised ₹126 crore through its IPO and the offer was oversubscribed 20.96 times by investors between December 15-17.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Campus Activewear files DRHP with SEBI for IPO
text: Footwear brand Campus Activewear has filed a draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) to garner funds via an initial public offering. Promoters Hari Krishan Agarwal and Nikhil Aggarwal will cumulatively sell 1.4 crore equity shares of the total 5.1 crore shares which will be put up for sale by promoters and investors.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: We need a booster policy, don't know what's holding it up: Mazumdar-Shaw
text: Biocon's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw told Bloomberg, "We need a booster policy for sure...I really don't know what's holding it up, it's got nothing to do with vaccine availability." She said that three weeks ago, 12 people in her household, including her husband, tested positive for COVID-19. However, since they were fully inoculated, they had only mild symptoms, she added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: My Wiki's a dumpster fire: Musk as report says his page was 3rd most-popular in 2021
text: After a report said Elon Musk's page was the third-most popular on Wikipedia in 2021, the world's richest person tweeted, "My Wiki is such a dumpster fire. That's how you know it isn't curated." "History is written by...victors, except on Wikipedia, as your enemies are still alive and have lots of time on their hands," the Tesla CEO added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: That's why I'm pro Doge: Musk as Dogecoin creator says Bitcoin 'gives power to rich'
text: Amid a discussion on Web3 on Twitter, meme-based cryptocurrency Dogecoin's creator Billy Markus wrote, "Bitcoin just gives power to new rich people." Responding to this, world's richest person Elon Musk said, "That's why I'm pro Doge." Block CEO and former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey wrote, "No one rich individual or institution has any more power over Bitcoin than anyone else."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Indian engineer tweets Tesla neared bankruptcy on Christmas Eve 2008; Musk responds
text: Pranay Pathole, a 23-year-old Pune-based engineer, wrote on Twitter, "On Christmas Eve 2008, Tesla funding round completed, Tesla was literally a few days from bankruptcy." "Elon Musk had to put in all his money and assets," he added. Musk responded saying, "That was a crazy tough year. Tesla financing closed at 6pm Christmas Eve – last hour of...last day possible."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Which are India's 10 biggest IPOs of 2021?
text: Paytm's ₹18,300-crore IPO is India's largest ever public issue in terms of size. The second-largest IPO of this year was by Zomato, which raised ₹9,375 crore. It's followed by PowerGrid InvIT's ₹7,735-crore IPO and Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Star Health and Allied Insurance's ₹7,249-crore IPO. Policybazaar raised ₹5,625 crore, Sona Comstar raised ₹5,550 crore, while Nykaa raised ₹5,352 crore.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I-T raids on businessman who launched Samajwadi Party perfume reportedly unearth ₹150 cr
text: Cash worth at least ₹150 crore has reportedly been detected during Income Tax raids on multiple premises linked to Kanpur perfume trader Piyush Jain so far. Pictures purportedly showed officials sitting on the floor and using note-counting machines. In November, Jain had launched a perfume for Samajwadi Party called 'Samajwadi Attar' in light of the upcoming Uttar Pradesh elections.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Data Patterns shares list at 48% premium on market debut
text: Shares of Data Patterns India made a strong market debut on Friday, listing at ₹864 apiece on the BSE. The stock listed with a premium of around 48% as against its IPO price of ₹585 per share. The ₹588-crore IPO of defence and aerospace electronics solutions provider was oversubscribed by 120 times, with non-institutional investors' portion getting subscribed 254 times.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: ₹1,000 crore worth of Nirav's properties to be auctioned to recover PNB's dues
text: The Enforcement Directorate has de-attached properties worth around ₹1,000 crore belonging to PNB scam accused fugitive diamantaire Nirav Modi. They will be auctioned to recover the bank's pending dues. These properties include the building that housed music store Rhythm House at Kala Ghoda, a flat at Nepean Sea Road in Mumbai and some jewellery, among others.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: HSBC AMC to acquire L&T's investment management unit for ₹3,193 cr
text: HSBC Holdings' asset management arm has signed an agreement to fully acquire L&T Investment Management, a wholly-owned subsidiary of L&T Finance Holdings, for $425 million (₹3,193 crore). The proposed acquisition will be funded from existing resources, HSBC said. LTIM had assets under management of $10.8 billion (₹80,300 crore) and over 2.4 million active folios as of September, it added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Impose lockdown after consulting trade bodies, we suffer most: CAIT
text: Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) on Saturday said that the Centre and state governments should impose lockdowns only after consulting the trade bodies. Taking to Twitter, CAIT Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said, ''No lockdown. It will kill the trade which is on recovering mode.'' He added that the trade bodies are the biggest sufferers during lockdown.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: I think of Amazon as a worthy rival: Shopify CEO Tobi Lütke
text: E-commerce company Shopify's CEO Tobi Lütke told Bloomberg in an interview, "I think of Amazon as a worthy rival." He added, "If they knock it out of the park and make it super easy to start new businesses on it, then I actually accomplished my mission." Lütke, who co-founded Shopify in 2006, said he's willing to be the underdog again.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Thanks to tech, we can look towards a healthier 2022: Mazumdar-Shaw
text: Biocon Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw while discussing COVID-19 and its part in digitising several sectors said, "Thanks to technology, we can look towards a healthier...2022." She said the use of digital technology in healthcare will make it accessible to economically-disadvantaged individuals. She added e-pharmacies could help eliminate inadequacies in drugs' last mile delivery.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Bitcoin price rises to $51,000, hits highest in over 2 weeks
text: Bitcoin price rose to about $51,000 on Friday, touching the highest level in more than two weeks. Bitcoin has jumped some 4% over the past two days and at one point reached $51,524 on Friday in Asian trading. Ether, the coin linked to Ethereum blockchain and the second largest cryptocurrency, also surged over 4% to $4,114.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Chinese users claim Walmart's not selling Xinjiang items at grocery chain
text: Chinese social media users criticised Walmart on Friday for allegedly stopping the sale of items from Xinjiang at its members-only grocery chain Sam's Club in China. Users posted screenshots of no search results for the word "Xinjiang" on Sam's Club's app on Weibo. This comes after US framed a law banning goods made from the province.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Shamefully low blow: Musk as WSJ says he's living in PayPal exec's mansion
text: After The Wall Street Journal reported that the world's richest person Elon Musk has been staying at a $12-million mansion owned by PayPal Co-founder Ken Howery in Texas, Musk said "it was a shamefully low blow from" the publication. "Elon doesn't live at my home...He stayed at the house as my guest occasionally when traveling to Austin," Howery told WSJ.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Hero MotoCorp to hike prices of 2-wheelers by up to ₹2,000 from Jan
text: Hero MotoCorp will increase the prices of its motorcycles and scooters with effect from January 4, 2022. The ex-showroom prices will be increased by up to ₹2,000 and the exact quantum of increase will depend on the model and the market. "The price revision has been necessitated to partially offset the impact of steadily increasing commodity prices," the company said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SoftBank faces legal action from Credit Suisse over Greensill debt
text: Credit Suisse has launched a legal action against SoftBank to recover funds it says are owed to its Greensill-linked supply chain finance funds. The lawsuit relates to $440m in funds that were owed to Credit Sussie's customers by Softbank-backed Katerra, which filed for bankruptcy in June. Katerra had estimated liabilities of $1 billion-$10 billion and assets of $500 million-$1 billion.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Paytm Lending CEO Bhavesh Gupta to lead offline payments vertical
text: Paytm on Friday announced that it has elevated Bhavesh Gupta, CEO of Paytm Lending, to take on the leadership for the offline payments vertical in addition to his existing responsibilities. Before joining Paytm, Bhavesh had over 22 years of experience in the financial sector. The firm also plans to hire 30 senior leaders for product, technology and business roles.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Railways earns over ₹100 crore from 5 passenger trains in 8 months
text: The West Central Railway zone collected an amount of ₹100.03 crore from five passenger train services in eight months, it said. Among the five passenger trains, Jabalpur–Nizamuddin Gondwana Express earned ₹21.32 crore, Rewa–Anand Vihar Express earned ₹20.52 crore and Jabalpur–Howrah Shaktipunj Express made ₹19.93 crore. Meanwhile, Jabalpur–Durg Amarkantak Express earned ₹19.59 crore.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Govt puts stock limits on soya meal till June 2022 to control prices
text: The Centre has imposed stock holding limits on soya meal till June 30, 2022 to check price rise and stop hoarding and black marketing. Under this, soya meal processors, millers and plant owners can hold a maximum stock of 90 days production. Meanwhile, government-registered traders and private chaupals can hold a maximum of 160 tonne in a declared storage location.
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: Economic bullying: China on US ban on imports from Xinjiang region
text: China's commerce ministry has expressed "strong dissatisfaction and firm opposition" to a US ban on imports from Xinjiang region. The ministry has termed the action by the US as "economic bullying", reported state news agency Xinhua on Friday. US President Joe Biden has signed into law a legislation that bans imports from China's Xinjiang region over concerns about forced labour.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Leading travel distribution platform TBO.com files draft papers for ₹2,100 cr IPO
text: Leading global travel distribution platform TBO.com filed a draft red herring prospectus with the SEBI to raise as much as ₹2,100 crore through an initial public offering (IPO). TBO serves over 100,000 travel buyers in more than 110 countries. TBO.com was founded in 2006 by Gaurav Bhatnagar and Ankush Nijhawan.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Crocs to acquire footwear brand Hey Dude for $2.5 billion
text: Crocs said on Thursday that it will acquire privately-owned footwear label Hey Dude for $2.5 billion. Of this, it will pay $2.05 billion in cash, while the remaining $450 million will be issued as Crocs shares to Hey Dude Founder and CEO Alessandro Rosano. Crocs CEO Andrew Rees said that the acquisition of the Italian-origin company will be "highly profitable".
author: Subhangi Singh

headlines: India's monetary policy financially inclusive by design: RBI Deputy Guv
text: RBI's Deputy Governor Michael D Patra on Friday said that India's monetary policy is financially inclusive by design. This strategy will result in policy effectiveness and welfare maximisation going ahead, he added. "Financial inclusion appears to have gone up, with the level of the RBI's financial inclusion index rising from 49.9 in March 2019 to...53.9 in March 2021," Patra said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Data Patterns shares end 28.3% higher over IPO price on market debut
text: Data Patterns' shares closed at ₹750.50 on the first day of trading at the stock exchanges on Friday, 28.3% higher than its IPO price of ₹585. The defense and aerospace electronics solutions provider's stock listed at ₹856.05 on the NSE and reached an intraday high of ₹864. Data Patterns' ₹588-crore IPO was among top 15 most subscribed IPOs of 2021.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's forex reserves drop by $160 million to $635.66 billion
text: India's foreign exchange reserves dropped by $160 million to $635.66 billion during the week ended December 17, due to a sharp drop in foreign currency assets (FCAs), according to data released by the RBI. The FCAs, a major component of the overall reserves, fell by $645 million to $572.21 billion. Further, gold reserves rose by $475 million to $39.18 billion.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: NCLAT stays CCI order imposing ₹873 cr fine on UBL, other beer makers
text: The National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) has imposed a stay on the orders passed by the CCI imposing penalties on several beer makers, including United Breweries Limited (UBL). In September, the CCI had imposed penalties totalling over ₹873 crore on UBL, Carlsberg India, All India Brewers' Association and others for cartelisation in the sale and supply of beer.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Poonawalla shares meme video showing boy in Home Alone fighting 'Omicron' with booster
text: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla shared a meme video showing a booster shot defeating Omicron. The video showed the boy from 'Home Alone' movie fighting two thieves marked as 'Delta' and 'Omicron' with buckets marked as 'vaccine' and 'booster'. "What's going on here!?" Poonawalla wrote while sharing the clip created by Johns Hopkins Bloomberg School of Public Health.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 160 IIT students get ₹1-crore salary package in 1st phase of campus hiring: Report
text: India's top eight IITs attracted nearly 9,000 jobs for their students, including at least 160 offers with a ₹1-crore salary package each in the first phase of campus placement, Moneycontrol reported. The average salary hike at the older campuses this year has reportedly been in the range of 15%-35% so far. At IIT-Bombay, a record 1,382 offers have been accepted.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 63 Indian IPOs raise ₹1.19 lakh crore in 2021, break previous record
text: Sixty three Indian corporates raised nearly ₹1.19 lakh crore in funds through main board IPOs in 2021, surpassing the 2017 record. The amount is 4.5 times the ₹26,613 crore raised through 15 IPOs in 2020, according to PRIME Database Group data. The largest IPO in 2021, which was also the largest Indian IPO ever, was from Paytm for ₹18,300 crore.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Elon Musk denies report he's living in a $12 mn mansion owned by PayPal co-founder
text: World's richest person Elon Musk has denied the WSJ's report which claimed that he's been staying in a $12-million mansion, owned by PayPal Co-founder Ken Howery, in Texas for about a year. "I don't live there and am not looking to buy a house anywhere," he told Insider. Earlier, Musk said he was living in a $50,000 house on rent.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: If you could die by irony, she'd be dead: Musk after Warren calls him a 'freeloader'
text: World's richest person Elon Musk in an interview criticised US Senator Elizabeth Warren for calling him a "freeloader and a grifter who doesn't pay taxes". "If you could die by irony, she'd be dead," he said. "I'm literally paying the most tax than any individual in history...and her salary is paid for by the taxpayer like me," Musk added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Foxconn's India arm & Xiaomi phone maker Bharat FIH files for ₹5,000-crore IPO
text: Bharat FIH, the India unit of Foxconn and Hong Kong-listed FIH Mobile, has filed draft papers for an IPO to raise over ₹5,000 crore. The IPO comprises fresh issue of up to ₹2,502 crore and an offer for sale of up to ₹2,502 crore. Electronic manufacturing services provider Bharat FIH manufactures and assembles Xiaomi mobile phones in India.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Elon Musk sells $15 bn worth Tesla shares since Twitter poll, says 'almost done'
text: World's richest person Elon Musk has sold over $15 billion worth of Tesla shares since early November when he polled Twitter users about offloading 10% of his stake. "There are still a few tranches left, but almost done," Musk tweeted. Musk exercised stock options that expire next year and sold a portion of stocks to pay taxes, Tesla filings said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I admire ingenuity of people: Mahindra on man who built 4-wheeler with ₹60,000
text: Businessman Anand Mahindra shared a video of a man in Maharashtra who spent ₹60,000 and built a jeep-like four-wheeler, that runs on the kick-start mechanism seen in two-wheelers, using scrap metal. "This clearly doesn't meet with any...regulations but I'll never cease to admire the ingenuity and 'more with less' capabilities of our people," Mahindra wrote on Twitter.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Snapdeal's IPO papers reveal salaries of co-founders, other officials
text: Snapdeal's draft IPO papers revealed that Co-founders Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal, who were appointed as Executive Directors this year, will receive ₹5 crore salary each in 2021-22. Both of them earned ₹3.5 crore in 2020-21, while CFO Vikas Bhasin received ₹3.1-crore compensation. Each independent director earns ₹1,00,000 sitting fee per meeting and will earn ₹24 lakh annually till 2024.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Amazon terms ED's probe into 2019 deal as 'fishing, roving', moves Delhi HC: Report
text: Amazon has reportedly filed a petition in the Delhi High Court, seeking relief from ED's probe into its 2019 deal with Future Group. Amazon accused ED of conducting a "fishing and roving enquiry" against it, Reuters reported citing a court filing. It also said multiple executives had been summoned by the ED in recent weeks, which amounts to "unnecessary harassment".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt asks phone firms to keep call records for 2 yrs for security reasons
text: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) has asked telecom and internet service providers to maintain commercial and call detail records for at least two years, instead of the current one-year practice, for security reasons. "Many security agencies pointed out...that they needed data even after a year since most investigations take more than that to be completed," a senior DoT official said.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: IT Dept raids offices of Chinese mobile firms OPPO, OnePlus, others in India: Report
text: The Income Tax Department is conducting searches on leading Chinese mobile companies across the country, said reports. Mobile companies OPPO, Xiaomi, and OnePlus are being covered in the searches, according to ANI. Over two dozen premises are being raided in the searches. The searches were reportedly conducted based on the intelligence inputs of huge tax evasion by these firms.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: Deadline for tokenisation of credit, debit cards extended to June 30, 2022
text: RBI on Thursday extended deadline for card tokenisation to June 30, 2022. "In addition to tokenisation, industry stakeholders may devise alternate mechanisms to handle...recurring e-mandates and EMI option, or post-transaction activity that currently involves/requires storage of CoF data by entities other than card issuers and card networks," said RBI. The earlier deadline was December 31, 2021.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: ₹1 crore fine each imposed by RBI on One Mobikwik Systems, Spice Money
text: RBI has imposed monetary penalty on two payment system operators, One Mobikwik Systems Private Limited and Spice Money Limited, for violation of norms. They've been fined ₹1 crore each. "These actions are based on deficiencies in regulatory compliance and are not intended to pronounce upon...validity of any transaction or agreement entered into by the entities with...customers," said RBI.
author: Daisy Mowke

headlines: McDonald's halts sale of large French fries in Japan amid potato supply crunch
text: McDonald's Japan has said that it will suspend selling medium and large-sized French fries for a week starting Friday as COVID-19-led supply chain issues and floods in Canada delay potato shipments. The fast-food company will continue to sell small-sized French fries in Japan. The potatoes used for the French fries are imported from North America, it said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Which are India's 5 most valuable state-controlled companies of 2021 as per Hurun?
text: According to 2021 Burgundy Private Hurun India 500 list, State Bank of India with a value of ₹4.65 lakh crore is India's most valuable state-controlled company of 2021. This is followed by Oil and Natural Gas Corporation (₹1.92 lakh crore), NTPC (₹1.32 lakh crore), Power Grid Corporation of India (₹1.29 lakh crore) and Indian Oil Corporation (₹1.23 lakh crore).
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Expect a dozen chipmakers to begin local production in 2-3 yrs: Govt
text: Information Technology Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in an interview with BloombergTV said at least a dozen semiconductor manufacturers are expected to start local production in the next two to three years. He revealed that all the big players in the industry are in talks with Indian partners and many want to come directly to set up their units in India.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Amazon seeks CCI's nod to buy Catamaran's stake in Prione: Report
text: Amazon is seeking CCI's approval to buy Catamaran Ventures' stake in Prione, TechCrunch reported. Catamaran owns 76% stake in Prione, while Amazon earlier held 49%, but diluted it down to 24% to comply with the local laws. Catamaran and Amazon had launched the joint venture in India in 2014. However, in August they announced they will be ending the partnership.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: No confidence in govt's understanding of crypto: Former Finance Secretary
text: Former Finance Secretary Subhash Chandra Garg said that he has no confidence in the government's ability of understanding complexities of cryptocurrency. He said this after the government failed to table the Cryptocurrency and Regulation of Official Digital Currency Bill in the Parliament. "I am not surprised to see...zero clarity over what is the Bill," Garg told IANS.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: CIA seeks GST exemption, fresh NPA norms for MSMEs in Budget 2022
text: The Consortium of Indian Associations (CIA) has sought in Budget 2022 that MSMEs with a turnover of up to ₹5 crore be exempted from GST for 12 months. CIA also recommended that non-performing assets (NPAs) be considered for MSMEs 120 days after missing an EMI and that raw material ration-cum-fair price shops be established to tackle inflating raw material costs.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India added 1.3 GW of rooftop solar installations from Jan-Sept: Report
text: According to the Mercom India Rooftop Solar Market Report Q3 2021, India added 1.3 gigawatt (GW) of rooftop solar installations (RSI) between January and September 2021. This marks a 202% year-on-year (YoY) increase. Additionally, between July and September, India added 448 megawatt of RSI, a 189% YoY increase. "Market [is]...showing signs of recovery," said Raj Prabhu, CEO, Mercom Capital Group.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Omicron may cast shadow on recovering Indian economy: RBI Governor
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that the Indian economy is facing severe headwinds due to global factors emanating from Omicron's spread, according to the minutes of the Monetary Policy Committee meeting. "Supply disruptions, other bottlenecks...gained additional shelf life stretching into 2022," Das said and added, "Omicron may cast some shadow on services that were showing signs of recovery."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Centre working to bring changes in GST Act: BJP's Jayant Sinha
text: BJP leader and Chairman of the Parliamentary Standing Committee on Finance Jayant Sinha said that the government is working to bring changes in the GST Act and other public platforms. He said that GST is fast becoming the backbone of the country. The changes, Sinha said, will aim to aid companies utilise data to grow big in size and scale.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Jhunjhunwala-backed Metro Brands' shares list at 12.8% discount
text: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Metro Brands' shares listed at a 12.8% discount to the issue price today. The stock opened at ₹436 on the BSE against the final offer price of ₹500 per share, while the listing price on the NSE was ₹437. The three-day ₹1,367.5 crore IPO of Metro Brands was subscribed 3.64 times on the last day of bidding.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Kotak Mahindra acquires Ford Credit India's vehicle finance portfolio
text: Kotak Mahindra Prime Limited (KMPL) today said it has acquired Ford Credit India's vehicle financing portfolio. KMPL said in an exchange filing that the deal is expected to give it access to 16,000 "high-quality" customers with total loan outstanding of ₹425 crore. "The acquisition...reiterates our commitment to grow our vehicle financing business," Vyomesh Kapasi, MD, KMPL, said in the filing.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: MedPlus Health's shares list at 30% premium over issue price
text: Shares of pharmacy retailer MedPlus Health listed at ₹1,040 per share on the NSE, a premium of over 30% as compared to its IPO issue price of ₹796 apiece. The shares started the trade on its first day at ₹1,015 on the BSE. MedPlus had fixed the price band for its ₹1,398.29-crore IPO at ₹780-₹796 per share.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Our booster dose appears to protect against Omicron: Moderna after initial study
text: Moderna has said that initial lab tests showed that a booster dose of its COVID-19 vaccine appeared to protect against the new Omicron variant. A 50-microgram booster dose increased neutralising antibodies against the variant 37 fold, the company said. It added that a 100-microgram booster drove neutralising antibodies to more than 80 times pre-boost levels.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Cardi B asks if crypto will replace US dollar, Jack Dorsey replies 'Bitcoin will'
text: After American rapper Cardi B asked on Twitter whether cryptocurrency is going to replace the US dollar, Twitter's Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey replied, "Yes, Bitcoin will." Dorsey, who stepped down as Twitter CEO last month, had earlier said, "Bitcoin changes absolutely everything...If [Bitcoin] needed more help than Square (now, Block) or Twitter, I would leave them for Bitcoin."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: US millionaire's friends file sticky notes to claim share in $500 mn estate: Report
text: American online clothing retailer Zappos' late millionaire Founder Tony Hsieh's friends have filed sticky notes as evidence in court to stake claim in his $500 million estate, reported WSJ. Hsieh died in November last year from injuries sustained in a house fire in Connecticut. The 46-year-old, who struggled with alcohol and drug use and mental-health issues, didn't leave a will.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Bitcoin jumps most in a day since November, climbs back above $49,000
text: Bitcoin climbed back above $49,000 in New York trading on Tuesday, marking its biggest single-day gain since November. The world's largest cryptocurrency rose as much as 5% to $49,331, before paring some of its gains. Bitcoin had slumped about 30% over the past five weeks after hitting a record high of nearly $69,000 in early November.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Husband-wife duo who founded MapmyIndia worth $586 mn after IPO
text: Husband-wife duo Rakesh Verma and Rashmi Verma, who founded MapmyIndia more than two decades ago, are jointly worth about $586 million after their startup's IPO, according to Bloomberg. The digital mapping services startup's stock rose around 35% to ₹1,393.65 on its market debut on Tuesday. The husband-and-wife team owns nearly 54% of the company post IPO.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: MapmyIndia shares list at a 53% premium on market debut
text: The shares of CE Info Systems, the parent company of digital mapping company MapmyIndia, were listed at a 53% premium on their market debut on Tuesday. The stock made its debut at ₹1,581, a gain of 53.04% from the issue price of ₹1,033 on the BSE. MapmyIndia IPO was subscribed 154.71 times on the last day of subscription last week.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Elon Musk's Tesla loses all gains made since Hertz announced 1,00,000 cars order
text: Billionaire Elon Musk-led Tesla has erased all gains it made from a 35% stock rally that followed US car rental company Hertz's announcement in October that it ordered 1,00,000 Tesla cars. Tesla's market capitalisation had crossed $1 trillion in October, however, the stock has fallen 21% in December so far. The stock fell after CEO Musk offloaded his company stake.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Who are Rakesh and Rashmi Verma, the husband-wife duo behind MapmyIndia?
text: The husband-wife duo behind recently-listed MapmyIndia is 71-year-old Rakesh and 65-year-old Rashmi Verma. BITS Pilani passout Rakesh and IIT Roorkee passout Rashmi, studied at the Eastern Washington University and quit their 12-year career in the US to return to India in the 1990s. They began MapmyIndia as CE Info Systems in 1995 and are now worth $586 million after IPO.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Influencer known as China's 'live streaming queen' fined $210 m for tax evasion
text: Chinese influencer Huang Wei, who is widely regarded as the country's "queen of live streaming" has been fined 1.34 billion yuan ($210.16 million) for tax evasion. The 36-year-old, who goes by the name 'Viya', was accused of failing to disclose her personal income in 2019 and 2020. In a statement, she apologised for the tax violations and 'accepted the punishment'.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Walmart sued for illegally dumping over a million toxic items a year in California
text: California officials have sued Walmart, accusing the world's largest retailer of illegally dumping pesticides, lithium batteries and other hazardous materials in landfills across the state. The suit referred to Walmart as a "repeat offender" and said that it unlawfully disposes 159,600 pounds of toxic waste each year amounting to over a million items. Walmart referred the lawsuit as "unjustified".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Officer's Choice whisky maker plans IPO at over ₹18,800 crore valuation: Report
text: Mumbai-based Allied Blenders & Distillers, which makes Officer's Choice whisky, Kyron brandy, Jolly Roger rum and other spirits, is considering an IPO, Bloomberg reported. The company could raise as much as $300 million (over ₹2,260 crore) and is seeking a valuation of at least $2.5 billion (over ₹18,800 crore). It plans to file preliminary documents by the Q1 of 2022.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Zee Entertainment, Sony India sign merger agreement; Punit Goenka to be CEO
text: Sony Pictures Networks India (SPNI) and Zee Entertainment Enterprises on Wednesday announced the signing of definitive agreements to merge the two companies. As per the deal, Sony Pictures Entertainment (SPE) will indirectly hold 50.86% stake in the merged entity, ZEEL founders will hold 3.99% and public shareholders will hold 45.15%. Punit Goenka will be the MD and CEO of entity.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Indian rupee to be worst-performing currency in Asia in 2021: Report
text: The Indian rupee is set to end 2021 as Asia's worst-performing currency, as per Bloomberg. It has declined 1.9% in this quarter as global funds pulled $4.2 billion of capital out of India's stock market, the most among regional markets where data is available, Bloomberg reported. Earlier, Goldman Sachs and Nomura lowered their outlook for Indian equities, citing expensive valuations.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: P&G recalls over 30 hair care products over cancer-causing chemical in US
text: Procter & Gamble Company (P&G) has recalled over 30 hair care products in the US due to the presence of the cancer-causing agent benzene. The recalled products include dry conditioner and dry shampoo sprays from Pantene, Herbal Essences, Old Spice and other brands. Notably, exposure to benzene can result in leukemia, blood cancer of the bone marrow and blood disorders.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: iPhone maker Foxconn to shut TN plant for 5 days amid workers' protests
text: Foxconn, which makes Apple's iPhones, will shut its plant in Tamil Nadu's Sriperumbudur for five days this week, the Superintendent of Police in Kancheepuram said. This comes after 150 employees were hospitalised due to food poisoning, sparking protests by plant workers and their relatives on the Chennai-Bengaluru national highway. Several protestors who had been detained were released on Monday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla rival Nikola to pay $125 mn over Founder's misleading statements
text: Tesla rival Nikola has agreed to pay $125 million to US SEC over allegedly misleading statements made by its Founder and former CEO Trevor Milton to investors about the electric-vehicle startup. "Nikola is responsible both for Milton's allegedly misleading statements and for other alleged deceptions, all of which falsely portrayed the true state of the company," SEC's enforcement director said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk's SpaceX reports 132 COVID-19 cases at California headquarters
text: Billionaire Elon Musk-led SpaceX has had an outbreak of 132 coronavirus cases at its headquarters in Hawthorne, California, as per the Los Angeles County Health Department. The outbreak is the largest among businesses in Los Angeles County. Last year, Musk had defied COVID-19 restrictions imposed by the local authorities and resumed operations at his Tesla factory in Alameda County, California.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's auto component manufacturing marks 65% YoY increase: ACMA
text: Automotive Component Manufacturers Association of India (ACMA) announced on Tuesday that India's automotive component manufacturing industry witnessed a turnover of ₹1.96 lakh crore between April and September 2021. This marks a 65% year-on-year (YoY) increase. The industry's exports also saw a growth of 76% between the same period in comparison to last year, rising to ₹68,746 crore.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Bipin and I will not sell any shares in the IPO: MobiKwik Co-founder
text: MobiKwik Co-founder Upasana Taku told Business Insider that one of the fintech startup's Co-founders Bipin Preet Singh and she have decided not to sell any shares in the initial public offering (IPO). "I am told that it's a positive signal that promoters are so gung-ho about their business that they don't want to sell at the current issue," Taku said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: McDonald's to sell AI startup Dynamic Yield to Mastercard
text: McDonald's on Tuesday announced that it has signed an agreement to sell Dynamic Yield, an artificial intelligence (AI) startup, to Mastercard for an undisclosed amount. McDonald's had acquired the startup in 2019 for more than $300 million in its biggest deal in two decades. Dynamic Yield's technology is used to personalise menus and browsing options online and at physical stores.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Adar Poonawalla acquires a 20% stake in JetSynthesys' Wakau
text: Serum Institute of India's CEO Adar Poonawalla has acquired a 20% stake in Wakau Interactive, a subsidiary of digital entertainment and technology company JetSynthesys, for an undisclosed amount. Poonawalla joins Bollywood actor Amitabh Bachchan as one of Wakau's investors. "New content formats like short entertainment and fashion videos are gaining wide-scale popularity," Poonawalla said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: IOCL acquires 4.93% equity stake in Indian Gas Exchange
text: The Indian Oil Corporation Limited (IOCL) said on Tuesday that it has acquired a 4.93% stake in Indian Gas Exchange Limited, India's first automated national level gas exchange. "The Board...accorded approval for acquisition of 36,93,750 shares with face value of ₹10 each," IOCL said in a statement. Indian Gas Exchange Limited is regulated by Petroleum and Natural Gas Regulatory Board.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: UK offers £1 billion to hospitality businesses affected by Omicron
text: The UK announced on Tuesday it will offer £1 billion in grants to the hospitality industry hit by the spread of the Omicron variant of COVID-19, after pressure from several business groups. Businesses in the hospitality industry will be eligible for one-time grants up to £6,000 each (over ₹6,00,000). New COVID-19 infections spiked by 60% in a week.
author: Veer Badani

headlines: Trump sues New York Attorney General to block inquiry into his company
text: Former US President Donald Trump has sued New York Attorney General Letitia James seeking to block her from continuing to investigate his company. The lawsuit comes after it was reported that James' office would seek to question Trump as it probes whether the Trump Organization manipulated the valuations of its real estate properties. Trump alleged the probe is "politically motivated".
author: Athira Sasidharan

headlines: YES Bank's board approves plan to raise up to ₹10,000 crore
text: YES Bank has received its board's approval to raise up to ₹10,000 crore, the private lender informed the exchanges in a regulatory filing on Tuesday. The board has approved raising of funds by issue of equity shares, depository receipts, convertible bonds, debentures, warrants, or any other equity-linked securities. The bank said it will now seek approval from its shareholders.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Unitech's ex-promoters arrested by ED in money laundering case
text: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has arrested Unitech's ex-promoters Sanjay and Ajay Chandra in a money laundering case. Officials said the brothers, who were earlier lodged in a Mumbai jail, were brought to Delhi on Monday. The arrests were made after the Supreme Court allowed the ED to carry out custodial interrogation of the brothers on the basis of new evidence.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ED probing Supertech after money laundering complaints: MoS Finance
text: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said the Enforcement Directorate (ED) has initiated an investigation against Supertech, its directors, promoters, and others. The probe is based upon several FIRs, under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act, 2002, he told the Rajya Sabha. It concerns entire Supertech Group and isn't limited to any particular residential project, he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: What is the Panama Papers case in which Aishwarya was questioned by ED?
text: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan appeared before the ED for questioning in a case linked to the 2016 'Panama Papers' global tax leaks. Leaked papers showed Aishwarya and her family members were in 2005 appointed as directors of Amic Partners under the laws of the British Virgin Islands. The process to wind up the company was initiated in 2008 after Aishwarya-Abhishek's marriage.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I will pay over $11 billion in taxes this year: World's richest person Musk
text: World's richest person Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "For those wondering, I will pay over $11 billion in taxes this year." The Tesla CEO's tweet comes days after he had a Twitter spat with US Senator Elizabeth Warren over taxes and called her "Senator Karen". Musk had earlier said he'll pay "more taxes than any American in history this year".
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Better.com CEO wanted to give 900 fired staff only 1-2 weeks of severance pay: Report
text: Better.com CEO Vishal Garg, who laid off 900 employees on Zoom call, initially wanted to give them one or two weeks of severance pay, Business Insider reported citing current and former employees. Garg offered four weeks of severance after executives reportedly pushed for a longer period. The number was further raised to 60 days after lawyers threatened to sue Better.com.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Snapdeal files papers for IPO, offer includes fresh issue of ₹1,250 crore
text: SoftBank-backed Snapdeal on Tuesday filed its draft papers for an initial public offering (IPO), which comprises a fresh issue of equity shares worth ₹1,250 crore. The IPO also comprises an offer for sale of up to 3.07 crore equity shares by existing shareholders. Kunal Bahl and Rohit Bansal, who founded the Delhi-based e-commerce startup in 2010, won't dilute their stake.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex jumps 900 points after crashing 1,100 points on Monday amid Omicron fears
text: The Sensex jumped more than 900 points on Tuesday to trade at 56,700 levels after crashing over 1,100 points on the previous day amid concerns over the Omicron COVID-19 variant. Meanwhile, the broader Nifty 50 jumped over 260 points to trade near the 16,900-mark. Tata Steel, HCL Tech, Tech Mahindra and Wipro were among the top Sensex gainers.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex plunges 1,000 points, Nifty slips below 16,700
text: Sensex plunged 1,000 points to sit near 56,000 in the opening session, while Nifty slipped below 16,700 to around 16,677. Shares of Future Retail jumped 18% after India's antitrust agency suspended Amazon's 2019 deal with Future Group on Friday. Among Nifty stocks, 47 out of the 50 were in the red today.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: SEBI bans futures trading in 7 agricultural commodities for one year
text: Markets regulator SEBI on Monday barred futures trading in five more commodities - paddy (non-basmati), wheat, soybean and its derivatives, crude palm oil and moong - for one year. The derivative contracts in chana, and mustard seeds and its derivatives, had already been suspended. This comes amid the retail inflation surging to a three-month-high of 4.91% in November 2021.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: ICICI once refused to give credit card to me, then-MD Kamath arranged it later: Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari recently revealed that ICICI Bank had once refused to issue a credit card to him. He said when he met the bank's then-MD KV Kamath, he told him about this. "Kamath said the bank has a policy that they don't issue credit cards to lawyers and politicians. Later, he arranged one immediately for me," Gadkari added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: IDBI Bank says diamond group owes ₹16.72 cr after report claims ₹6,710 cr default
text: After a report claimed that diamond firm Sanghavi Exports International defaulted on loans worth ₹6,710 crore to IDBI Bank, the bank issued a clarification saying the report contained "factual inaccuracies". The Mumbai-based group's account is a non-performing asset, but current principal outstanding is only ₹16.72 crore, it said. The bank added that it initiated requisite actions to recover dues.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: ₹9 lakh crore investor wealth wiped off as markets crash amid Omicron worries
text: Over ₹9 lakh crore wealth of investors was wiped off on Monday as stock markets mirrored the weak global trends amid Omicron worries and Sensex and Nifty slumped nearly 3%. While the Sensex ended 1,189 points lower at 55,822, Nifty slumped 371 points to end at 16,614. In the last two months, ₹25 lakh crore of investor wealth has eroded.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex crashes over 1,000 points to end at 55,822 amid Omicron worries
text: The benchmark indices ended lower for the second consecutive session on Monday on rising concern over the Omicron variant. At close, the Sensex was down 1,189.73 points or 2.09% at 55,822.01, and the Nifty was down 371 points or 2.18%, at 16,614.20. BPCL, Tata Steel, Tata Motors, IndusInd Bank and SBI were among the top Nifty losers.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Oracle to buy Cerner for $28 billion in its biggest acquisition ever
text: Oracle on Monday announced that it will buy electronic medical records company Cerner in an all-cash deal for approximately $28.3 billion, marking the enterprise software maker's biggest acquisition ever. Cerner shareholders will receive $95 per share, representing a premium of 5.8% to the company's closing price on Friday. The deal is expected to close in 2022, the company said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Messed up lie: Musk on US Senator's ads calling him 'freeloading billionaire'
text: World's richest person Elon Musk reacted to a Twitter post showing Facebook ads purchased by US Senator Elizabeth Warren, calling Musk a "freeloading billionaire". Musk said, "This is such a deeply messed up lie to the American people...She is the one freeloading off taxpayers." He claimed he will be paying the largest amount of tax than any individual in history.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Wipro to acquire US-based cybersecurity firm Edgile for $230 million
text: Wipro on Monday announced it has signed an agreement to acquire US-headquartered Edgile for $230 million (approximately ₹1,744 crore). Founded in 2001, Edgile is a privately held company and has an on-site workforce of 182 employees. Wipro expects the transaction will be completed before March 31, 2022, subject to regulatory approvals and customary closing conditions.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Future Group companies' shares rally after CCI revokes Amazon deal
text: Shares of Future Group companies on Monday rallied 20% after the Competition Commission of India (CCI) suspended Amazon's 2019 investment in Future Coupons and imposed a ₹202-crore fine on the e-commerce giant. Future Retail shares gained 19.92% to hit the upper circuit of ₹57.50 on NSE and shares of Future Consumer, Future Supply and Future Enterprise also rose nearly 20%.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: CCI order shows Amazon deliberately dodged Indian laws: CAIT
text: Competition Commission of India (CCI) ordered suspension of Amazon-Future Group's deal and imposed a ₹202 crore fine on Amazon. Reacting to this, the Confederation of All India Traders said on Sunday that the order concludes that Amazon deliberately attempted to dodge Indian laws and policies. Amazon had proposed to buy a 49% minority stake in Future Coupons under the deal.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: ixigo gets SEBI's approval for ₹1,600-crore IPO
