text: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has approved the ₹1,600-crore initial public offering (IPO) of Le Travenues Technology, which operates travel platform ixigo. The offer comprises a fresh issue of shares worth ₹750 crore and an offer-for-sale of ₹850 crore. As part of OFS, ixigo Co-founders Aloke Bajpai and Rajnish Kumar will divest stakes worth ₹50 crore each.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Axis Bank may be highest bidder for Citi's India retail business: Reports
text: Axis Bank may be the highest bidder for Citibank's India retail business, CNBC TV 18 reported on Monday citing sources. Axis Bank is also reportedly likely to strike an all-cash deal with Citibank, which could be worth $1.5 billion, the news channel said. Reportedly, Kotak Mahindra Bank and Induslnd Bank are also in the race to buy Citibank's assets.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: 9-10% growth expected in current fiscal year: CEOs in CII poll
text: Indian economy is set for a growth of 9-10% in the current fiscal year, according to 56% of CEOs polled by the Confederation of Indian Industry (CII). About 10% of the CEOs polled, however, think that growth could exceed even the 10% mark. Many CEOs also said they are worried about Omicron's potential effect on the services and manufacturing sectors.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: PM interacts with CEOs of top companies ahead of Budget
text: PM Narendra Modi on Monday interacted with the CEOs of companies from various sectors of industry. "We discussed various aspects relating to the economy. The CEOs shared insightful suggestions for the upcoming Budget," PM said. Just like India aspires for a podium finish at Olympics, it wants to see its industries among world's top five in every sector, he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Vedanta acquires Nicomet, becomes India's sole nickel producer
text: Vedanta Resources on Monday said it acquired leading nickel and cobalt producer Nicomet and became India's only nickel producer. A company statement said that the acquisition is a significant step in making India self-reliant in key minerals. Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal said, "India currently imports 100% of its nickel requirement. Our focus will be to boost India's domestic production."
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: World Economic Forum's Davos Summit postponed due to Omicron
text: The World Economic Forum (WEF) has deferred its annual summit, which is usually held in Switzerland's Davos, until mid-2022, Sky News reported on Monday citing communication from organisers. The Davos Summit was planned to be held in January 2022 but has been postponed amid rising Omicron cases globally. The annual summit is a gathering of global business and political leaders.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: International banks in UAE to switch to Mon-Fri work week from Jan
text: Several international banks operating in the United Arab Emirates (UAE) are set to adopt a Monday-Friday work week from January 2022. Wall Street-based JPMorgan Chase & Co and France's Societe Generale said they will implement a Saturday-Sunday weekend from January. UAE recently announced that it will adopt a four-and-a-half day working week with a Saturday-Sunday weekend from January 1, 2022.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tata Group's acquisition of Air India approved by CCI
text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Monday approved Tata Group's acquisition of Air India, Air India Express and Air India SATS Airport Services. In October, Talace, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Tata Sons, had won the bid to acquire Air India for ₹18,000 crore. The amount includes a cash payment of ₹2,700 crore and taking over ₹15,300 crore debt.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ₹13,109 cr recovered from assets sale of Nirav Modi, Mallya, Choksi: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said a total of ₹13,109.17 crore has been recovered from assets sale of defaulters Nirav Modi, Vijay Mallya and Mehul Choksi, as of July. She said ₹792 crore was also realised from sale of assets belonging to Mallya and others. PSBs recovered ₹5.49 lakh crore through resolution of bad loans in last seven years, she added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ATL completes one of India's largest intra-state transmission lines in UP
text: Adani Transmission Limited (ATL), a part of the Adani Group, has completed construction of one of India's largest intra-state transmission lines of 897 circuit kilometres in Uttar Pradesh. The line has been built on a Build, Own, Operate, Maintain (BOOM) basis. "Completion of this project even during the pandemic is a significant achievement," said Anil Sardana, CEO and MD, ATL.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: China Evergrande Founder's wealth plunges by $17.2 billion in 2021
text: China's eight real estate tycoons have seen their wealth plunge in 2021, with China Evergrande Group's Founder Hui Ka Yan leading the decline. Hui, who was Asia's second-richest person with a fortune of $42 billion in 2017, lost $17.2 billion this year, reported Bloomberg. Hui's current net worth stands at $6.1 billion as shares of his companies' units have tumbled.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Serum Institute's Covovax COVID-19 vaccine gets WHO approval for emergency use
text: The World Health Organization (WHO) on Friday issued an emergency use listing (EUL) for the Covovax COVID-19 vaccine manufactured by Serum Institute of India. SII CEO Adar Poonawalla called it "another milestone in our fight against COVID-19". Covovax is the ninth COVID-19 vaccine that's been granted EUL, WHO said, adding that its listing will increase vaccine access in lower-income countries.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: 150 employees hospitalised after food poisoning at iPhone maker Foxconn in TN
text: Over 150 employees, who work at a Foxconn factory that makes Apple's iPhones in Tamil Nadu's Sriperumbudur, were hospitalised for food poisoning this week. "There was an outbreak of acute diarrhoea reported among the Foxconn employees," the Thiruvallur district administration said. As many as 256 workers were treated as out-patients and 159 were hospitalised, of whom 155 have been discharged.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: It feels different to leave the addiction of monthly salary: Ex-Twitter India head
text: Twitter India's former head Manish Maheshwari, who quit Twitter this month to launch his edtech startup Invact Metaversity, tweeted, "It feels different to leave the addiction of monthly salary." His tweet received various reactions, with MBA dropout Prafull Billore, who founded MBA Chai Wala, tweeting, "Welcome to the club." A Twitter user also wrote, "You're going to miss that SMS."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: RBI tells board it favours a complete ban on cryptos: Report
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) conveyed to its central board that it favours a complete ban on cryptocurrencies, The Economic Times reported. In a detailed presentation, RBI highlighted "serious concerns" relating to financial stability and exchange management. As per RBI's statement, "The board discussed various aspects relating to central bank digital currency and private cryptocurrencies."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: JPMorgan employees discuss business on WhatsApp, firm to pay $125 mn fine
text: JPMorgan Chase subsidiary JP Morgan Securities will pay a $125-million penalty to the US SEC over its business recordkeeping. From at least January 2018 through November 2020, its employees often communicated about business matters on their personal devices, using text messages, WhatsApp, and personal email accounts. None of these records were preserved as required by the federal securities laws.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I refused to see age as a handicap: Falguni Nayar who founded Nykaa at 50
text: Nykaa's billionaire CEO Falguni Nayar at FICCI's 94th Annual Convention said, "When I decided to start Nykaa at 50 with no experience in beauty, technology, or retail, it was all a learning curve." She said she refused to see "age as a handicap". "I wasn't an engineer, I'm not from IIT...but I was ready to ask stupid questions," Nayar added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Amazon stands exposed: CAIT as CCI revokes Amazon-Future Coupons deal
text: The Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT) has welcomed the Competition Commission of India's (CCI) order suspending Amazon's 2019 deal with Future Group's Future Coupons and penalising the e-commerce giant for ₹200 crore. "Amazon stands fully exposed for its malpractices and the trading community of India under the flag of CAIT stands vindicated," its Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: World's topmost organisations have Indian CEOs: Rajnath Singh
text: Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh at FICCI's 94th Annual General Meeting said that the world's topmost organisations have Indian CEOs. "India is an emerging economy that has started moving towards growth. We have trained, scientific, technological and managerial talent," he said. Recently, Twitter and Chanel named Indian-origin Parag Agrawal and Leena Nair as their CEOs, respectively.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Rejected Reliance's tender as state minister once, saved ₹2,000 crore: Gadkari
text: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari recalled that he had rejected a tender by Reliance for the Mumbai-Pune express highway as Maharashtra minister in 1995. "My CM was also upset and so was Balasaheb Thackeray...Reliance had quoted ₹3,600 crore. We rejected it and completed the project through the MSRDC at a cost of ₹1,600 crore. We saved ₹2,000 crore," he stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: CNG, PNG prices increased for 2nd time in 3 weeks in Mumbai from today
text: For the second time in three weeks, Maharashtra government-run Mahanagar Gas Limited (MGL) has hiked the prices of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) and Piped Natural Gas (PNG) in Mumbai from December 17 midnight. The price of CNG is increased by ₹2 per kilogram and PNG by ₹1.50 per standard cubic metre. Over eight lakh consumers will reportedly be impacted.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: World Bank approves $195 million loan for Pakistan
text: The World Bank has approved $195 million in financing for Pakistan. It will help in improving electricity distribution and implementing energy sector reforms to increase service quality for consumers in Pakistan. The Electricity Distribution Efficiency Improvement Project (EDEIP) will also invest in climate-resilient infrastructure, particularly grid stations and transmission lines.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Asia's richest man Mukesh Ambani names 5 best books of 2021
text: Asia's richest man and Reliance Industries Limited Chairman Mukesh Ambani has named five best books of 2021 according to him. The books include 'Ten Lessons for a Post-Pandemic World', 'Principles for Dealing With the Changing World Order: Why Nations Succeed and Fail' and '2030: How Today's Biggest Trends Will Collide and Reshape the Future of Everything' among others.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Emirati billionaire Majid Al Futtaim, who once worked as a bank clerk, passes away
text: Emirati billionaire Majid Al Futtaim, who once worked as a bank clerk, has passed away. Dubai ruler Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum announced Al Futtaim's death in a post on Twitter on Friday, and wrote, "May God have mercy on...one of Dubai's most important merchants and senior men." The cause behind his death and his age haven't been announced.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: Amazon delays plan to ban phones in warehouses as tornado kills 6 in US
text: Amazon is delaying its plans to ban cell phones in warehouses, allowing employees to keep their devices with them at work "until further notice". The development comes after six workers died at an Amazon facility in Illinois as it was struck by a tornado last week. Amazon has, for years, prohibited employees from having their phones on warehouse floors.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: China may ban online brokerages from offering offshore trading: Report
text: Chinese officials are planning to ban online brokerages such as Futu Holdings and UP Fintech from offering offshore trading services to mainland clients, Reuters reported citing sources. Firms affected by the crackdown are likely to be notified of a ban in "the coming months". Futu said it had been communicating with authorities but had not received any formal orders.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: China's Alibaba pledges carbon neutrality by 2030
text: China's Alibaba has announced that it will aim to achieve carbon neutrality in its own operations by 2030. The company also pledged to cut overall CO2 across all its businesses by 1.5 gigatonnes by 2035. It plans to deploy new energy-saving, high-efficiency technologies, make further use of renewables and also explore "carbon removal initiatives".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Indian-origin Anand Eswaran named Veeam Software's new CEO
text: Switzerland-headquartered data protection and backup software maker Veeam Software has named Indian-origin Anand Eswaran as its new CEO. Prior to joining Veeam, Eswaran was RingCentral's Chief Operating Officer and President. He holds a master's degree in computer science and engineering from University of Missouri, Columbia and a bachelor's degree in computer engineering from Mumbai University.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: NYPD mulling $12.36 million deal with Tesla for 250 cars: Report
text: The New York City Police Department (NYPD) is planning to purchase as many as 250 fully electric Model 3 sedans from Tesla, Bloomberg reported. The deal is expected to be worth about $12.36 million, with the NYPD paying $51,940 for each vehicle, as per a draft of the procurement contract. The NYPD bought a Model 3 for $47,740 in June.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Sharp drops in stock prices of new-age tech firms scary: Zerodha CEO
text: Zerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath took to Twitter to say that the "sharp drops in stock prices of listed new-age tech companies across the world is quite scary". "If history is a guide, only a small percentage of them will maybe bounce back," he added. He said companies, when projecting growth, should prioritise lower volatility long-term versus maximum short-term gain.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tesla sued over CEO Elon Musk's Twitter poll on stock sale
text: Tesla is being sued by an investor over its CEO Elon Musk's social media posts including his Twitter poll asking users whether he should sell 10% of his Tesla stock. The lawsuit alleges that Musk's tweets "ultimately have an impact on Tesla's stock prices". "It is unclear who at Tesla, if anyone, is currently reviewing Musk's tweets," the suit says.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Fraud-accused Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes' case goes to jury
text: The criminal fraud case of blood-testing startup Theranos' Founder Elizabeth Holmes has been handed to the jury after the prosecution and defence wrapped up closing arguments. If convicted, Holmes, who pleaded not guilty, faces up to 20 years in prison. Theranos was founded in 2003 after Holmes dropped out of Stanford and was valued at $9 billion before it collapsed.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Vedanta Chairman meets Raj CM, says 'discussed investment opportunities'
text: Vedanta's billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal on Saturday tweeted that he met Ashok Gehlot, the Chief Minister of Rajasthan. "We discussed the investment opportunities in natural resources and job creation potential in Rajasthan with focus on inclusive development of the communities," Agarwal wrote on Twitter. "I am sure that under your leadership the state will reach new heights," he further said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Airtel prepays ₹15,519 cr in liability for spectrum acquired in 2014
text: Bharti Airtel has paid ₹15,519 crore to the Department of Telecom towards prepayment of the entire deferred liabilities pertaining to spectrum acquired in 2014 auction. Airtel said it had acquired 128.4 MHz spectrum (including Telenor spectrum) for ₹19,051 crore in the auction. The company expects an interest cost savings of ₹3,400 crore over the residual life for fully substituted capital.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Plan on course for LIC IPO in last quarter of this fiscal: DIPAM Secy
text: The Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey has refuted reports stating that the Life Insurance Corporation's (LIC) initial public offering (IPO) is unlikely to take place in the current financial year ending March 2022. "It is reiterated that plan is on course for the IPO in the last quarter of this fiscal," Pandey said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ArcelorMittal Nippon to invest ₹1.02 lakh cr to build steel plant in Odisha
text: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India has received approval from the Odisha government to set up a 24 million tonnes-a-year steel plant in the Kendrapara district. The facility will produce steel using the latest green steel-making technology and will also produce 18.75 million tonnes of cement annually. The company will invest ₹1.02 lakh crore which will create direct employment for 16,000 people.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Foxconn India's workers hospitalised after food poisoning: Report
text: Several employees of a Foxconn India unit, which makes iPhones for Apple, were hospitalised after a bout of food poisoning, reported Reuters. The food poisoning reportedly occurred earlier this week at the company's dormitories. On Saturday, hundreds of Foxconn workers staged a protest on the Chennai-Bengaluru national highway demanding to know the status of their colleagues, TOI reported.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's most valuable startup BYJU'S to go public through SPAC deal: Report
text: India's most valuable startup BYJU'S is in advanced talks to go public through a merger with one of Churchill Capital's special-purpose acquisition companies (SPAC), Bloomberg reported on Thursday. BYJU'S would raise a total of $4 billion at a valuation of about $48 billion. BYJU'S is the world's 13th most valuable startup with a $21 billion valuation, according to CB Insights.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: CCI suspends Amazon-Future 2019 deal, imposes ₹200-crore fine on Amazon: Report
text: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has revoked its clearance to Amazon's 2019 deal with Future Coupons, a unit of Future Retail Ltd, Reuters reported. The competition regulator also reportedly imposed a fine of over ₹200 crore on the e-commerce giant for concealing facts. This comes amid Amazon-Future legal battle over Future's deal with Reliance Retail to sell its assets.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Bezos should spend less time in hot tub & more at Blue Origin: Musk
text: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in an interview discussing Blue Origin's Jeff Bezos said, "As a friend of mine says, he should spend more time at Blue Origin and less time in the hot tub." Musk added Bezos has a "reasonably good engineering aptitude", but he doesn't seem to want to use his "mental energy getting into the details of engineering".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: India likely to become fastest growing economy in 2021-22: Amit Shah
text: Union Home Affairs Minister Amit Shah on Friday said that India is likely to become the fastest growing economy in the world in the year 2021-2022. "We are reaching the pre-COVID-19 levels...I will not be surprised if we touch double-digit growth," he added. Shah further said out of the 22 parameters of the economy, India has exceeded in 19 parameters.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Money manager vanishes with $313 million of Chinese builder
text: China Fortune Land Development Company has said that it has "lost contact" with a money manager that it gave over $313 million for investment in 2018. The builder had handed the money to China Create Capital Ltd, a British Virgin Islands-registered firm. The Chinese builder, that's debt-laden, was hoping for an annual return of 7-10% from the investment through 2022.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Fashion alley also catching 'good Indian CEO virus': Anand Mahindra on Leena Nair
text: After Leena Nair was named Chanel's new global CEO, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra tweeted, "So it's not just Silicon Valley but also Fashion Alley that's catching the 'good virus' of Indian CEOs." "Bravo Leena! Keep making us proud," he added. Earlier, former PepsiCo Chairman and CEO Indra Nooyi also congratulated Leena Nair.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Indiabulls Housing's shares fall after its Founder sells 11.9% stake
text: Indiabulls Housing Finance's shares ended 8.34% lower on Friday after its Founder Sameer Gehlaut sold an 11.9% stake. Gehlaut said he'll step down from the company's board by the end of this financial year. "I and my promoter companies now own 9.8% of the company. I intend to hold these shares and participate in the future growth story," he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tallest girl in class: Chanel's new CEO Leena Nair's teacher on her school pic
text: A teacher who taught Chanel's new Indian-origin global CEO Leena Nair has shared a group photo from Nair's school days and said that Nair was the "tallest girl in the class". The picture was shared on Twitter by Dallas resident Vijaylakshmi Nadar and was later liked by Nair herself. The 52-year-old graduated from XLRI, Jamshedpur with a gold medal.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Everyone, she is one to watch: Indra Nooyi as Leena Nair named Chanel CEO
text: Former PepsiCo Chairman and CEO Indra Nooyi congratulated Leena Nair on being named Chanel's CEO. Nooyi tweeted, "It's been an honor seeing you rise. In all the moments we've shared together, you’ve come with a certain joie de vivre and determination — a testament to the leader you are." She added, "Everyone, she is one to watch."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Global economy remains hostage to uncertainty due to Omicron: RBI
text: The global economy remains hostage to heightened uncertainty, with the Omicron variant of COVID-19 sparking fresh containment measures, the RBI said. The emergence of Omicron has accelerated risks to global trade with the resumption of travel restrictions and quarantine rules at major ports and airports, it added. "The looming threat of Omicron calls for observing greater caution," RBI added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Cryptos need to be blocked if being used for illegal means: Lekhi
text: Minister of State for External Affairs Meenakshi Lekhi has said that cryptocurrencies need to be blocked if they are being used for illegal means to harm the sovereignty and integrity of the country. "Cryptocurrency platforms and exchanges are owned by a set of people who are trying to avoid tax, taking the money out of the country," she added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Musk sells Tesla shares worth $884 mn, bringing total to $13.6 bn
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk sold another 9,34,091 shares of Tesla worth $884.1 million, filings showed. The billionaire sold the shares to pay for taxes on the exercise of stock options to buy 2.2 million shares. This brings the total shares sold to 12.9 million for about $13.6 billion since Musk took a poll on offloading 10% of his stake.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Emerging economies should regulate cryptos instead of banning them: Gopinath
text: International Monetary Fund (IMF) Chief Economist Gita Gopinath said that emerging economies should regulate cryptocurrencies instead of banning them. "Banning...may not work as crypto exchanges are located offshore, which makes it easier for an individual to trade in them despite the ban," she added. "There is a need for a global policy on it urgently," Gopinath said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Amazon shareholders call for tax disclosures
text: Greater Manchester Pension Fund and the Oblate International Pastoral Investment Trust have filed a shareholder proposal at Amazon, calling on it to disclose global tax practices and risks to investors, shareholder adviser PIRC said. Their proposal also calls on Amazon to implement the new GRI Tax Standard, including public country-by-country reporting of financial, tax and worker information.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Flipkart looking to list outside India by the end of 2022: Report
text: Flipkart is looking at an initial public offering (IPO) outside India around November-December 2022, the company’s Group CEO Kalyan Krishnamurthy reportedly said at an offsite meeting. A US listing may get stretched to March 2023, reported Economic Times. "He said IPO would potentially happen in next 12 months...unless things change dramatically, triggered by external events," a source told ET.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: CAIT writes to FM Sitharaman against Shopee, alleges Chinese links
text: Traders' body CAIT has written to Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman alleging that e-commerce firm Shopee violated norms as it entered India without seeking a government approval despite having a Chinese investor. Pointing to a complex ownership structure of Shopee, CAIT's Praveen Khandelwal said it is "nothing but an attempt to hoodwink the Indian government and infuse Chinese funds into India".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: We condemn Amazon for saying CCI has no power to revoke its Future deal: CAIT
text: Traders' body CAIT has condemned Amazon's "high-handed and arrogant attitude" as well as its "diversionary tactics" for saying CCI has no power to revoke the Future-Amazon deal. It said that the argument reportedly presented by Amazon is an "afterthought just to get the matter escaped from...CCI". Amazon is showing a "my way or the high way attitude", CAIT added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Bank of England raises interest rate to 0.25% amid inflation surge
text: The Bank of England (BoE) became the first major bank globally to raise interest rate from 0.1% to 0.25% amid rising inflation triggered by the pandemic. BoE said inflation rate is likely to hit the 6% mark by April, which is three times its target level. "There are signs of greater persistence in domestic cost, price pressures," BoE said.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: CMS Info Systems fixes price band for ₹1,100-cr IPO at ₹205-216 apiece
text: CMS Info Systems, one of India's largest cash management firm, has fixed the price band for its ₹1,100-crore IPO at ₹205-216 per share. The IPO is entirely an offer for sale by promoter Sion Investment Holdings. Of the issue size, 50% portion is reserved for qualified institutional buyers, 35% for retail investors and 15% for non-institutional investors.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India could export 60 lakh tonnes of sugar despite WTO ruling: Officials
text: India could sell over 60 lakh tonnes of sugar worldwide this year, trade officials said. This comes after World Trade Organization (WTO) panel ruled that India violated international trade rules when it offered excessive subsidies for the production and export of sugar and sugarcane. "There's...no impact of order...with regard to Indian sugar exports," ISMA's Director General Abinash Verma said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Vodafone Idea planning to increase capex to ₹15,000 crore: Report
text: Vodafone Idea (Vi) is planning to increase its annual capital expenditure to $2 billion (about ₹15,000 crore), The Economic Times reported. Vi's promoters Aditya Birla Group and UK's Vodafone Plc are likely to put in more equity, it said. Vi, with a cash balance of ₹250 crore at September-end, is expected to complete its fund-raise by March 2022, it added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Jury is still out: RBI DG on allowing big corporates into banking space
text: RBI's Deputy Governor M Rajeshwar Rao said the "jury is still out" on issue of allowing big corporates into the banking space. Speaking at Mint Annual Conclave, he added, "Given that banking is a highly leveraged business dealing with public money, it makes sense to keep industry/business and banking separate." "This separation is expected to avoid spillover risks," Rao said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: RIL aims to get 1st oil cargo from UAE trade arm in Dec: Report
text: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries (RIL) aims to get the first cargo of oil from its new Abu Dhabi-based trading unit in December, Reuters reported. In October, RIL had announced plans to set up Reliance International (RINL) to trade in crude oil, petroleum, petrochemical products and agricultural commodities. RIL is reportedly aiming to get 5,00,000 barrels cargo of Das crude.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Supriya Lifescience's ₹700-cr IPO fully subscribed within 2 hrs of opening
text: The ₹700-crore IPO of Supriya Lifescience was fully subscribed within two hours of opening for subscription on Thursday. As of 1pm, portion reserved for retail investors was subscribed 7.14 times. The IPO, which will close on December 20, comprises fresh issue of shares worth ₹200 crore and an offer for sale (OFS) of up to ₹500 crore by its promoter.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Sensex falls 889 points to end at 57,011, Nifty closes below 17,000
text: The Sensex fell 889 points to end 1.54% lower at 57,011.74 on Friday, weighed by an across-the-board selloff. Out of the 30 Sensex stocks, 26 closed in the red with IndusInd Bank losing nearly 5%. Infosys, HCL Technologies, Power Grid Corporation and Sun Pharmaceutical were among top gainers. Meanwhile, the Nifty 50 index plunged 263.20 points or 1.53% to 16,985.20.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Around 9% MSMEs got shut down due to COVID-19: Govt
text: Minister of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) Narayan Rane said an online survey conducted by National Small Industries Corporation found that about 9% MSMEs closed down due to COVID-19. As per National Crime Records Bureau, 9,052 MSME business owners committed suicide in 2019, while the number increased to 11,716 in 2020, he added. MSMEs contribute 29% to India's GDP.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: RateGain Travel's shares list at 15% discount on market debut
text: The shares of RateGain Travel Technologies listed at ₹360 on the NSE on Friday, marking a discount of 15% over an issue price of ₹425 apiece. RateGain's initial public offering (IPO) was subscribed 17.41 times between December 7 and December 9. The offer comprised a fresh issue of ₹375 crore, and an offer-for-sale of ₹960.74 crore by investor and promoters.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Pfizer says its COVID-19 pill cuts death risk by 89%, works against Omicron
text: Pfizer has said that the final data available from high-risk patients enrolled in its study  confirmed that its antiviral COVID-19 pill reduced risk of hospitalisation or death by 89% (within three days of symptom onset) and 88% (within five days of symptom onset). Further, Pfizer added Paxlovid will retain robust antiviral activity against current Variants of Concern including Omicron variant.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Cabinet clears ₹76,000-cr PLI scheme for semiconductor production
text: The Union Cabinet has cleared a ₹76,000-crore production linked incentive (PLI) scheme for semiconductor production. Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur said an ambitious project to establish a complete ecosystem of semiconductors and display boards manufacturing has been sanctioned. He added that ₹76,000 crore will be spent on this project in six years.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Musk compares US Senator Warren to an 'angry mom', calls her 'Karen'
text: Elon Musk in a Twitter spat with Elizabeth Warren, over taxes, compared the US Senator to his friend's "angry mom who'd randomly yell at everyone". Musk also tweeted, "Please don't call the manager on me, Senator Karen." He added, "If you opened your eyes for 2 seconds, you'd realize I'll pay more taxes than any American in history this year."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 9 lakh employees of PSU banks to go on 2-day strike from Thursday
text: Nine lakh employees of state-run banks will go on a two-day nationwide strike beginning Thursday to protest against the government’s move to privatise two public sector banks (PSBs), according to union leaders. Most of the banks have cautioned customers about the strike's possible impact on banking operations. In Budget 2021-22, the government had announced its intent to privatise two PSBs.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Who is Leena Nair, Chanel's new global CEO?
text: Indian-origin Leena Nair, Chanel's new Global CEO, did her bachelor's from Walchand College of Engineering, Sangli. She then earned her MBA from XLRI, Jamshedpur, with a gold medal. The 52-year-old joined HUL as a management trainee in 1992 and was appointed the Chief Human Resources Officer (CHRO) in 2016 as the first female, first Asian, and youngest-ever CHRO of Unilever.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: RBI fines PNB ₹1.80 crore and ICICI Bank ₹30 lakh for rule violations
text: The RBI has fined PNB ₹1.80 crore and imposed a ₹30-lakh penalty on ICICI Bank. PNB's fine related to the bank's shareholding in borrower companies, as pledgee, of an amount exceeding 30% of paid-up share capital of those companies. ICICI Bank was fined for violating rules regarding levy of penal charges on non-maintenance of minimum balances in savings bank accounts.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Only months old US company offers two free houses as incentives for employees
text: Florida-based company Mechanical One, which provides air conditioning and plumbing services, is offering a drawing for two houses as incentives for its employees. Opened just in July, the company has bought two units of a three-bedroom, two-bath home for the project. To qualify for the drawing, employees must be with the company for a year, so no employees qualify yet.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Tata Group to return to beauty business it exited 23 years ago
text: Tata Group is returning to the beauty business, a business that the conglomerate exited 23 years ago, according to Bloomberg. Beauty products will be "a key focus for us" from now on, Noel Tata, the non-executive Chairman of Tata's unit Trent, said. Noel Tata's mother Simone Tata helped create Lakmé, which was sold to Unilever's local unit in 1998.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: I am reading every comment: Leena Nair after being named Chanel's CEO
text: Indian-origin businesswoman Leena Nair tweeted, "Overwhelmed by the love and support my appointment as Chanel CEO has got...Please trust that I am reading every comment, even if I don't reply to everyone individually." The 52-year-old, who's spent 30 years at Unilever, said, "I am grateful for my long career at Unilever." She'll take over as Chanel's CEO in January 2022.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Tesla US employee says she barricaded herself to stop men from staring at her
text: One of the six more Tesla US employees who have sued Tesla over workplace harassment told The Washington Post that she barricaded herself with boxes to stop the unwanted attention she received and to stop the men gawking at her. Jessica Brooks alleges a supervisor told his subordinates to "check out the new girl" on her first day of orientation.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: TVS Motor and BMW Motorrad partner to make EVs in India
text: TVS Motor and BMW's motorcycle brand have announced that they will develop electric vehicles (EVs) in India. TVS shares jumped as much as 7.4% after media reports said the companies were likely to announce a partnership for making and exporting electric vehicles from India. The first product from this partnership will be showcased in the next 24 months, TVS said.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Govt unlikely to bring bill on crypto in winter session: Reports
text: The government is unlikely to bring a bill on cryptocurrency in the winter session of Parliament, according to reports. Whenever the bill will be brought, it will be referred to the parliamentary standing committee for wider deliberations with stakeholders, they added. The bill's agenda says, "To create a facilitative framework for creation of the official digital currency issued by RBI."
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Will pay for news content to agencies: Google to French antitrust body
text: Google has submitted a proposal to France's Competition Authority (CA) on how it would deal with news agencies and publishers in a dispute regarding the latter losing ad sales revenue. Google has proposed negotiation in "good faith" with news websites over the amount required to be paid to use their protected content as one of the measures.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: Uber looking to sell stake in Didi, other non-strategic investments: CEO
text: Uber is looking to sell stakes in non-strategic investments in other companies, including its shares in Chinese ride-hailing firm Didi Global, its CEO Dara Khosrowshahi said. "Our Didi stake we don't believe is strategic. They're a competitor," he said. Many companies in which Uber has stakes have gone public recently and are still subject to a lockup period, he added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Paytm's shares fall 11% as lock-in period for anchor investors ends
text: Shares of Paytm parent One97 Communications plunged 11% during intraday trade on Wednesday as the lock-in period of 30 days for anchor investors ended. The firm's shares fell to an intraday low of ₹1,297.70 on the BSE. The percentage of anchor shares outstanding is 5.9% in Paytm, or about 3.83 crore shares, according to a report by Edelweiss Alternative Research.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Musk's behaviour similar to that of abusive man I knew: SpaceX ex-employee
text: A former SpaceX engineer Ashley Kosak, in an essay detailing her experiences of harassment at SpaceX, said, "Elon Musk's behaviour bears a...similarity to the behaviour of a sadistic and abusive man who had...been part of my life." Kosak, who started as an intern, alleged some men at SpaceX hug women without consent and stare at them while they work.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Toyota Kirloskar to hike vehicle prices from January
text: Toyota Kirloskar Motor on Wednesday said that it will increase prices across its entire product portfolio from January. "The price realignment is necessitated on the back of sustained increase in input costs including raw materials," the company added. "All efforts have been made to ensure that the impact of...cost increase has a minimum effect on our esteemed customers," Toyota said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: UK's inflation hits decade-high of 5.1% in November 2021
text: The inflation rate in the United Kingdom reached a decade-high of 5.1% in November 2021. The inflation rates in October were 4.2%, marking an increase of 19.3% in inflation rates over a one-month period. Rising petrol prices, jump in value of second-hand cars, and increase in clothing prices are reportedly driving the high inflation rates.
author: Ashley Paul

headlines: India's Nov exports rise 27% to $30.04 bn, trade deficit at $22.91 bn
text: India's merchandise exports rose 27.16% to $30.04 billion in November, according to the data released by the government. Export sectors that recorded positive growth during the month include petroleum products, engineering goods and electronic items, among others, data showed. Meanwhile, the country's trade deficit stood at $22.91 billion, while imports increased by 56.58% to $52.94 billion.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Biggest 1-year global debt increase since World War II in 2020: IMF
text: The International Monetary Fund said that global debt rose to $226 trillion in 2020 after seeing its biggest yearly increase since World War II. Wealthier nations made up 90% of last year's debt increase, data showed. "The large increase in debt was justified by the need to protect people's lives, preserve jobs and avoid a wave of bankruptcies," it said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: NCLT, NCLAT can't force parties to settle dispute under IBC: SC
text: The Supreme Court has said that the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) and the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) can't compel parties to settle a dispute under the Insolvency and Bankruptcy Code (IBC). SC further said that they cannot act as "courts of equity". NCLT and NCLAT can either allow or reject the insolvency proceedings against the firm.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Saudi Aramco looking to invest in Reliance New Energy Solar: Report
text: Saudi Aramco is looking to invest in Reliance New Energy Solar, Mint reported. This comes after Aramco and Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries recently called off a $15 billion deal for the oil giant to buy 20% stake in RIL's oil-to-chemicals business. "Reliance and Aramco have...longstanding relationship and will continue to look for investment opportunities in India," Aramco said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: SBI gets board's approval to sell 6% stake in mutual fund arm via IPO
text: The State Bank of India (SBI) on Wednesday said its board has given approval for selling 6% in its mutual fund joint venture through the initial public offering (IPO) route. SBI Funds Management's JV partner Amundi also said that it intends to sell 4% stake in the IPO. The IPO will reportedly seek to raise about $1 billion (₹7,600 crore).
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: SBI collected ₹346 crore in additional services fee since FY18: Govt
text: SBI collected around ₹346 crore from 2017-18 up to October 2021 in the form of additional services to customers holding basic savings, including Jan Dhan accounts, Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad said. The amount was collected for additional services beyond the bank's free services, he added. SBI levied charges worth ₹72.38 crore in 2020-21, Karad said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: HP Adhesives' ₹126-cr IPO fully subscribed within an hour of opening
text: The ₹125.96-crore IPO of HP Adhesives was fully subscribed within an hour of opening for subscription on Wednesday. As of 12:40 pm, the portion reserved for retail investors was subscribed 11.08 times. The IPO comprises a fresh issue worth ₹113.44 crore and an offer for sale of ₹12.53 crore. The company has fixed IPO's price band at ₹262-274 apiece.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Serum Institute pledges $66 mn to Oxford University for research campus
text: World's largest vaccine maker Serum Institute of India (SII) has pledged $66.2 million to the University of Oxford for setting up a research campus. The research building would be named after SII's billionaire owners, the Poonawalla family. The investment was made through Serum Life Sciences unit, Oxford University said.  In September, SII had invested $68 million in Oxford Biomedica.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Only 8 PSUs' disinvestment complete out of 36 selected in 2016: Govt
text: Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat K Karad said disinvestment process has been completed for only eight out of the 36 public sector units that it had listed for disinvestment in 2016. "The execution and outcome of disinvestment transactions inter alia depends on the prevailing market conditions and bidders' interest," he added. DIPAM is currently processing 18 transactions, Karad said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: SII will launch Novavax vaccine for children in India in 6 months: CEO
text: Serum Institute of India (SII) CEO Adar Poonawalla has said that the company will launch the Novavax COVID-19 vaccine for children in India in six months. "It's under trial and has shown excellent data all the way down to the age group of 3," he added. Poonawalla also said global vaccine supplies were outstripping the absorption capacity of many countries.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Tesla will accept Dogecoin for merchandise: CEO Elon Musk
text: Dogecoin jumped as much as 24% on Tuesday after Tesla CEO Elon Musk tweeted, "Tesla will make some merch buyable with Doge & see how it goes." Tesla sells merchandise such as apparel, belt buckle, mini models of its vehicles and quad bike 'Cyberquad' for kids. Earlier, Tesla had said it would stop accepting bitcoin for car purchases.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Unvaccinated taking a risk, but people do risky things all the time: Musk
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in an interview opposed the vaccine mandate saying the unvaccinated people are "taking a risk, but people do risky things all the time". "I believe we've got to watch out for the erosion of freedom in America," he added. Musk said he and his eligible children are vaccinated and that he is not against vaccinations.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Revoking FCPL deal will let Reliance restrict competition: Amazon to CCI
text: Amazon has warned the Competition Commission of India (CCI) that revoking its 2019 deal with a Future Group unit would send a negative signal to foreign investors and allow Reliance to "further restrict competition", Reuters reported citing a legal document. The CCI had earlier alleged that Amazon concealed facts while seeking approval to invest ₹1,431 crore in Future Coupons (FCPL).
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Wholesale inflation rises to 12-year-high of 14.23% in November
text: India's wholesale price inflation rose to a 12-year-high of 14.23% in November, data released by the Ministry of Commerce & Industry showed. In October 2021, the figure stood at a five-month high of 12.54%. "The high rate is primarily due to rise in prices of mineral oils, basic metals, crude petroleum, natural gas, chemical products and food," the Ministry said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Indian-origin Leena Nair named as new global CEO of Chanel
text: French fashion house Chanel on Tuesday named 52-year-old Indian national Leena Nair as its new global CEO. Prior to this, Nair was associated with Unilever for the last 30 years. She was the first female, first Asian and the youngest ever Chief Human Resources Officer of Unilever. She'll join Chanel at the end of January and be based in London.
author: Ridham Gambhir

headlines: Unacceptable: Govt as WTO rules against India over sugar subsidies
text: A World Trade Organization (WTO) panel ruled that India violated international trade rules when it offered excessive subsidies for the production and export of sugar and sugarcane. The ruling comes after Brazil, Australia and Guatemala filed parallel complaints in 2019 against India. The government said the findings were "unacceptable" and its sugar subsidies are consistent with WTO agreements.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 6 out of 13 SpiceJet's 737 MAX aircraft started operating flights: Govt
text: Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh said that six out of 13 of SpiceJet's 737 MAX aircraft have started operating commercial passenger flights. DGCA had lifted ban on them after almost two-and-a-half years. The planes were grounded worldwide in March 2019 following two crashes, which killed 346 people. SpiceJet is the only operator of MAX planes in India.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Aditya Birla Fashion & Retail to take over Reebok's operations in India
text: Aditya Birla Fashion and Retail Limited (ABFRL) has signed a long-term licensing agreement to distribute and sell Reebok products in India and other ASEAN countries. "This deal marks a foray for ABFRL into India's fast-growing sports and activewear segment," the company said. The cost of acquisition is estimated to be between ₹75 crore and ₹100 crore, reports said.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Cabinet committee yet to take decision on privatisation of 2 banks: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said cabinet committee on privatisation is yet to take a decision with regard to divesting two public sector banks (PSBs). Government had in Budget 2021-22 announced its intent to take up privatisation of two PSBs during the year, she added. Centre has budgeted ₹1.75 lakh crore from stake sale in PSUs and financial institutions in 2021-22.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Adani's realty unit in talks to buy Ozone Group at $1 billion: Report
text: Billionaire Gautam Adani's Adani Realty is in advanced talks to buy Bengaluru-based developer Ozone Group at an enterprise valuation of $1 billion, Bloomberg reported. Ozone Group, which has ongoing projects in Mumbai, Bengaluru and Chennai, reportedly has an outstanding debt of over ₹6,000 crore. As part of the transaction, Adani will be taking over the debt of Ozone Group.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Jhunjhunwala-backed Metro Brands' ₹1,368-cr IPO subscribed 52% on day 2
text: The ₹1,367.5-crore initial public offering (IPO) of footwear retailer Metro Brands, backed by billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, was subscribed 52% on the second day of bidding. The company received bids for 99.49 lakh equity shares against an IPO size of 1.91 crore. The portion set aside for retail investors was subscribed 87%, while that of non-institutional investors was subscribed 17%.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India plans to produce 500 crore COVID-19 vaccine doses in 2022: Goyal
text: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal has said that India plans to produce 500 crore doses of COVID-19 vaccines next year. He further said that India is one of the shining examples of both vaccinating her own population and providing vaccines to the world. "We hope to contribute to making the world a safer place to live in," Goyal added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Govt should clarify whether it's going to recognise cryptos or not: Adhir
text: The leader of Congress in the Lok Sabha, Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury, said, "The government should clarify in Parliament whether it is going to recognise cryptocurrency or not." He added, "At a time when the government is planning to ban cryptocurrencies...Prime Minister's Twitter handle is compromised and a link is tweeted saying...government is going to recognise cryptocurrencies."
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Facebook parent acquires name rights for 'Meta' for $60 million
text: Facebook's parent company Meta Platforms has acquired the trademark assets of US-based regional bank Meta Financial Group for $60 million in cash. Meta Financial and its subsidiary MetaBank will have one year to remove "Meta" from its name and all branding. Earlier in October, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg announced that the parent company would change its name to Meta.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk sells Tesla shares worth $906 mn, bringing total to $12.7 bn
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk sold another 9,34,091 shares of Tesla worth $906 million, filings showed. The billionaire sold the shares to pay for taxes on the exercise of stock options to buy 2.13 million shares. This brings the total shares sold to 11.97 million for about $12.7 billion since Musk took a poll on offloading 10% of his stake.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Time to pay taxes: US lawmaker as Musk named TIME Person of the Year
text: After the world's richest person and Tesla and SpaceX CEO Elon Musk was named TIME magazine's '2021 Person of the Year', US lawmaker Pramila Jayapal said, "It's *TIME* for him to pay his fair share in taxes." US Senator Elizabeth Warren tweeted, "Let's change the rigged tax code so [Musk] will actually pay taxes and stop freeloading off everyone else."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Musk's brother congratulates him on being TIME's 2021 Person of the Year
text: Tesla's billionaire Founder and CEO Elon Musk's brother Kimbal Musk congratulated him on being named TIME magazine's 2021 Person of the Year. "Congratulations bro. I can't think of a more deserving person ever. You are changing the world and humanity for the betterment of all," Kimbal  said. "Thanks bro," Musk replied. The Tesla CEO is currently worth $266 billion.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Govt earned ₹8 lakh cr from taxes on petrol, diesel in last 3 fiscals: FM
text: The Centre earned nearly ₹8.02 lakh crore from taxes on petrol and diesel during the last three fiscal years, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman informed the Parliament. Of the total, over ₹3.71 lakh crore was collected in 2020-21, she added. Excise duty on petrol rose from ₹19.48/litre as on October 5, 2018 to ₹27.90/litre as on November 4, 2021, she said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: States yet to receive ₹37,134 crore GST compensation for 2020-21: Govt
text: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said GST compensation amounting to ₹37,134 crore is due to states and Union Territories for 2020-21. He also said that ₹14,664 crore was due to states and UTs for April-September 2021. Chaudhary added that ₹1.10 lakh crore and ₹1.59 lakh crore were released to states as back-to-back loans in FY21 and FY22, respectively.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India has 1 registered investment advisor per 76,510 investors: Govt
text: Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said the ratio of mutual fund investors and demat account holders to SEBI-registered investment advisors (RIAs) in India is around 76,510:1. As of October 31, there were around 2.75 crore mutual fund investors, 7.38 crore demat account holders and 1,324 RIAs, he added. Chaudhary also said there were total 738 lakh demat accounts.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Raymond shares hit 2-year high on plan to issue NCDs worth ₹100 crore
text: Raymond's shares surged nearly 7% during intraday trade to hit a two-year high of ₹704. This comes after the company said that its board of directors will meet on December 17 to consider and approve issuance of non-convertible debentures (NCDs) to raise up to ₹100 crore. NCDs are proposed to be listed on NSE's wholesale debt market segment, it added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Air India was profitable, unfounded decisions drove it into ground: Scindia
text: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia at CII Partnership Summit said, "Air India was initially a profitable company, but it was driven into the ground because of many unfounded decisions." He called the Tata-Air India deal a win-win transaction for everybody and said, "It's an opportunity for Air India to rise as a phoenix...having gone back to its original owner."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ADB cuts India's GDP growth estimate to 9.7% for 2021-22
text: The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has cut India's GDP growth forecast for 2021-22 to 9.7% from its previous estimate of 10%. This is the second time in three months that the bank has scaled down India's growth estimate. "The reduction...comes amid supply chain issues that are affecting industry," the Manila-based multilateral development bank said in its latest supplement.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Data Patterns' ₹588-cr IPO fully subscribed within an hour of opening
text: The ₹588.2-crore initial public offering (IPO) of Data Patterns was fully subscribed within an hour of opening for subscription on Tuesday. As of 1 pm, the portion reserved for retail investors was subscribed 3.42 times. The Chennai-based defence and aerospace electronics solutions provider has fixed a price band of ₹555-585 for the IPO, which will remain open till December 16.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Anand Rathi Wealth lists at ₹602, 9% premium over IPO price
text: Shares of Anand Rathi Wealth listed at ₹602 apiece on the BSE, a 9.46% premium to its IPO price of ₹550. The non-bank wealth solutions provider's IPO, which was entirely an offer-for-sale by promoters, was subscribed 9.78 times. The portion set aside for non-institutional investors was subscribed 25.42 times, while that of retail investors was subscribed 7.76 times.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Jhunjhunwala-backed Metro Brands' IPO booked 3.64 times on final day
text: The ₹1,367.5 crore IPO of footwear retailer Metro Brands, which is backed by billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, was subscribed 3.64 times on the last day of bidding on Tuesday. The retail portion of the offer was subscribed 1.13 times and that of non-institutional investors saw 3.02 times subscription. The price band for the IPO was fixed at ₹485-₹500 apiece.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Elon Musk named TIME magazine's 2021 Person of the Year
text: Tesla's billionaire founder and CEO Elon Musk has been named TIME magazine's 2021 Person of the Year. The 50-year-old had in October 2021 become the world's first person to cross a net worth of $300 billion. "This is the man who aspires to save our planet and get us a new one to inhabit," said TIME on Musk.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Bezos criticised for celebrating space trip as Amazon US warehouse collapsed
text: Amazon's billionaire Founder Jeff Bezos has been criticised for celebrating the launch of Blue Origin's spaceflight after a tornado hit an Amazon warehouse in Illinois killing at least six people. Bezos had shared a picture from launch site on Instagram, captioned, "Happy crew this morning in the training centre." "You should worry about the tornado situation more," a user commented.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Alibaba employee who accused her manager of sexual assault fired
text: An Alibaba employee, who had accused her manager of sexually assaulting her, told a Chinese newspaper the company terminated her last month, Bloomberg reported. The employee said Alibaba fired her for spreading false information in August about being raped by a senior manager. She further claimed she didn't receive any severance pay and was compensated till the date of termination.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I used to fail in school: Zomato's IITian CEO Deepinder Goyal
text: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal at an event said, "I was a terrible student during school...I used to be at the bottom of the class...I used to fail." He added, "A teacher gave me the answers to every exam in the first semester of Class 8 and I ranked third." Goyal later studied at IIT Delhi and founded Zomato in 2008.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Glad we didn't cross the fine line between being brave & stupid: Zomato CEO on IPO
text: Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal spoke about his company's IPO, and said, "Fortune favours the brave. There's a fine line between being brave and being stupid, I'm glad we actually didn't cross that line." He said, "People tell us that 'you guys timed the IPO really well'." Goyal added, "I tell them you can't time things like an IPO."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Retail inflation rises to 4.91% in November from 4.48% in October
text: India's retail inflation rose to 4.91% in the month of November from 4.48% in October, data released by the Ministry of Statistics & Programme Implementation showed. The rise was led by an increase in food prices, particularly vegetables. This is the fifth consecutive month that CPI data has come below the Reserve Bank of India's upper margin of 6%.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India bans Kiwi fruit import from Iran due to rise in pest-infested consignments
text: India has suspended the import of fresh Kiwi fruits from Iran due to the rise in pest-infested consignments from the country despite repeated warnings. Since October 2021, India has intercepted quarantine pest 'Aspidiotus netil' in 22 consignments and 'Pseudococcu Calceolariae' pest in two Kiwi fruit consignments. Earlier in 2019 too, India had intercepted pest-infested consignments.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance looks to buy bankrupt textile firm Sintex Industries
text: Mukesh Ambani's Reliance Industries (RIL), along with a partner, is looking to buy Gujarat-based bankrupt textile firm Sintex Industries, according to a stock exchange filing by Sintex Industries. Reliance is partnering with Assets Care & Reconstruction Enterprise Limited to bid for the company.  Other bidders for the company are Easygo Textiles (Welspun Group), GHCL, and Himatsingka Ventures.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Global chip shortage to continue till second half of 2022: Samsung
text: Samsung said it believes that the ongoing global chip shortage shall continue till the second half of 2022. The company is reportedly taking many steps to mitigate the shortage, which includes stocking up four weeks' worth of chip supplies instead of two weeks. Samsung is also going to push for annual contracts with chip foundries to secure chip production capacity.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: HCL underpaid H1-B visa holders by at least $95 mn a year: Report
text: HCL Technologies has been accused of wage theft by underpaying thousands of skilled migrants with H-1B visas. The Economic Policy Institute said, "We estimate that HCL is saving at least $95 million per year by illegally underpaying H-1B employees." The report was released as part of a whistleblower lawsuit against HCL Technologies, the US-based think tank said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: MGM Resorts lets candidates try out jobs in virtual reality before signing on
text: American hospitality company MGM Resorts is letting applicants try out casino and hotel jobs in virtual reality (VR) before signing on. "It can be very difficult just to verbally explain the types of positions or show a video," MGM's chief HR officer told Insider. She said VR experience allows candidates to "throw a headset on and really experience the job".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Amazon worker killed in US roof collapse wasn't allowed to leave: Girlfriend
text: Amazon worker Larry Virden, who was killed after a tornado hit the company's Illinois warehouse and its roof collapsed, wasn't allowed to leave the facility, his girlfriend said. "That was the last text message I got from him...He had 20 minutes to get home," she said. Virden, who started working for Amazon five months ago, is survived by four children.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: COVID-19, lack of funds for survival compelled Zomato to go public: CEO
text: Zomato's Founder and CEO Deepinder Goyal said that COVID-19 induced disruptions, lack of funds for survival and reluctant private investors compelled the company to go public. Goyal added that he was determined to go for it even if it was to be a $50 million IPO at a valuation of $500 million. "We were just trying to survive," he said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: MapmyIndia's ₹1,039 crore IPO subscribed 154.71 times on final day
text: Digital mapping company MapmyIndia's ₹1,039.61 crore initial public offer (IPO) was subscribed 154.71 times on the final day of bidding on Monday. It received bids for 108.98 crore shares against an offer size of 70.44 lakh shares. The portion reserved for non-institutional investors was booked 424.69 times, whereas that of qualified institutional buyers (QIBs) was subscribed 196.36 times.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt to organise innovation week to encourage startup ecosystem
text: The government will be hosting a week-long event to encourage the startup ecosystem in India in January 2022, as a part of the 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav'. The "Celebrating Innovation Ecosystem" event will aim to bring together key startups, entrepreneurs, investors, policymakers and other stakeholders. It will help provide market access opportunities to startups and mobilise capital investment.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Centre planning to hike DA for its employees on New Year: Reports
text: The Centre is planning to increase dearness allowance (DA) for its employees under the 7th pay commission by the beginning of next year, according to reports. The employees will get a 3% hike in their DA and the increase in salary can be as much as ₹20,000, the reports said. In October, Centre had hiked DA by 3% to 31%.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Amazon-backed More Retail plans IPO to raise ₹3,780 crore: Report
text: Grocery chain More Retail is considering an initial public offering (IPO) to raise as much as $500 million (₹3,780 crore), Bloomberg reported. The listing will likely consist largely of new shares and could value the company at $5 billion (₹37,800 crore). Amazon and Samara Capital Partners acquired More Retail from billionaire Kumar Mangalam Birla's Aditya Birla Group in 2019.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Banks write off ₹2.02 lakh cr in FY21; ₹10.7 lakh cr in last 7 yrs: RTI
text: Banks have written off ₹2,02,781 crore of bad loans in financial year 2020-21, the RBI said in an RTI reply to The Indian Express. Five banks, led by SBI, wrote off ₹89,686 crore in FY21, with SBI accounting for ₹34,402 crore, it added. As much as ₹10.72 lakh crore was written off by banks since financial year 2014-15, RBI said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India's largest syringe maker allowed to restart production by CAQM
text: India's largest syringe maker Hindustan Syringes and Medical Devices (HMD) has been allowed to restart production after it was told to temporarily shut down its plants in Haryana to control pollution. HMD had earlier warned that syringes were already in short supply. "We're thankful to CAQM and Haryana State Pollution Control Board for the partial reprieve," MD Rajiv Nath said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Vedanta withdraws cases against govt to settle retro tax dispute
text: Vedanta has withdrawn cases against the government in the Delhi High Court and before an international arbitration tribunal to settle a ₹20,495 crore retrospective tax dispute. The company further declared, "No further proceedings or claims shall be initiated in any court or tribunal." The Parliament passed the Taxation Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2021, in August to scrap the retrospective tax law.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Vedanta shares rise 3% after it declares interim dividend of ₹13.5/share
text: Shares of Vedanta surged by 3% during intraday trade on Monday after the company announced that its board has approved an interim dividend of ₹13.50 per share, amounting to ₹5,019 crore, for 2021-22. Vedanta's promoters, who have a shareholding of 65.18%, are poised to receive ₹3,271 crore. The date for the payment of dividend has been set as December 18.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Shaktikanta Das begins his extended 3-year term as RBI Governor
text: Shaktikanta Das has started his extended three-year term as Reserve Bank of India's (RBI) Governor. Das has become the first RBI Governor to get a second term since PM Narendra Modi-led government came into power in 2014. The reappointment is effective for three years beyond December 10, 2021, or until further orders, whichever is earlier, an official statement earlier said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tega Industries lists at 68% premium on market debut
text: The shares of Kolkata-based Tega Industries listed at ₹753 apiece on the BSE and ₹760 on the NSE. This is a 68% premium to its IPO price of ₹453. Its initial public offer (IPO), which was a complete offer-for-sale, was subscribed 219.04 times on the last day of subscription. The portion reserved for non-institutional investors was booked 666.19 times.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Govt to follow auction route for coal block allocation: Coal Minister
text: Coal Minister Pralhad Joshi on Monday defended the government's decision to auction four coal blocks located near the Singareni Collieries Company (SCCL) in Telangana and said it is being done according to policy. He was replying to Congress MP Uttam Kumar Reddy during the Zero Hour. "Now the auction regime has begun," Joshi added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Supriya Lifescience's ₹700-cr IPO to open on Dec 16 at ₹265-274/share
text: Supriya Lifescience's ₹700-crore initial public offering (IPO) will open on December 16 at a price band of ₹265-274 per share. The offer comprises fresh issue of equity shares worth ₹200 crore and an offer-for-sale of up to ₹500 crore by its promoter. Currently, the promoter holds 99.26% stake in the company, which manufactures and supplies active pharmaceutical ingredients (APIs).
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: PSBs lost ₹2.85 lakh crore due to loan dues of 13 corporates: UFBU
text: Public sector banks (PSBs) have lost nearly ₹2.85 lakh crore on account of loan dues of 13 corporates, United Forum of Bank Unions (UBFU) alleged. UBFU has called for a two-day nationwide bank strike on December 16 and 17. The strike has been called to protest against Banking Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2021 and opposing government's alleged move to privatise PSBs.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: 41,177 posts vacant at public sector banks as on Dec 1: FM Sitharaman
text: As many as 41,177 positions or 5% of the total sanctioned posts at public sector banks (PSBs) were vacant as on December 1, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said in a written reply in Lok Sabha. There are over 8,05,986 sanctioned positions at PSBs. No vacancy/post was abolished in last six years, except one in Punjab & Sind Bank, Sitharaman said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Blue Origin spaceflight with 1st American astronaut's daughter, 5 others launched
text: Jeff Bezos-led Blue Origin launched its third human spaceflight, a first one with six crew members, to the edge of space on Saturday. The crew members include Laura Shepard Churchley, the eldest daughter of first American in space Alan Shepard and Good Morning America host Michael Strahan. Evan Dick, Dylan Taylor, Cameron Bess and Lane Bess are the other members.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Better.com, that fired 900 staff, topped LinkedIn's top 50 US startups list in Sept
text: Days after Better.com CEO Vishal Garg fired 900 employees on a Zoom call, LinkedIn's list of top 50 startups in the US in 2021 resurfaced online. Better.com had topped the list that was released in September. The mortgage lending startup also topped the 2020 list. Notably, Garg sent an e-mail to employees referring to them as "dumb dolphins" in 2020.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: What made him think his action would be rewarded: Mahindra on Better.com CEO's time off
text: After Better.com CEO Vishal Garg, who fired 900 employees over a Zoom call, took time off, Anand Mahindra said, "Seemed inevitable...What type of culture led to this CEO thinking his action would be rewarded?" Mahindra stated that CEOs act in a manner they believe will help them succeed, adding, "Boards of directors need to reflect on the culture they foster."
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Before and after pics show Amazon warehouse hit by tornado in US killing 6
text: Satellite pictures by Maxar Technologies showed the extent of destruction after a tornado hit an Amazon warehouse in the US' Illinois killing six people this weekend. Amazon didn't have a specific count on employees because there was a shift change underway when it happened. The tornado caused both sides of a building to collapse inwards, leading the roof to fall.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Ola, Uber auto rides may get costlier from Jan 1 as Centre levies 5% GST
text: Auto rides booked through app aggregators like Ola and Uber are likely to become costlier from January 1, 2022 with the Centre levying a 5% GST. Demanding a reconsideration of the move, an Uber spokesperson said, the move will "hurt earnings of auto drivers" and the government's "digitisation agenda". The government recently withdrew GST exemption on auto rides booked online.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Started wearing saree after I began social work, you need to be like aam aadmi: Murthy
text: Speaking about what she changed about herself when she began social work, Infosys Foundation Chairperson Sudha Murthy said she used to wear "jeans and a T-shirt". "When I used to go to a community...they always felt..I'm different from them. [Later] I started wearing a saree, tied my bun," she stated. "You should dress or...be like...aam aadmi," the 71-year-old added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Which are India's 5 biggest business houses as per Hurun?
text: As per the 2021 Burgundy Private Hurun India 500 list, Tata Group with as many as 14 companies in the list is India's biggest business house. This is followed by Adani Group, Aditya Birla Group, Murugappa Group and Bajaj Group. "The top 5 business groups...has a combined value of more than [₹46 lakh crore]," Hurun India stated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Omicron's impact on economy will be less severe: Finance Ministry
text: The impact of Omicron variant of COVID-19 on the economy will be less severe due to rapid vaccination, the Finance Ministry said in a report. However, it said that Omicron may pose a fresh risk to the ongoing global recovery. The ministry also urged all the citizens to stay safe and follow all the COVID-19 guidelines.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Expect to complete Phase 2/3 trials of mRNA vaccine by Jan: Emcure President
text: Emcure Pharmaceuticals' President Samit Mehta has said that the company's subsidiary Gennova Biopharmaceuticals expects to complete Phase 2 and 3 trials of its mRNA-based COVID-19 vaccine by January 2022. Gennova has applied for manufacturing and stockpiling of the vaccines at risk, he added. Gennova is the first Indian pharma company to develop an indigenous mRNA platform, Mehta said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: SpiceJet to introduce drone delivery service for essential goods
text: SpiceJet is planning to introduce drone delivery service to transport vaccines, life-saving medicines and essential goods to remote areas. It said customised drones of different payloads, including 0-5 kg, 5-10 kg and 10-25 kg, will be introduced. A SpiceXpress-led consortium was earlier shortlisted by the DGCA for conducting experimental Beyond Visual Line of Sight (BVLOS) drone operations.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Samsung names new mobile, consumer electronics unit 'DX Division'
text: Samsung Electronics has named its newly merged mobile phone and home appliances businesses as "DX Division". DX stands for "Device eXperience" and reflects Samsung's focus on creating new experiences for customers, the company said. This comes after Samsung announced it is merging two of its three divisions, marking biggest reshuffle since appointing three co-CEOs for its three divisions in 2017.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Urge MP CM to order accused Amazon officials' arrest in ganja case: CAIT
text: The Secretary General of Confederation of All India Traders (CAIT), Praveen Khandelwal, has urged Madhya Pradesh's Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan to order the arrest of Amazon officials who are named as accused in the marijuana case. Khandelwal said, "MP government has shown the way how government works and...(we) expect it to create a landmark as to how law works."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Pragmatic step: CAIT as SIT to probe alleged ganja sale on Amazon set up
text: After the government of Madhya Pradesh set up a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to probe the alleged sale of marijuana through Amazon, CAIT's Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal called it a "pragmatic step". He said, "Accused Amazon officials should be arrested immediately." MP Police had earlier arrested two people for allegedly selling 20kg of marijuana worth ₹1.1 crore on Amazon India.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Heartbroken: Bezos as Amazon workers die after tornado hits US warehouse
text: Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos said he was "heartbroken" after at least six people were killed at an Amazon warehouse in Illinois, US, when it was struck by a tornado late Friday. "Our thoughts and prayers are with their families and loved ones," Bezos tweeted. Amazon's CEO Andy Jassy said the company is "working closely with local officials and first responders".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's largest syringe maker HMD urges PM to lift factory shutdown order
text: India's largest syringe and needle manufacturer, Hindustan Syringes and Medical Devices (HMD), has urged PM Narendra Modi to revoke an order to shut its units. Haryana Pollution Control Board had asked HMD to temporarily close down the plants to curb heavy pollution. "We won't use...diesel generator sets and have...equipped our plants with renewable energy sources," HMD's MD Rajiv Nath said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Edible oil prices fell by ₹8-10 per kg in last 30 days: Trade body
text: Edible oil prices declined ₹8-10 per kg in last one month on the back of lower import duties, Solvent Extractors' Association of India (SEA) said. The prices may fall ₹3-4 per kg in the coming months on higher domestic output of oilseeds and bearish trend in global markets, the trade body added. Centre had reduced import duties on edible oils.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: 2 workers confirmed dead after tornado hits Amazon warehouse in US
text: At least two workers were confirmed dead when an Amazon warehouse collapsed near St. Louis, US, after tornadoes and strong storms hit the area late on Friday. About 50 workers were believed to be trapped at the warehouse. Local authorities said at least 30 workers were transported by bus from the scene and others may have left on their own.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Depositors should be careful while chasing high returns: RBI Governor
text: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) Governor Shaktikanta Das on Sunday said that depositors should be careful while chasing high returns. "There are institutions offering higher rates. Higher return, higher interest rate also has higher risk," he added. Das also said that India can become a gross driver of the world economy if all stakeholders in the banking sector work together.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Increasing deposit insurance cover will protect ₹76 lakh cr of savings: PM
text: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said that the move to increase deposit insurance cover to ₹5 lakh from ₹1 lakh will protect ₹76 lakh crore of savings. "We amended the law for time-bound resolution of deposit insurance claims in 90 days," he added. So far, ₹1300 crore, stuck for years, have been returned to over 1 lakh depositors, he said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Billionaire Yusuff Ali's LuLu Group to invest ₹2,000 cr in Gujarat
text: UAE-based retail giant LuLu Group on Saturday announced it will invest ₹2,000 crore to develop a shopping mall near Ahmedabad. The mall is expected to create employment opportunities for more than 5,000 people. "Gujarat holds a very special place in my heart, this is where I first learnt the basics of business," LuLu Group's billionaire MD Yusuff Ali MA said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Growth to gain further traction in remaining quarters: Finance Min
text: India's real GDP, which grew 8.4% in September quarter and exceeded the pre-pandemic output level, will likely gain further traction in the remaining quarters of this fiscal, the Finance Ministry said in a report. “India will be among the few economies to rebound so strongly from the contraction...due to COVID-19," it added. "Recovery suggests kick-starting of investment cycle," it said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: DoT moves NCLAT against Twin Star takeover bid for Videocon
text: The Department of Telecommunications (DoT) has moved before the NCLAT against the NCLT order approving the consolidated resolution plan for 13 companies of Videocon Group. It urged NCLAT to set aside order allowing Twin Star Technologies' ₹2,962 crore takeover of Videocon. Videocon Telecommunications had secured dues with 131 Bank Guarantees from SBI in favour of DoT for ₹881.92 crore.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India needs 'self-belief' to draw from its past success: Rajan
text: Former RBI Governor Raghuram Rajan said India needs "aatmavishwas (self-belief)" to draw from its past success. "India needs to find out why it's a success story in making two-wheelers and pharmaceuticals but cannot make clay Ganeshas," Rajan said at the Chennai International Centre, adding, "India must make pasta and market Haldirams' bhujia and vathal to all parts of the world".
