author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Vedanta declares interim dividend of ₹13.5/share amounting to ₹5,019 cr
text: Billionaire Anil Agarwal-led Vedanta on Saturday approved a second interim dividend for the financial year 2021-22. The company said in an exchange filing that an interim dividend of ₹13.50 per share, amounting to ₹5,019 crore has been approved. As a result, Vedanta's promoters are poised to receive ₹3,271 crore. In September, Vedanta paid a total of ₹6,877 crore as dividend.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt unlikely to announce capital infusion for PSBs in Budget 2022: Reports
text: The government is unlikely to announce capital infusion for public sector banks (PSBs) in Budget 2022-23 as their financial health has improved on the back of reduction in bad loans, according to reports. Banks would be encouraged to raise funds from the market and also by selling their non-core assets to augment their resources, reports said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Bank deposit insurance cover increased to ₹5 lakh, refund in 90 days: Goyal
text: Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal said the Centre has increased the bank deposit insurance cover, in case of problems occurring such as closure, from ₹1 lakh to ₹5 lakh. The amount has to be refunded to the depositor within 90 days, he added. "The most important thing is that earlier it used to take nearly 10 years," Goyal said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Underestimated how tough it would be convincing people for vaccine: Gates
text: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates in a blog expressed that he "underestimated how tough it would be to convince people to take the vaccine and continue to use masks". "I think the acute phase of the pandemic will come to a close some time in 2022," he added. However, Gates accepted that the "Omicron variant is concerning".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Crypto should be used to empower democracy, not undermine it: PM Modi
text: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday said that emerging technologies such as cryptocurrencies should be used to empower democracy, not to undermine it. Speaking at the virtual 'Summit for Democracy' event hosted by US President Joe Biden, PM further said, "We must also jointly shape global norms for emerging technologies like social media and cryptocurrencies."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Oracle Co-founder gains $12 billion in a day as shares surge
text: Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison's net worth surged by $12 billion on Friday after his company's shares rose 16% following strong second-quarter earnings. Currently, the 77-year-old has a fortune of $119.5 billion and ranks ninth among the world's richest people, as per Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Ellison owns over 40% stake in the software company, he co-founded in 1977.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Thinking of quitting my jobs & becoming an influencer full-time, says Elon Musk
text: World's richest person Elon Musk wrote on Twitter, "Thinking of quitting my jobs and becoming an influencer full-time wdyt (what do you think)." Responding to the Tesla and SpaceX CEO's tweet, American YouTuber Jimmy Donaldson aka MrBeast said, "I'll coach you on how to get YouTube views!" "What makes you think you're not already one (influencer)," a Twitter user wrote.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Businessman says Musk connects with people for fun despite $260 bn wealth; he replies
text: After Elon Musk tweeted 'Hahaha', American businessman Jeremy Padawer said, "Despite his massive wealth and responsibilities, he connects with the people for fun." Musk, who has "$260 billion net worth, six kids, three massive businesses and 150,000 employees" was "blowing off steam" with the tweet, Padawer wrote. World's richest person Musk responded saying, "I do aspire to entertain the people!"
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Which 5 Indian companies employ most number of people as per Hurun?
text: At least 139 Indian companies employ more than 10,000 people, with TCS being the country's largest employer, as per Hurun India 500 list of 2021. The IT major employs 5.06 lakh people and is followed by Quess Corp with 3.63 lakh employees. Larsen & Toubro (L&T) has 3.6 lakh employees, Infosys has 2.59 lakh and Reliance Industries employs 2.36 lakh.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: TRAI asks Musk's Starlink not to solicit business, collect fees: Report
text: The Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) has asked Elon Musk-led SpaceX's satellite broadband arm Starlink not to "solicit any telecom business or collect any related fees" without necessary authorisations, reported Economic Times citing a directive. Earlier, the Department of Telecommunications had barred Starlink from taking bookings or pre-orders for its internet services in India.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: We're scared, expecting to get fired next: Better.com employee after 900 layoffs on Zoom
text: After 900 Better.com employees were laid off on a Zoom call, a current employee said, "Everyone has been on edge. We're all looking behind our backs, expecting to get fired next. It's not a healthy environment." "The mood...lifted a little bit since [CEO Vishal] Garg's break was announced, but everyone's still scared," the employee told Business Insider.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Which are the oldest & youngest firms on Hurun India's 500 most valuable firms list?
text: As per Hurun India's list of 500 most valuable companies, 21 are older than 100 years and 52 companies are younger than 10 years. Forbes & Company, founded in 1767, is the oldest firm featured on the list, followed by E.I.D-Parry (India), founded in 1788. Mensa Brands, founded by ex-Myntra CEO Ananth Narayanan over six months ago, is the youngest.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Reject PharmEasy's proposed ₹6,250-crore IPO: CAIT to SEBI
text: Indian traders' body CAIT has written to SEBI seeking the rejection of PharmEasy's proposed ₹6,250-crore IPO. CAIT's Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said selling medicines online is illegal as per an order passed by the Delhi High Court in 2018. He further said that PharmEasy mentions Thyrocare as its subsidiary in the DRHP even though CCI hasn't yet approved the acquisition.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Which are India's 10 most valuable unlisted companies as per Hurun?
text: Covishield maker Serum Institute of India is the most valuable unlisted company in India with ₹1.83 lakh crore in value, as per the 2021 Burgundy Private Hurun India 500 list. NSE and BYJU'S stood second and third with a value of ₹1.68 lakh crore and 1.35 lakh crore, respectively. They're followed by InMobi, OYO, Ramcharan & Co and Dream11.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Better.com CEO Vishal Garg who fired 900 employees on Zoom call takes time off
text: Better.com CEO Vishal Garg, who fired 900 employees over a Zoom call, is "taking time off effective immediately", according to the company's internal memo accessed by Business Insider. "Board has engaged an independent 3rd party firm to do a leadership and cultural assessment," the memo stated, adding that Kevin Ryan as CFO will manage the day-to-day decisions in his absence.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Couldn't tell my kids, but when news went viral I had to: Fired Better.com employee
text: A man, who was among 900 Better.com employees laid off on a Zoom call, said he and his wife agreed not to tell their five children about it. "But when news of...mass-layoff went viral, we were left with no choice," Christian Chapman told Business Insider. "My employment status changes things for the holidays. Christmas vacation? Probably not anymore," he added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India's largest syringe maker asked to shut Haryana plant to control pollution
text: India's largest syringe maker Hindustan Syringes and Medical Devices (HMD) has shut its units after Haryana Pollution Control Board asked it to temporarily close down or face prosecution. HMD has written to PM Narendra Modi, asking for declaration of syringes for COVID-19 vaccination as critical medical devices to ensure uninterrupted operations. "Syringes are already in short supply," HMD said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt offices in UAE's Sharjah to have 4-day workweek
text: The government agencies in the United Arab Emirates' (UAE's) Sharjah city are moving to a four-day workweek and the working hours will be from 7:30 am to 3:30 pm. While the working days will be from Monday to Thursday, the weekend will be from Friday to Sunday. It follows the UAE's switch to a 4.5-day workweek from January 1, 2022.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala makes over ₹6,000-crore profit after Star Health listing
text: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala made a profit of over ₹6,000 crore from his investment in Star Health and Allied Insurance Company after its shares reached an intraday high of ₹940 on Friday. According to the company's RHP, Jhunjhunwala held 14.98% equity shares that he had acquired at an average of ₹155.28/share. He didn't put up any shares for sale in the IPO.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Which are India's 10 most valuable companies in 2021 as per Hurun?
text: Reliance Industries has topped the list of 500 most valuable Indian companies in 2021 with ₹16.65 lakh crore, according to Hurun India. TCS and HDFC Bank with a value of ₹13.09 lakh crore and ₹9.05 lakh crore, respectively, stood second and third. They are followed by Infosys with ₹7.51 lakh crore, ICICI Bank, HDFC, Bajaj Finance and Kotak Mahindra Bank.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Haven't sold stake because I have confidence in Star Health management: Jhunjhunwala
text: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, who is a promoter of Star Health and Allied Insurance, has said that he has "full confidence in the management" and that's why he hasn't sold any shares. Jhunjhunwala and his wife have around 18% stake, the second-largest shareholding. On Friday, Star Health's shares listed at a 6% discount over its IPO price of ₹900 apiece.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Most virtual meetings will move to metaverse in 2-3 yrs: Bill Gates
text: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said, "Within the next 2-3 years, I predict most virtual meetings will move from 2D camera image grids...to the metaverse, a 3D space with digital avatars." He added, "The idea is you'll eventually use your avatar to meet with people in a virtual space that replicates the feeling of being in an actual room with them."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 8-yr-old Nubank becomes Latin America's biggest bank after US IPO
text: Eight-year-old Nubank has become Latin America's biggest bank by market capitalisation after listing on New York Stock Exchange. It raised $2.6 billion in an initial public offering at $9 a share on Wednesday, giving it a market value above $40 billion. Earlier, Nubank had cut its proposed IPO price range by a fifth, to $8-$9 per share from $10-$11.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Paytm Payments Bank receives Scheduled Bank status from RBI
text: Paytm on Thursday said that Paytm Payments Bank Limited (PPBL) has received Scheduled Bank status from the RBI. PPBL has been included in the Second Schedule to the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934, and can now explore new business opportunities, it added. The bank would now also be eligible to partner in government-run financial inclusion schemes, Paytm said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Elon Musk sells another 9.34 lakh Tesla shares worth $963.2 mn
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold another 9.34 lakh shares of Tesla worth $963.2 million, US securities filings showed. He also exercised stock options to buy 2.17 million shares of Tesla. Earlier this month, Musk had sold over 9.34 lakh shares worth $1.01 billion. In November, Musk took a poll on offloading 10% of his stake.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: MedPlus Health raises ₹418 cr from anchor investors ahead of IPO
text: India's second-largest pharmacy retailer MedPlus Health Services has raised ₹418 crore from anchor investors ahead of its IPO. Investors who participated in this round included Abu Dhabi Investment Authority, Blackrock Global Funds, Nomura, Fidelity, Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley, and Aditya Birla Sun Life MF. MedPlus has fixed the price band for its ₹1,398.29-crore IPO at ₹780-₹796 per share.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: LIC gets RBI nod to double its stake in IndusInd Bank to 9.99%
text: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has granted approval to Life Insurance Corporation (LIC) to increase its stake in IndusInd Bank to up to 9.99%, the bank said in a filing. LIC currently holds 4.95% of the total issued and paid up capital of IndusInd Bank. Shares of IndusInd Bank marginally rose to an intraday high of ₹966.60 on BSE.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Govt plans to privatise 25 airports under NMP by 2025: MoS Civil Aviation
text: Minister of State for Civil Aviation General Dr VK Singh told Lok Sabha the government has earmarked 25 airports for asset monetisation between 2022-2025 under the National Monetisation Pipeline (NMP). When asked about the criteria adopted for such privatisation, he said airports with annual traffic above 0.4 million passengers and a sizeable ongoing/proposed capex plan as per NIP were selected.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Shares of Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Star Health list at 6% discount
text: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Star Health and Allied Insurance shares got listed at 6.11% discount over its issue price of ₹900. The stock opened at ₹848 on the BSE, while the opening price on the NSE was ₹845. The initial public offering of Star Health was subscribed 79% during November 30 to December 2.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Jhunjhunwala-backed Metro Brands' ₹1,368-cr IPO booked 27% on day 1
text: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed footwear retailer Metro Brands' IPO was booked 27% on the first day of bidding on Friday. The company earlier said it had raised ₹410 crore from anchor investors. The price band for the IPO has been fixed at ₹485-₹500 per share and the company will raise ₹1,367.5 crore at the upper price band.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 3rd dose of our vaccine neutralises Omicron: Pfizer, BioNTech after initial studies
text: Pfizer and BioNTech in a joint statement on Wednesday said that preliminary laboratory studies demonstrate that the third dose of their COVID-19 vaccine neutralises the Omicron variant. "Data shows that the third dose increases the neutralising antibody titers by 25-fold compared to two doses against the Omicron variant," the companies said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Elon Musk's last remaining house sells for $30 million
text: Elon Musk, world's richest person with $282 billion fortune, has sold his last remaining home, a 47-acre Bay Area estate in Hillsborough, California, for $30 million, according to MLSListings.com. The property was listed for $37.5 million earlier this year. Tesla CEO Musk had said he was downsizing his life to work on sustainable energy for Earth and making life multi-planetary.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Most unusual, difficult year of my life: Bill Gates on spending 2021 mostly online
text: Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates in his blog post described how he had "the most unusual and difficult year" of his life, like many other people, amid COVID-19 pandemic. "My personal world...never felt smaller than it did," he said about spending his time mostly online. Talking about his divorce with Melinda, he added, "It's been a year of great personal sadness."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: RBI to launch UPI-based payment product for feature phones
text: The RBI on Wednesday said it will launch a UPI-based payment product for feature phone users. "Feature phone users have limited access to innovative payment products," RBI said. "Although feature phones have National Unified USSD Platform (NUUP) as an option for availing basic payment services using the short code of *99#, the same has not picked up," it added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Apple halted iPhone production for the first time in 10 years in Oct: Report
text: Apple had to halt iPhone and iPad production for the first time in over a decade in October 2021, Nikkei Asia reported on Wednesday. iPhone and iPad assembly was halted for several days due to supply chain constraints and restrictions on power usage in China. In September and October, iPhone 13 lineup's production reportedly fell 20% short of previous plans.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Is it fair to give 2nd chance: Mahindra after CEO who laid off 900 staff apologises
text: After Better.com CEO Vishal Garg apologised for the way he laid off 900 employees on a Zoom call, businessman Anand Mahindra questioned his Twitter followers whether he deserved a second chance. "I'm curious whether you think a CEO can survive after a blunder like this? Is it fair, or not, to allow a second chance?" the Mahindra Group Chairman wrote.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Fired Better.com employee says his work screens went black right after CEO's Zoom call
text: A man, who was among 900 Better.com employees laid off by CEO Vishal Garg on a Zoom call, told CNN his screens went black and he lost access to his company computer, phone and email. Christian Chapman said he resorted to Facebook to ask his colleagues about the layoffs. "It was...surreal moment," Chapman, a father of five children, said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Amazon fined $1.28 billion by Italy for alleged abuse of market dominance
text: Italy's antitrust authority has imposed a fine of 1.13 billion euros ($1.28 billion) on Amazon for alleged abuse of market dominance. Amazon leveraged its dominant position "to favour the adoption of its own logistics service - Fulfilment by Amazon (FBA) - by sellers active on Amazon", the watchdog said. The authority said it will also impose corrective steps on Amazon.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Better.com's 3 top execs resign after CEO fires 900 staff over a Zoom call: Reports
text: US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com's three top executives have resigned after CEO Vishal Garg fired 900 employees over a Zoom call, TechCrunch and Insider reported. The three executives are VP of Communications Patrick Lenihan, Head of PR Tanya Gillogley, and Head of Marketing Melanie Hahn. Separately, Garg apologised to his current employees for the "blundered execution" of layoffs.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: The brave die never...: Anand Mahindra on CDS General Bipin Rawat's demise
text: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra condoled CDS General Bipin Rawat's death in the Tamil Nadu helicopter crash by tweeting, "The brave die never, though they sleep in the dust: Their courage nerves a thousand living men." He added, "We salute our fallen heroes. Om shanti." CDS General Rawat, his wife Madhulika Rawat and 11 others died in the helicopter crash.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Russian billionaire Vladimir Potanin faces one of the biggest divorce claims of $7 bn
text: Russia's second-richest man Vladimir Potanin is facing a $7-billion divorce claim, one of the world's biggest divorce claims after Jeff Bezos and Bill Gates, from his ex-wife Natalia Potanina. Vladimir's ex-wife has reached a London court seeking 50% of the value of his stake in his mining company Nornickel. The amount could exceed $7 billion, Bloomberg reported.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Biocon in talks with Mylan to merge biosimilar businesses: Report
text: Biocon is in talks with Mylan for a merger of their biosimilar businesses, Moneycontrol reported. Biocon will seek to hold a controlling majority stake in the merged entity and the firms will look for an initial public offering (IPO) for the entity post-merger, it said. The firms will seek a valuation of over $10 billion from the IPO, it added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Serum Institute's Executive Director Dr Suresh Jadhav passes away aged 71
text: Dr Suresh Jadhav, Executive Director of world's largest vaccine maker Serum Institute of India (SII), has passed away in Pune at the age of 71. He had been with SII since 1979 and was also instrumental in the production of COVID-19 vaccine Covishield. "The Biotech world has lost an irreplaceable stalwart," Biocon Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw wrote on Twitter.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex ends 1,016 points higher after RBI keeps repo rate steady at 4%
text: The Indian benchmark indices extended their gains on Wednesday after the RBI kept repo rate unchanged at 4% for the ninth straight time amid concerns over Omicron COVID-19 variant. The Sensex jumped 1,016 points to close at 58,650, while the Nifty 50 index climbed 293 points to end at 17,470. Bajaj Finance, Maruti Suzuki and SBI were among top gainers.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Investors gain ₹7.5 lakh crore in 2 days as Sensex rises 1,903 points
text: Investors' wealth has surged by ₹7.5 lakh crore as Sensex gained nearly 2,000 points in two days. The benchmark index ended 1,016 points higher at 58,650 on Wednesday after closing 887 points higher on the previous day. The rally followed positive global cues and RBI's decision to keep repo rate unchanged at record low of 4%.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: COVAX still seeing strong demand for India-made AstraZeneca doses: GAVI
text: COVAX is still seeing strong demand for India-made doses of the AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine, Global Alliance for Vaccines and Immunizations (GAVI) said. This comes after Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla recently said it would temporarily halve vaccine's production as it had no fresh orders from government. COVAX was also placing orders at a "very slow" rate, he added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: RBI could lose control over money supply if crypto is allowed: Ex-Governor
text: Former RBI Governor Duvvuri Subbarao has said the central bank could lose control over money supply and inflation management if cryptocurrency is allowed in India. "There are also concerns that crypto will disrupt the monetary policy," he added. Rao also said that India's case for issuing a central bank digital currency may not be strong as there are capital controls.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Retail portion of MapmyIndia's ₹1,040-cr IPO fully booked in an hour of opening
text: The retail portion of MapMyIndia's ₹1,040-crore initial public offering (IPO) was fully subscribed within an hour of opening on Thursday. Meanwhile, its overall subscription stood at 0.74 times as of 12 pm. The company, which had mobilised ₹311.88 crore from 34 anchor investors ahead of the IPO, has fixed price band of ₹1,000-1,033 per share for the issue.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Mobile industry vital for India's vision for $5 tn economy by 2025: Birla
text: Chairman of Aditya Birla Group Kumar Mangalam Birla at India Mobile Congress event said, "I believe...the mobile industry will be vital in achieving India's vision to be a $5 trillion economy by 2025." Birla asserted that a robust industry is necessary to invest and accelerate achievement of Digital India vision. He called the industry "the growth engine" of Indian economy.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Cybersecurity, frauds main concerns with digital currency: RBI Governor
text: RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das has said cybersecurity and the possibility of digital frauds are main concerns with rolling out a central bank digital currency. He added one has to ensure cyber security and take preemptive steps to prevent any kind of fraud. Deputy Governor T Rabi Sankar said work is being done on two types of CBDCs, retail and wholesale.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Fitch cuts India's GDP forecast for 2021-22 to 8.4%
text: Fitch Ratings has cut India's GDP growth forecast for 2021-22 to 8.4% from its previous estimate of 8.7%, saying the rebound after the second wave of COVID-19 infections has been subdued than expected. Growth in the manufacturing sector is constrained by ongoing supply shortages, it added. However, it raised GDP growth projection for the next financial year to 10.3%.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: United Breweries challenges ₹752 crore CCI penalty before NCLAT
text: United Breweries (UBL) has approached the National Company Law Appellate Tribunal (NCLAT) against ₹751.8 crore penalty imposed on the company by the Competition Commission of India (CCI). In September, CCI had imposed the fine for alleged cartelisation in the sale and supply of beer. CCI had also imposed penalties on Carlsberg India, All India Brewers' Association (AIBA) and 11 individuals.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Construction steel prices rose up to 117% since Nov 2016: Govt
text: Prices of steel products used in the infrastructure sector such as wire rods, plates and TMT bars have gone up by 117% in last six years, Steel Minister RCP Singh informed the Parliament. Average price of plates (10 mm) increased to ₹69,852 per tonne (excluding GST) in November as against ₹32,244 per tonne in November 2016, he added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: China Evergrande defaults for 1st time on bonds worth $1.2 bn: Fitch
text: Fitch Ratings on Thursday said that China Evergrande Group has defaulted for the first time on more than $1.2 billion worth of bond debt. Fitch has downgraded the firm's status to 'restricted default' rating. The rating agency also downgraded Kaisa Group Holdings to 'restricted default', citing its failure to repay a $400 million bond that matured on Tuesday.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Vi rises 15% on reports that it raised funds for interest repayment
text: Shares of Vodafone Idea (Vi) rose by 14.98% to close at ₹16.43 on the BSE on Thursday. This comes after reports claimed that the company has raised enough funds for the repayment of interest to its bondholders amounting to nearly ₹6,000 crore. Last month, Vi had hiked mobile call and data tariffs by 18% to 25% for prepaid customers.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: 1.26 lakh jewellers registered for gold hallmarking since June: Govt
text: Over 1.26 lakh jewellers have registered for gold hallmarking since its mandatory implementation from June this year, the government said. About 4.29 crore pieces of jewellery were hallmarked between July 1 and November 30, Union Minister Ashwini Kumar Choubey informed the Parliament. An advisory committee was constituted to deal with the issues faced in its implementation, he added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: RBI will work on PMC Bank resolution very quickly: Governor
text: The RBI will act "very quickly" on Punjab and Maharashtra Cooperative (PMC) Bank's resolution once it receives feedback on the draft amalgamation scheme with Unity Small Finance Bank, its Governor Shaktikanta Das said. RBI has given stakeholders time till December 10 for comments on the scheme. According to the scheme, acquiring bank will pay up to ₹5 lakh to depositors.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: RBI keeps repo rate unchanged at record low of 4% for 9th time in a row
text: The RBI's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) on Wednesday kept the repo rate unchanged at a record low of 4% and reverse repo rate at 3.35% amid concerns over the new COVID-19 variant Omicron. The rates were also left unchanged during the last MPC meeting in October 2021. This is the ninth straight time repo rate has been unchanged at 4%.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: No new Covishield orders, production to be halved from next week: SII's Poonawalla
text: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla said that Covishield's production will be cut by at least 50% starting next week as it has no further orders from the government. World's biggest vaccine maker SII is currently producing 25 crore doses per month. "Over the eight months when we couldn't export...[Indian companies] lost a lot of market share," Poonawalla added.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Indian economy not immune to global spillovers, new variants like Omicron: RBI Governor
text: While announcing the monetary policy, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said that Indian economy is relatively "well-positioned on the path of recovery". However, he added, "It cannot be immune to global spillovers or to possible surges of infections from new mutations including the Omicron variant." The highest priority will be to put in "place credible and consistent policies", Das stated.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Apple CEO signed $275 bn deal with China in 2016 to quash regulatory actions: Report
text: Apple CEO Tim Cook signed a five-year agreement with Chinese officials in 2016, worth about $275 billion, promising Apple would do its part to develop China's economy, reported The Information. The deal was reportedly signed to quash the regulatory actions against Apple. As per internal company documents, Chinese officials believed Apple wasn't contributing enough to local economy before the deal.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: UPI limit for investing in IPOs, government securities raised to ₹5 lakh: RBI
text: The RBI announced that it's enhancing the transaction limit of UPI payments for investment in RBI Retail Direct Scheme for government securities (G-Secs) and IPOs from the current limit of ₹2 lakh to ₹5 lakh. To deepen digital payments further, the RBI will launch UPI-based payment products for feature phone users, Governor Shaktikanta Das said while announcing the monetary policy.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt may give crypto holders a deadline to declare assets, fine violators: Report
text: The government may reportedly give cryptocurrency holders a deadline to declare their assets and meet any new rules that will be announced through the cryptocurrency bill. Any violators could be fined up to ₹20 crore or face 1.5 years of imprisonment, Bloomberg reported citing sources. It may also prescribe a minimum threshold for investing in crypto assets, the report said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Ambani lists 5 ideas for connectivity, says '5G rollout should be national priority'
text: Speaking at India Mobile Congress, Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani shared five ideas related to the theme 'Connectivity for the next decade'. He said, "India must complete...migration from 2G to 4G to 5G at the earliest...Rollout of 5G should be India's national priority." He added that India should move towards greater digital inclusion and ubiquitous fibre connectivity should be done.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: You're a bunch of dumb dolphins: CEO who fired 900 employees in old e-mail to staff
text: An old e-mail by Vishal Garg to his employees, the CEO of US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com who recently fired 900 employees over a Zoom call, has resurfaced. In the e-mail obtained by Forbes, Garg wrote, "You are too slow. You are a bunch of Dumb Dolphins and…dumb dolphins get caught in nets and eaten by sharks."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Deeply sorry, I blundered execution: Better.com CEO who fired 900 staff on Zoom call
text: US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg, who recently fired 900 employees on Zoom call, has said he's "deeply sorry" for the way he "handled the layoffs". "I failed to show...appropriate amount of respect and appreciation for individuals who are affected," he wrote in his memo to current employees. "In communicating I blundered the execution...I embarrassed you," Garg said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Novelist sues Amazon as seller lists his book as centuries old, with $1,008 price tag
text: A novelist is suing Amazon after he discovered fake editions of his books being "fraudulently" advertised by third-party sellers as hundreds of years old on the website. One such edition of the $7-book was listed for $1,008, John C Boland's suit said. "When a seller claims to have a 1602 edition...it's defaming me by implying...that I'm a plagiarist," Boland said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India 'very unequal country'; top 10% hold 57% of total national income: Report
text: The World Inequality Report 2022 states, "India stands out as a poor and very unequal country, with an affluent elite." "While the top 10% hold 57% of total national income, the bottom 50 per cent's share has gone down to 13 per cent in 2021," it said. The report has also flagged a drop in global income during 2020.
author: Ankush Verma

headlines: RBI retains real GDP growth forecast at 9.5% for 2021-22
text: While announcing the monetary policy, RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das said real GDP growth projection for 2021-22 has been retained at 9.5% and projected growth for Q1 of 2022-23 is 17.2%. The Indian economy has "hauled itself out of one of the deepest contractions in first quarter of 2020-21", Das added. GDP growth expanded by 13.7% in first half of 2021-22.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Deposit $5 million in two weeks or face liquidation: Madras HC to SpiceJet
text: The Madras High Court has stayed its earlier order of winding up SpiceJet and appointing an official liquidator for SpiceJet's non-payment of $24 million to Credit Suisse AG. The Madras High Court has now asked SpiceJet to deposit $5 million within a period of two weeks. "The company is examining the order and shall initiate appropriate remedial steps," SpiceJet said.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: List of world's 100 most powerful women released by Forbes, MacKenzie Scott on top
text: The 2021 list of world's 100 most powerful women has been released by Forbes. Philanthropist MacKenzie Scott, the ex-wife of Amazon founder Jeff Bezos, has topped the list. She is followed by the US Vice President Kamala Harris. Christine Lagarde, the first woman to head the European Central Bank, is on the third spot. GM CEO Mary Barra comes fourth.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: UAE to move its weekend to Saturday and Sunday from Jan 1, 2022
text: The United Arab Emirates (UAE), which currently has a Sunday-Thursday working week, will switch its weekend to Saturday and Sunday from January 1, 2022. It will also adopt a four-and-a-half-day working week as the country looks to bring itself more in line with other countries. Friday, a holy day in Islam, will be a half-day in the UAE.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Who are the Indians in Forbes list of World's Most Powerful Women 2021?
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman is ranked 37th in the Forbes list of World's Most Powerful Women 2021. She has featured in the annual list for three years in a row. HCL Corporation CEO Roshni Nadar Malhotra is ranked 52nd. Biocon Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw is ranked 72nd, while India's richest self-made female billionaire Falguni Nayar is ranked 88th.
author: Anmol Sharma

headlines: Sensex briefly jumps 1,100 points, ends 887 points higher ahead of RBI policy
text: The Sensex on Tuesday briefly jumped more than 1,100 points and eventually ended 887 points higher at nearly 57,634 ahead of RBI's monetary policy announcement on December 8 (Wednesday). Meanwhile, the broader Nifty 50 jumped 264 points to close at 17,177. Tata Steel, Axis Bank, ICICI Bank and Kotak Mahindra Bank were the top Sensex gainers.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex jumps 800 points, reclaims 58,000 ahead of RBI monetary policy
text: Indian benchmark indices extended their gains from the previous day and opened higher on Wednesday ahead of RBI's monetary policy decision. The Sensex jumped over 800 points in early trade to cross 58,400, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped over 220 points to hit 17,400. IT, banking and financial stocks, including Infosys and Bajaj Finance, were among top gainers.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Tesla adds $40 billion to its market value in a day as shares rise
text: Tesla added $40 billion to its market value as shares rose as much as 4.4% on Tuesday, marking the strongest intraday gain in more than a week. World's richest person Elon Musk-led electric carmaker's shares rose after UBS boosted its price target to $1,000 from $725. "No rival will even get close to Tesla in 2022," a UBS analyst said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Hyundai to invest ₹3,995 cr to launch 6 EVs in India by 2028
text: Hyundai Motor plans to invest ₹3,995 crore to launch six electric vehicles in India by 2028. It will launch affordable and premium electric models including sport utility vehicles (SUVs) and sedans, starting with its first electric vehicle (EV) in 2022. "We want to be a key contributor to...EV story in India," Hyundai India's Director for sales and marketing said.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: MedPlus fixes price band for ₹1,398 crore IPO at ₹780-₹796 apiece
text: India's second-largest pharmacy retailer MedPlus Health Services has fixed the price band for its IPO at ₹780-₹796 per share. The issue will open for subscription on December 13 and close on December 15. MedPlus is seeking to raise as much as ₹1,398.29 crore through the IPO. The offer comprises fresh issuance of ₹600 crore and an offer-for-sale of ₹798.29 crore.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RateGain IPO subscribed 41% on day 1, retail portion booked 2.23 times
text: The ₹1,335 crore-IPO of travel and hospitality solutions provider RateGain Travel Technologies was subscribed 41% on the first day of bidding. The portion set aside for retail investors, which was subscribed 100% within the first hour of opening, was subscribed 2.23 times, whereas that of non-institutional investors was booked 4%. The price band for the IPO is ₹405-425 per share.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Elon Musk backs estate tax, says his marginal tax rate is high
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in response to a question about how billionaires should be taxed at a Wall Street Journal summit, said, "Generally, I think...estate tax is a good tax." He said that his marginal tax rate is high, and that he pays sales tax as well. Musk also reiterated opposition to a proposal by Democrats to tax billionaires.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: I work seven days and some 'pretty crazy hours': Elon Musk
text: Tesla and SpaceX's CEO Elon Musk at a Wall Street Journal conference said the role of a chief executive officer (CEO) is a "made-up title" and that he is splitting his time roughly evenly between Tesla and SpaceX. "It really depends on where I'm needed most," Musk said, adding that he works seven days and some "pretty crazy hours".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RIL forms $2 billion production JV with Abu Dhabi chemical company
text: Reliance Industries and Abu Dhabi state-owned Chemicals Derivatives Company (TA'ZIZ) have agreed to start a more than $2 billion chemical production partnership in Ruwais, Abu Dhabi. The joint venture will construct and operate a chloralkali, ethylene dichloride (EDC) and polyvinyl chloride (PVC) production facility. The project marks Reliance's first investment in the MENA region, TA'ZIZ said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: LG Energy Solution aims to raise $10.9 bn in S Korea's biggest IPO
text: LG Chem's wholly owned battery subsidiary LG Energy Solution is planning to raise up to 12.75 trillion won ($10.87 billion) in what would be South Korea's biggest-ever IPO. The offering could give LG Energy a market value of as much as 70.2 trillion won ($59.55 billion), making it South Korea's third most valuable company after Samsung Electronics and SK Hynix.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: FabIndia set to file for ₹3,770 crore IPO early next year: Report
text: Clothing brand FabIndia plans to file the draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) for an initial public offering (IPO) of as much as ₹3,770 crore ($500 million) as soon as early next year, Bloomberg reported. The company is reportedly considering seeking a valuation of about ₹15,084 crore ($2 billion). The IPO will largely consist of investors selling existing shares, it added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tweets cite old interview to claim BioNTech CEO didn't take COVID jab; firm responds
text: Several posts on social media, including Twitter, falsely claimed that Ugur Sahin, CEO of BioNTech, the German firm that made a COVID-19 vaccine with Pfizer, hasn't taken the jab. The posts cited Sahin's interview from December 2020, AP reported. Sahin got vaccinated in early 2021 using his company's product, a BioNTech spokesperson said, adding that the interview is "completely outdated".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Govt has no plans for boosting crypto sector in India: MoS Finance
text: MoS for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary told the Parliament on Monday that the government has "no plans for boosting the cryptocurrency sector in India". When questioned about how trustable cryptocurrency is and whether it's possible for government to regulate it, he said, "Currently, cryptocurrencies are unregulated in India." He added, "The government doesn't collect data on the cryptocurrency sector."
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Samsung merges mobile & consumer electronics businesses in biggest rejig since 2017
text: Samsung Electronics is merging two of its three divisions, mobile and consumer electronics businesses, into a newly-formed SET Division. The company will now have two new CEOs for its two divisions - the semiconductors business named Device Solutions and the newly-formed SET Division. It's the biggest management shakeup by Samsung since appointing three co-CEOs for its three divisions in 2017.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Which are now the world's top 10 cryptos as Luna overtakes Dogecoin, Shiba Inu?
text: Terraform Labs' Luna token has become the world's 10th largest cryptocurrency by market capitalisation, overtaking meme-based tokens Dogecoin and Shiba Inu. Bitcoin remains the world's largest cryptocurrency, followed by Ether, Binance Coin, Tether, Solana, Cardano, USD Coin, XRP and Polkadot. As per CoinMarketCap, Luna gained 30% in the last seven days, giving it a market value of $25 billion.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Better.com CEO Vishal Garg fires 900 employees over a video call
text: Better.com CEO Vishal Garg announced the mortgage company is laying off 900 employees over a video call. "If you're on this call...you're part of the unlucky group being laid off," Garg said on the call that surfaced on social media. "This is the second time in my career I'm doing this...The last time I did it, I cried," he added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Zoho's billionaire CEO drives Mahindra auto, offers Anand Mahindra suggestions
text: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu on Monday tweeted that he recently got a new Mahindra Electric Treo auto and added, "I love driving it around!" Vembu went on to offer some suggestions to Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra, which included bringing the auto's price down by increasing volume. "Please offer a variety of designs and colours," Vembu added.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: 250 of them were working just 2 hours a day: Better.com CEO who fired 900 staff
text: US-based mortgage lender Better.com's CEO Vishal Garg, who fired 900 employees over a video call, claimed that 250 of them were working two hours a day while clocking over eight hours daily in the payroll system. "They were stealing from you and stealing from our customers who pay the bills that pay our bills," he wrote in a blog post.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: No data on COVID-related suicides among traders, businessmen: Govt
text: The Ministry of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) on Monday said in the Rajya Sabha that the government does not have any data on COVID-19-related suicides among vendors, tradesmen and businessmen. "This Ministry doesn't maintain data of suicides," the MSME stated. Notably, 11,716 businessmen died by suicide in 2020 as per the NCRB 2020 report, released in September 2021.
author: Atul Mishra

headlines: Jhunjhunwala-backed Metro Brands to sell shares at ₹485-500 apiece in ₹1,368-cr IPO
text: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed footwear retailer Metro Brands has fixed the price band for its IPO at ₹485-500 per share. At the upper price band, the company will raise ₹1,367.5 crore. The IPO will open for subscription on December 10 and close on December 14. Founded in 1947, Metro Brands operates brands such as Metro, Mochi, Walkway and Crocs.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Sensex falls 949 points to end at 56,747, Nifty below 16,950 amid Omicron concerns
text: Sensex fell 949 points to close at 56,747 while Nifty ended 284 points lower at 16,912 on Monday amid concerns regarding the Omicron COVID-19 variant. Among sectors, the IT index fell over 2%, while other sectors lost a percent each. Key benchmark indices have extended losses and registered fresh intra-day lows with major weakness witnessed in IT and FMCG stocks.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: Sensex jumps 900 points, a day after losing 950 points amid Omicron concerns
text: The Sensex jumped more than 900 points during intraday trade, a day after it ended nearly 950 points lower at 56,747 amid concerns regarding Omicron COVID-19 variant. On Tuesday, Sensex was trading at 57,600 levels, while the broader Nifty 50 jumped over 250 points to trade near 17,200. Kotak Mahindra Bank, ICICI Bank and Axis Bank were top gainers.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: HCL Technologies to hire 12,000 in US over 5 years
text: HCL Technologies will hire 12,000 people in the US over the next five years. Nearly 2,000 of the new jobs will go to college graduates over the next three years, HCL said, adding it will focus its recruitment drive on seven states. Hiring will be done across roles including in IT consulting, cloud, data analytics and digital engineering.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Bitcoin falls 5% to trade below $48,000, Ether down 5.5%
text: World's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell as low as 5% on Monday and was trading below $48,000. Ether, the second-largest digital currency, was also trading 5.5% lower at $3,965. The development came after several global cryptocurrencies plunged over the weekend amid worries about the Omicron variant of coronavirus. Bitcoin lost over a fifth of its value at one point on Saturday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Granting cryptos the status of financial asset fraught with risks: CEA
text: Chief Economic Adviser KV Subramanian said granting cryptocurrencies the status of a financial asset is fraught with risks currently. "A cryptocurrency doesn't derive its value from any underlying assets or earnings...So, valuation can be easily swayed with speculative bids, causing excessive volatility," he added. "Retail investors...would struggle to cope with such wild fluctuations," he said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Tesla shares fall on report of SEC probe into solar panel defects
text: Tesla shares fell as much as 5.5% on Monday after Reuters reported that the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) has opened an investigation into the company. The agency reportedly launched a probe over a whistleblower complaint from a former employee alleging Tesla failed to properly notify shareholders and the public of fire risks associated with its solar panel systems.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: RateGain Travel raises ₹598 cr from anchor investors ahead of IPO
text: RateGain Travel Technologies has raised ₹598.83 crore from 34 anchor investors, including the Government of Singapore, Monetary Authority of Singapore, Nomura, Goldman Sachs, BNP Paribas, HSBC, the company said. RateGain, a SaaS provider to the hospitality and travel industry, aims to raise ₹1,335 crore through IPO. The issue will open for subscription on December 7 and close on December 9.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Retail portion of RateGain IPO 100% booked within 1st hour of opening
text: The retail portion of the IPO of travel and hospitality solutions provider RateGain Travel Technologies was subscribed 100% within the first hour of the opening of the issue on December 7. The ₹1,335 crore-IPO was subscribed 19%. Investors bid for 33 lakh equity shares against an IPO size of 1.73 crore units. The issue will close for subscription on Thursday.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: States entering into MoUs with Amazon unfortunate: CAIT
text: Traders' body CAIT said it is "most unfortunate and regrettable" that several Indian states have entered into memorandum of understandings (MoUs) with Amazon to sell products of government agencies. Such MoUs are strongly contradicting "Aatmanirbhar Bharat" and "Vocal for Local" campaign initiated by PM Narendra Modi, it added. "Amazon is continuously violating Indian laws & rules," CAIT said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Goldman Sachs, Morgan Stanley to bid for MapmyIndia's IPO: Report
text: Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley are among institutional investors bidding to participate in the initial public offering (IPO) of digital-map provider MapmyIndia, Bloomberg reported. Mutual funds of HDFC, SBI, Aditya Birla Group and ICICI Bank are also bidding to become anchor investors in the IPO, it added. The price band for the IPO has been fixed at ₹1,000-1,033 per share.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ₹100 cr unaccounted income detected after raids on Kolkata-based group
text: The Income Tax Department has detected unaccounted income of about ₹100 crore after it raided a Kolkata-based group, engaged in manufacturing of TMT bars and construction material, the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) said. It further said that ₹75 lakh cash and jewellery valued at ₹2.26 crore were seized. Some bank lockers were put under restraint, it said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Companies raised ₹52,759 crore from IPOs in 2021-22 till October: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday informed the Lok Sabha that 61 companies have raised ₹52,759 crore through initial public offerings (IPOs) in financial year 2021-22 till October. Out of the 61 firms, 34 entities were small and medium enterprises (SMEs), she added. In the last fiscal, 56 companies had garnered ₹31,060 crore from IPOs, Sitharaman said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Will pay ₹1,000 cr to Reliance Infra's arm in 48 hours: Delhi Metro to HC
text: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) told the Delhi High Court that it will pay ₹1,000 crore to Anil Ambani-led Reliance Infrastructure's subsidiary, Delhi Airport Metro Express, within 48 hours. DMRC has sought time to compute entire amount of liability. In September, Supreme Court had upheld an arbitration award worth over ₹4,600 crore in favour of Reliance Infrastructure against DMRC.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Ethos, Senco plan to launch IPOs worth ₹500 crore each in Jan: Report
text: Luxury watch retailer Ethos and jewellery retailer Senco, are planning to launch IPOs worth ₹500 crore each, The Economic Times reported. The IPOs could be launched in January, it added. Ethos, which is an authorised retailer for watch brands such as Rolex, Omega and Tag Heuer, is reportedly working with Emkay Global and Incred Capital for the IPO.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Ted Baker Chairman John Barton dies aged 77
text: British luxury clothing retail firm Ted Baker on Monday said that its Chairman John Barton has died at the age of 77. The firm did not specify the cause of his death, but said it was sudden. Senior independent director Helena Feltham will take on the role of Interim Chairman with immediate effect, the company added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Hindustan Unilever MD Sanjiv Mehta to be appointed FICCI President
text: The Federation of Indian Chambers of Commerce & Industry (FICCI) on Monday announced that Hindustan Unilever's Chair and Managing Director Sanjiv Mehta will be appointed as its President on December 18. Mehta, who currently serves as FICCI's Senior Vice President, will succeed Uday Shankar, the former President of The Walt Disney Company Asia Pacific.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: India's airlines incurred loss of ₹19,564 crore in 2020-21: Govt
text: The airlines in India incurred an estimated loss of ₹19,564 crore in 2020-21 due to disruption caused by COVID-19 pandemic, Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh said. Indian airports also suffered an estimated loss of ₹5,116 crore in the last fiscal, he added. Scheduled domestic flights were suspended in India from March 25 to May 24 last year.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Agri products' FY22 export target of $43 bn set to be achieved: Minister
text: Union Minister Anupriya Patel has said that India's record export target of $43 billion for agricultural products in 2021-22 would be achieved. The target would be achieved because of the efforts by farmers and APEDA, she added. India has set a $400 billion target for merchandise exports for FY22, of which $262 billion has already been achieved, Patel said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Trump's social media venture TRUTH Social claims to raise $1 billion
text: Donald Trump's new social media venture, TRUTH Social, said it has entered into agreements to raise about $1 billion from a group of investors. "$1 billion sends an important message to Big Tech that censorship and political discrimination must end. America is ready for TRUTH Social, a platform that will not discriminate on the basis of political ideology," said Trump.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: A lot of speculation is happening on crypto, it's not healthy: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman at the Hindustan Times Leadership Summit 2021 said there is a lot of unregulated speculation happening on cryptocurrencies. "It is not healthy at all," she added. She reiterated that a "well-consulted bill" on cryptocurrency is coming through and it will be introduced in the Parliament after the Cabinet clears it.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Ratan Tata to be conferred Assam's highest civilian award 'Asom Baibhav'
text: The Chief Minister of Assam, Himanta Biswa Sarma, on Saturday announced that the state has chosen 19 personalities for its three newly-instituted awards - Asom Baibhav, Asom Sourav and Asom Gourav. He said industrialist and Tata Trusts' Chairman Ratan Tata will be conferred the state's highest civilian award, Asom Baibhav, for his exceptional contribution towards furthering cancer care in Assam.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Which are the world's cheapest cities to live in?
text: As per the Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU)'s Worldwide Cost of Living 2021 survey, Damascus in Syria is the world's cheapest city to live in. Tripoli (Libya), Tashkent (Uzbekistan), Tunis (Tunisia) and Almaty (Kazakhstan) are also among the top five cheapest cities. Pakistan's Karachi is in the sixth position and India's Ahmedabad (in Gujarat) is ranked seventh.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Salesmen threaten to disrupt supplies to kirana stores in protest against Reliance
text: Household goods salesmen have threatened to disrupt supplies to kirana stores if consumer companies provide products at lower prices to Reliance Industries, Reuters reported. Last year, salesmen of companies like Unilever and Colgate-Palmolive saw a 20-25% drop in their sales. The drop in sales was attributed to kirana stores ordering digitally from JioMart owing to 'deeply discounted offerings'.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: IMF likely to lower global economic growth estimates due to Omicron: MD
text: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) is likely to lower its global economic growth estimates due to the Omicron variant of COVID-19, its MD Kristalina Georgieva said. "A new variant that may spread very rapidly can dent confidence...we're likely to see some downgrades of our October projections," she added. The Omicron variant has been detected in around 40 countries, officials said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Let's not repeat past mistakes in electric mobility: NITI Aayog CEO
text: NITI Aayog's CEO Amitabh Kant said India must learn from the mistakes made in electronics and solar manufacturing and not repeat them with electric mobility. Kant said, "In the last 70 years, India has always been getting into the sunset areas of industry." "We must make India the centre of manufacturing both for Indian market and...the world," he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: El Salvador buys Bitcoin worth $7.3 mn as it falls as low as 22%
text: El Salvador purchased Bitcoin worth more than $7.3 million after the world's largest cryptocurrency plunged as low as 22% to $41,967 on Saturday. "El Salvador just bought the dip! 150 coins at an average USD price of ~$48,670," the country's President Nayib Bukele tweeted. The market capitalisation of global cryptocurrencies has dropped nearly 15% to $2.34 trillion, as per CoinGecko.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Hero Electric plans to raise $200 million to $300 million: Report
text: India's largest electric two-wheeler maker Hero Electric is planning to raise fresh funds to the tune of $200-$300 million, reported Moneycontrol. It will reportedly look to tap private equity funds and pension funds for the new round. Hero Electric's MD Naveen Munjal told Moneycontrol that seeking investments are a continuous process for any company to scale and meet market demand.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: MapmyIndia IPO to open on December 9 at ₹1,000-1,033 per share
text: The IPO of CE Info Systems, which operates MapMyIndia, will open for subscription on December 9. The company, which powers Apple maps in India, has fixed a price band at ₹1,000-1,033 per share for the IPO. The IPO is entirely an offer for sale of 1,00,63,945 shares with a face value of ₹2 each by existing shareholders and promoters.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Create a powerful, seamless platform like UPI: Vaishnaw to bankers
text: IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw has challenged bankers to create a platform as powerful and seamless as the UPI (Unified Payments Interface) for providing quick and easy credit to people at the bottom of the pyramid. "Work on the challenge for the next three months...I'll work the whole day with you to look at the concepts you have brought," he said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: We must look beyond valuations for startup IPOs: Edelweiss Chairman
text: Edelweiss Group's Chairman Rashesh Shah said that everyone should look beyond valuations in case of startup IPOs. "Like most other markets, the startup market also goes through up cycles and down cycles. We are currently in what is clearly an upcycle," he added. "We must...focus on the real and tangible change that these startups are bringing...to the ecosystem," Shah said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Long waiting periods amid chip shortage can impact demand: Maruti official
text: Longer waiting periods with semiconductor shortage affecting production can have a negative impact on car demand, Maruti Suzuki India's Senior Executive Director (Marketing and Sales) Shashank Srivastava said. Maruti has a pending order of around 2.5 lakh units, while production was over 80% of normal in November, he added. Supply constraints have improved in last few months, he said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Tesla's duty cut proposal being evaluated by govt: NITI Aayog CEO
text: NITI Aayog's CEO Amitabh Kant told ET the government is currently evaluating Tesla's proposal seeking a reduction in import duties ahead of a local launch and a decision will be taken shortly. Kant earlier told CNBC-TV18, "India's objective is to ensure Tesla makes in India for the world." He said Tesla wants to test the market before investing in India.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Indian economy fastest in world to come out of COVID-19's impact: Shah
text: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said Indian economy is the fastest in the world to come out of the impact of COVID-19 pandemic. It was due to the policy decisions taken by Modi government, he added. PM Modi visualised that economic slump would affect the world, but government's policy decisions ensured that global economic slowdown didn't touch India, Shah said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: I'm hopeful this year's GDP will be very encouraging: FM Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, at the Hindustan Times Leadership Summit, said "I am very hopeful that this year's GDP would be very encouraging and we will still be the fastest-growing economy in the world." She added, "An element of uncertainty continues over the Omicron variant of the coronavirus. But Indians are resilient, they've shown they can adapt to any situation."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Grab opportunity created by closure of plants in China: Rane to entrepreneurs
text: Union Minister of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) Narayan Rane has urged Indian entrepreneurs to take advantage of closure of factories in China. "China is number one in the world in terms of production...However, many companies are shutting down [in China]," Rane said. "I've urged...industrialists to capture this opportunity and start manufacturing these products in India," he said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Shriram Properties fixes price band at ₹113-118 per share for ₹600-cr IPO
text: Shriram Properties has fixed the price band for its ₹600-crore IPO at ₹113-₹118 per share. The IPO, which will open for subscription on December 8, comprises a fresh issue of ₹250 crore and an offer for sale of ₹350 crore by investors. Of the issue size, 75% portion is reserved for qualified institutional buyers and 15% for non-institutional investors.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Emphasis on infra spending to continue in Budget 2022: FM Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has said that emphasis on infrastructure spending will continue in the upcoming Budget 2022 to some extent. Speaking at the Hindustan Times Leadership Summit, she also said that the government is continuously taking policy decisions for ease of doing business. "If decision-making is complicated, time-consuming and burdensome, it cannot help," she added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Talks of reverse repo rate hike at RBI MPC meet may be premature: SBI report
text: The talks of a reverse repo rate hike at the RBI's Monetary Policy Committee (MPC) meeting on December 8 may be premature, SBI's house economists said in a report. "RBI has been able to narrow the corridor without the noise of rate hikes and ensuing market cacophony," they added. They also urged the RBI to delay liquidity normalisation measures.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Evergrande shares hit 11-year-low after it gives no guarantee on repayments
text: China's Evergrande Group shares fell 12% to an 11-year low on Monday after the firm said there was no guarantee it would have enough funds to meet debt repayments. A 30-day grace period on a coupon payment of $82.5 million due on November 6 ends on Monday. Evergrande said it received a demand from creditors to pay about $260 million.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Working from home will not go away post COVID-19: Anand Mahindra
text: Mahindra Group's Chairman Anand Mahindra on Saturday tweeted that working from home will not go away even after the COVID-19 pandemic is over. "Some form of hybrid work culture will endure," he said. Mahindra also posted a report announcing that Tech Mahindra has acquired a 100% stake in Activus Connect, a work-at-home customer experience management solutions provider, for $62 million.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Time of extreme pain in India, economy below 2019 levels: Abhijit Banerjee
text: Nobel laureate Abhijit Banerjee has said people in India are in extreme pain and the economy is still below the 2019 levels. Speaking at Ahmedabad University's convocation ceremony, he further said, "I...spent some time in rural West Bengal and the stories you hear about...dashed aspirations of...people are very real." People had small aspirations which have become smaller now, Banerjee added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Infosys to do away with COO role after Rao's retirement: Report
text: Infosys will do away with the role of Chief Operating Officer (COO) after incumbent Pravin Rao retires this month, reported Moneycontrol. The company will instead create a leadership structure giving key leaders additional responsibilities, it added. Rao was inducted in 2014 as a member of the company's board and also serves as the board's Whole-time Director.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Over 3 crore ITRs filed for AY 2021-22 on new I-T portal: Govt
text: More than 3 crore income tax returns have now been filed for the assessment year 2021-22 on the new I-T portal, the Ministry of Finance said in a statement. "The number of ITRs filed per day is over 4 lakh and increasing everyday," it added. The last date for filing ITR for individual taxpayers is December 31.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: IPO-bound LIC improves asset quality, lowers net NPA to 0.05%
text: Ahead of its proposed initial public offering (IPO), LIC has improved its asset quality for financial year 2020-21. According to LIC's latest annual report, its sub-standard assets are ₹254.37 crore, whereas the doubtful assets are ₹20,369.17 crore and loss assets are ₹14,506.35 crore. LIC's net NPA was at 0.05% at March-end, as against 0.79% in the previous year.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: SBI to auction KSK Mahanadi's NPA account to recover ₹4,100 cr dues
text: The SBI will auction a non-performing asset (NPA) account of KSK Mahanadi Power on December 31 to recover outstanding dues of over ₹4,100 crore. It has invited bids from asset reconstruction firms, banks, NBFCs and financial institutions for the sale. The reserve price for the sale has been set at ₹1,423.17 crore, the bank said in an auction notice.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Elon Musk loses $15 billion in a day as tech stocks slump
text: World's richest person Elon Musk's wealth dropped by $15 billion on Friday, the most among tech billionaires, as Tesla shares extended losses amid fears of inflation. His net worth fell to $268.9 billion, Bloomberg reported. Jeff Bezos' net worth dropped by $2.7 billion as Amazon shares declined. Top 10 US tech billionaires' combined wealth fell by $27.4 billion on Friday.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: $1 trillion wiped off Chinese stocks in US in 10 months amid tech crackdown
text: Chinese stocks trading in the US have lost over $1 trillion in market value since their record highs in mid-February amid a crackdown on tech industry. Billionaire Jack Ma's Alibaba Group lost the most during the period as its market value fell by $430 billion or 60%. On Friday, Nasdaq Golden Dragon China Index, which tracks these stocks, fell 9.1%.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Got copies of Musk's straight, male, PayPal mafia e-mail group: Courtney Love
text: US singer Courtney Love Cobain told the world's richest person Elon Musk on Twitter, "You know your straight, male, PayPal mafia email group? I was on bcc for months on that." She wrote, "With that information in mind, don't you think in a 'civilised society' one should embrace paying...fair share of tax?" "Don't pick on [Senator] Bernie [Sanders]," Cobain said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Banks may lose parts of traditional business to Google Pay, PhonePe: Uday Kotak
text: India's richest banker Uday Kotak has said Indian lenders may end up losing large parts of their traditional business to digital wallet platforms like Google Pay and Walmart-backed PhonePe. Banks need to scale up technology, Kotak Mahindra Bank's CEO added. "Bankers were short-sighted over the last three years...Their standard response was 'oh, there's no money in payments'," Kotak said further.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Wouldn't want crypto investors to marry into my family: 97-yr-old billionaire Munger
text: Charlie Munger, Warren Buffett's longtime business partner, said in an interview that he "wouldn't want" anyone who invests in cryptocurrencies "to marry into my family". "The people who are getting in cryptocurrencies are not thinking about the customer, they're thinking about themselves," the 97-year-old billionaire added. Munger also praised China's crypto ban as the "correct decision".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Bitcoin plunges 20%, cryptocurrency market's value falls to $2.2 trillion
text: World's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin plunged more than 20% on Saturday and fell to as low as $42,296, before paring some of the losses. Meanwhile, the second-largest cryptocurrency Ether also fell as much as 17.4%. The overall cryptocurrency sector shed around a fifth of its market capitalisation, taking its total value to $2.2 trillion, according to CoinGecko.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: $230 billion wiped off Meta's market value in last three months
text: Facebook parent Meta has lost about $230 billion from its market value since September 7. The slump in Meta's shares in the recent months has been driven by former employee and whistleblower Frances Haugen's revelations and disappointing quarterly results. Meta shares fell 8% for the week ending December 3, on track to suffer its worst weekly decline since June 2020.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Paytm shares jump after it receives first 'buy' rating post IPO
text: Shares of Paytm parent One97 Communications jumped after receiving the first 'buy' rating since the company's stock market debut. Dolat Capital said it expects Paytm to turn profitable by March 2026 and has set a target price of ₹2,500, 16% higher than its issue price of ₹2,150. The company's shares closed 3.08% higher on Friday at ₹1649.80 on the BSE.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Grab CEO briefly turns billionaire before ride-hailing app loses $17 bn in m-cap
text: Southeast Asia's biggest ride-hailing and delivery app Grab fell over 20% in US stock market debut on Thursday, wiping about $17 billion from its market capitalisation. Its Co-founder and CEO Anthony Tan briefly became a billionaire before the value of his stake dropped to $725 million. "The price makes no difference...I'm going to celebrate tonight," Tan said after the listing.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Ratan Tata likens COVID-19 to world war, calls it opportunity to innovate
text: Tata Sons Chairman Emeritus Ratan Tata in an interview with YourStory likened coronavirus to world war and called it an opportunity for entrepreneurs to innovate. "The virus will disappear in a period of time, but the innovativeness that we bring...would be something we could look back on and say there was a good part of what we faced," he added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: PepsiCo's patent on potato variety grown for Lay's chips revoked by India
text: The Protection of Plant Varieties and Farmers' Rights (PPVFR) Authority has revoked a patent for a potato variety grown exclusively for PepsiCo's Lay's potato chips. The body agreed with activist Kavitha Kuruganti's contention that PepsiCo can't claim a patent over a seed variety. In 2019, PepsiCo sued some Gujarati farmers for cultivating FC5 potato variety, saying they infringed patent rights.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Anand Mahindra shares pics of sunset in Kochi, says 'God's own country, indeed'
text: Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra has tweeted pictures of sunset taken in Kerala's Kochi. "God's own country? Yes indeed. Without exaggeration," he wrote with the pictures. "Beautiful no doubt about it, truly it's God's own country having spent some wonderful time there with family," a Twitter user reacted on his post.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Which cities have the highest petrol prices in the world?
text: As per Economist Intelligence Unit (EIU) Worldwide Cost of Living 2021 survey, petrol is the most expensive in Hong Kong at $2.50 (around ₹190) per litre. Netherlands' Amsterdam ($2.18/litre) and Norway's Oslo ($2.06/litre) have the second and third-highest petrol costs. Israel's Tel Aviv ($2/litre), which emerged as the world's most expensive city overall, ranked fourth in the petrol prices list.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Which are the best and worst cities for expats in 2021 as per a recent survey?
text: Kuala Lumpur has been ranked the best place to live for expats in 2021, according to a survey conducted by Munich-based expat network InterNations. Kuala Lumpur is followed by Málaga in Spain, Dubai, Sydney and Singapore in the top five. Rome was ranked the worst place for expats, while Milan, Johannesburg, Istanbul and Tokyo were among the bottom five.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: US woman wins $10mn case against Walmart after stepping on nail, losing part of leg
text: Walmart has been ordered to pay $10 million in damages to a woman who filed a lawsuit against the company after losing part of her leg after she stepped on a rusty nail in their store in US. The woman said that because of the infection from the nail in 2015, most of her right leg was amputated.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Jhunjhunwala-backed footwear firm Metro Brands' IPO to open on December 10
text: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed footwear retailer Metro Brands' IPO will open for subscription on December 10 and close on December 14. The IPO comprises a fresh issue of ₹295 crore and an offer for sale of 2.14 crore shares by its existing shareholders and promoters. Founded in 1947, Metro Brands operates brands such as Metro, Mochi, Walkway and Crocs.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Billionaire Mark Cuban buys entire town named Mustang with population of 23 in US
text: US billionaire Mark Cuban has bought the entire town of Mustang in Texas for an undisclosed amount. The 77-acre town is said to have a population of 23 people and was first put up on sale in 2017 with an asking price of $4 million. "I don't know what, if anything, I will do with it (Mustang)," Cuban told media.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Vodafone files for settlement of ₹20,000-cr retro tax dispute with India
text: Vodafone Group has filed an application with the Indian government to settle its ₹20,000-crore retrospective tax dispute. Vodafone further said it has "always been confident" that no tax is due on the company. The government in August passed the Taxation Laws (Amendment) Bill, 2021 to do away with retrospective tax demand provisions.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: World's largest shipping company to give $1,000 each to 80,000 employees
text: World's largest shipping company Maersk will give a $1,000 bonus each to 80,000 employees worldwide as the company heads for record profits this year, Bloomberg reported citing an internal memo. The company's top 400 managers are not included in the programme. As per estimates, Maersk is set to report a net income of more than $17 billion this year.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I believe in blockchain tech, it's different from crypto: Ambani
text: Speaking at the InFinity Forum, Asia's richest person and Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani said, "Blockchain is the technology I believe in and it's different from cryptocurrency." He noted that digital technology is "a great leveller" and "democratiser". "We are witnessing the fourth revolution...the digital-first revolution," he said, adding that it will be "the people's first world".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: I wish cryptocurrencies had never been invented: Berkshire's Munger
text: Berkshire Hathaway's Vice Chairman Charlie Munger said he wishes cryptocurrencies had never been invented. "I admire the Chinese, I think they made the correct decision, which was to simply ban them. In my country, the English-speaking civilisation has made the wrong decision," Munger said at the Sohn conference. "I just can't stand participating in these insane booms," he added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Distinction needed between crypto as asset & currency: CEA Subramanian
text: Chief Economic Adviser KV Subramanian on Friday said that a distinction is needed between cryptocurrency as an asset and as a currency. "For currencies, there are important considerations that need to come in. There is no underlying that backs the cryptocurrency price," he said. "A financial innovation that is a zero-sum game has to be treaded carefully," Subramanian added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: FBI yet to find proof for claim that Saudi hacked Bezos' phone: Report
text: The FBI is yet to find proof to support claims of alleged hacking of Amazon's Jeff Bezos' phone by Saudi Arabia, Business Insider reported citing a WSJ report. The FBI began investigating the hacking theory after the National Enquirer story on Bezos' affair with Lauren Sanchez was published. However, Saudi Arabia had called the hacking allegations "absurd".
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Fraud-accused Theranos Founder's 4 am daily schedule shared amid trial
text: American blood-testing startup Theranos Founder Elizabeth Holmes' handwritten note detailing her daily schedule was shared during her fraud trial. The schedule begins with a 4 am wakeup time to "rise & thank God" and ends with lunch and dinner menus. It also includes a set of notes that Holmes claims were her ex-boyfriend and ex-Theranos President Ramesh 'Sunny' Balwani's precepts.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SoftBank COO seeking $2 bn in compensation over next few yrs: NYT
text: Japanese conglomerate SoftBank's Chief Operating Officer Marcelo Claure is seeking roughly $2 billion in compensation over the next several years, reported The New York Times. SoftBank executives are reportedly willing to pay Claure "tens of millions of dollars" at most. The company said, "SoftBank and Claure are actively engaged in discussions about his role at the company and his compensation."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Tega Industries' ₹619-crore IPO subscribed 219 times on final day
text: Kolkata-based Tega Industries' ₹619-crore initial public offer (IPO) was subscribed 219.04 times on the last day of subscription. It received bids for 209.58 crore shares against an offer size of 95.68 lakh shares. The portion reserved for non-institutional investors was booked 666.19 times. The issue, which is a complete offer-for-sale, was fully subscribed within an hour of bidding on Wednesday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Star Health cuts IPO size after 79% subscription on last day: Report
text: Billionaire Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Star Health and Allied Insurance will cut the offer-for-sale portion of its ₹7,249-crore IPO, Reuters reported. The development comes after the company's offer was subscribed 79%, despite extending the subscription period. India's largest private health insurer Star Health's IPO was set to be the country's third-largest IPO of 2021 after Paytm and Zomato.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Millennials can now start goal-based investments even with ₹500: Moneyfy
text: Aiming to make investing easy and uncomplicated, Tata Capital's Moneyfy App promises to take care of your financial needs and aspirations from goal-setting to transacting. With Moneyfy App, you can invest in a SIP with as low as ₹500. Goal-based financial planning is now achievable as one can choose from diverse well-researched and unbiased mutual fund schemes, said Tata Capital.
author: Roshan Gupta

headlines: Dorsey's Square changes company name to 'Block' after he resigns as Twitter CEO
text: Payments company Square has announced that it's changing its corporate name to 'Block', effective December 10, amid its plan to expand into new technologies like blockchain. This comes days after its Founder and CEO Jack Dorsey stepped down as Twitter CEO. The name change is intended to house the company's products, including Cash App, TBD, and Square, under one brand.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Elon Musk mocks Twitter's CEO change with meme showing Parag Agrawal as Stalin
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk mocked Twitter's recent changes by sharing a meme showing new Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal as former Soviet Union dictator Joseph Stalin.
