It also showed Jack Dorsey as Stalin's aide Nikolay Yezhov, who was assassinated. Musk's tweet may've been a dig on Agrawal's past comments on free speech as Twitter banned posting of pictures without people's consent.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Musk, Bezos sell over $20 billion worth of Tesla, Amazon stock this year
text: World's two richest person Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos have sold over $20 billion of their companies' shares between them so far this year, as stock sales by CEOs soared to a record high. Tesla CEO Musk sold over $10 billion worth of shares, as of Thursday. Amazon's Founder and former CEO Bezos has shed $10 billion worth of shares.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Nothing wrong with Indians going abroad & excelling, I'd applaud them: Narayana Murthy
text: Infosys Co-founder NR Narayana Murthy told Moneycontrol that a small percentage of Indians going abroad and excelling in their profession only "enhances the brand image of India". "[They're] our ambassadors...I'd like to applaud them rather than say they've to stay back in India. There's nothing wrong," Murthy said. His comments come days after India-born Parag Agrawal was appointed Twitter CEO.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Google indefinitely delays office return plan amid concerns over Omicron: Report
text: Alphabet's Google has indefinitely delayed its mandatory return-to-office plan globally amid concerns over the Omicron variant of COVID-19, Reuters reported. In August, Google said it'd expect workers to come in three days a week from January 10, 2022, ending its voluntary work-from-home policy. Google was one of the first companies to ask employees to work from home during COVID-19 pandemic.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Adani shares pic with Mamata, says 'discussed investment scenarios in WB'
text: Industrialist Gautam Adani on Thursday shared an image with West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee and said he discussed different investment scenarios with her. "Discussed different investment scenarios and the tremendous potential of West Bengal. I look forward to attending the Bengal Global Business Summit (BGBS) in April 2022," Adani tweeted. Reportedly, the meeting lasted over one hour.
author: Shalini Ojha

headlines: MP Police officer who took action against Amazon in weed smuggling case transferred
text: Bhind SP Manoj Kumar Singh, who took action against Amazon India officials in the alleged smuggling of marijuana through its platform, is among 13 IPS officers who were transferred in Madhya Pradesh on Wednesday. Sharing the list, Confederation of All India Traders' Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said, "It shows how the government's working under pressure of Amazon on MP government."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki to hike prices in January
text: India's largest carmaker Maruti Suzuki on Thursday said that it will hike prices in January next year due to increase in various input costs. "It has become imperative for the company to pass on some impact of the...additional costs to customers through a price hike," Maruti said. The price hike shall vary for different models, the company added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Founders smiling with pride: Mahindra as govt unveils special stamp on Group's 75th yr
text: Minister of State for Communications, Devusinh Chauhan, on Wednesday released the commemorative stamp marking 75 years of the Mahindra Group. Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra wrote on Twitter, "Our founders started the company to serve the nation & I know, wherever they are now, they're smiling with pride." "They [Mahindra Group] showcase Atmanirbhar Bharat," Chauhan said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Disney names Susan Arnold as its 1st woman Chairman in 98-year history
text: Walt Disney has elected a woman to become its chairman for the first time in its 98-year history. Susan Arnold, who has been a board member for 14 years, will succeed Bob Iger as Chairman on December 31. Iger, who stepped down as Disney's CEO in 2020 after 15 years in the role, will leave the company later this month.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India-born Gita Gopinath to become IMF's second-highest ranking official in 2022
text: IMF has announced that Chief Economist Gita Gopinath will take up the role of First Deputy Managing Director (FDMD) in 2022, becoming its second-highest ranking official. India-born Gopinath, who was scheduled to return to Harvard University in January 2022, has decided to stay at IMF. "She is the right person at the right time," IMF Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Vaccinating the world against COVID-19 to cost $50 billion: OECD
text: OECD has estimated it would cost $50 billion to vaccinate the world against COVID-19. It's a measure that's key to tackling the imbalances "plaguing the recovery", OECD Chief Economist Laurence Boone said. "When you balance things out, $10 trillion for supporting our economy...compared with $50 billion to bring the vaccine to...world population, that looks completely disproportionate," she added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Cryptos not suitable for transactions due to volatility: Nilekani
text: Infosys Co-founder Nandan Nilekani said cryptocurrencies are not suitable for transactions because of volatility and high transaction costs. "If we've a...well regulated...crypto market, not as currency but as assets and lot of young people build innovative applications around that then these...people could create a wave of global companies," he added. There's a role for crypto as assets, he said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Musk sells Tesla shares worth $1 bn, bringing total to over $10 bn
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has sold another 9,34,091 shares of Tesla worth $1.01 billion, US SEC filings showed. The sales were to help him offset taxes on the exercise of about 2.1 million options. This brings the total of shares sold to 10.1 million for about $10.9 billion since Musk took a poll on offloading 10% of his stake.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: OYO appoints SBI's ex-Chairman Rajnish Kumar as Strategic Group Advisor
text: Hospitality firm OYO on Thursday said that it has appointed former SBI Chairman Rajnish Kumar as Strategic Group Advisor. Kumar will advise the company's management on short and long-term strategies, regulatory and stakeholder engagement besides enhancing the brand of the company globally, OYO said. Recently, fintech startup BharatPe had appointed Kumar as Chairman of its board.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Binny Bansal sold 0.3% Flipkart stake worth $200 mn in July: Report
text: Flipkart Co-founder Binny Bansal sold a part of his stake in the firm worth $200-250 million to Tencent Holdings in July when Flipkart last raised funds, The Economic Times reported. Flipkart had raised $3.6 billion in funding at $37.6 billion valuation in July. Bansal, who earlier held 2.7% stake, still holds around 2.4% in the company after the stake sale.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Need reasons why petrol products can't be brought under GST: Kerala HC
text: The Kerala High Court said that genuine reasons were needed as to why petroleum products cannot be brought under GST. This comes after GST Council said it would be difficult to bring the products under GST during the pandemic. "Pandemic period can't be cited as a reason...even during the pandemic, several decisions were taken involving revenue, after deliberations," HC added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Tata Group to get stake in Cochin airport after Air India takeover: Report
text: Tata Group will receive stake in Kerala's Cochin airport after it acquires Air India, Business Standard reported. The conglomerate will become the only airline to have an operational stake in a major Indian airport, the report added. Air India has 3% stake in the airport and the stake will be with the buyer, as per government's disinvestment documents, it said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Taliban's curbs on working women could cost Afghan economy $1 bn: UN report
text: The Taliban's move to restrict women from working could immediately cost the Afghan economy up to $1 billion or 5% of its GDP, the United Nations Development Programme said in a report. Women account for 20% of the country's workforce, it added. Preventing women from working could shave half a billion dollars alone from household consumption, the report said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Jet Airways in talks with Boeing, Airbus to purchase 100 aircraft
text: Jet Airways is in talks with Boeing and Airbus to purchase at least 100 narrowbody jets, its owners, Murari Lal Jalan and Kalrock Capital, said. "It'll be at least something that covers us for...next five to six years," Jalan said. The group is set to invest about $200 million through equity and debt in Jet in next six months.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Bharti Airtel in talks to buy majority stake in Dish TV: Report
text: Bharti Airtel is in early talks to buy a majority stake in Essel Group-owned Dish TV India, Mint reported. Accounting firm EY, which Airtel hired to inspect Dish TV's financials, has submitted the due diligence report to the telecom company, the report said. Shares of Dish TV rose by 4.8% during early trade to hit upper circuit at ₹18.40.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Star Health IPO subscribed 20% on day 2, retail portion booked 89%
text: Star Health and Allied Insurance's IPO, backed by Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, was subscribed 20% on the second day of bidding, receiving bids for 89.67 lakh shares against offer size of 4.49 crore shares. The portion set aside for retail investors was subscribed 89%, while that of non-institutional investors was subscribed 2%. It plans to mobilise ₹7,249.18 crore through the IPO.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Raymond approves ₹800 crore IPO of subsidiary JK Files & Engineering
text: Raymond has said that its board approved listing of its wholly-owned material subsidiary JK Files & Engineering (JKFEL) through an initial public offering (IPO). The company, which aims to mobilise ₹800 crore through its subsidiary's IPO, said that the issue will help deleverage Raymond. Post-IPO, JKFEL would continue to remain its material subsidiary, Raymond added.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India's Nov exports rise 26% to $29.8 bn, trade deficit at record $23 bn
text: India's exports rose by 26.49% to $29.88 billion in November, as against $23.62 billion in the same month last year, provisional data released by the government showed. Trade deficit widened to an all-time high of $23.27 billion as gold imports grew by about 8% to $4.22 billion during the month. Imports rose 57.18% to $53.15 billion in November.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Sensex surges 776 points to close at 58,461, Nifty ends above 17,400
text: The Sensex on Thursday surged by 776.50 points or 1.35% higher to close at 58,461.29, while the broader Nifty 50 rose 234.80 points or 1.37% to end at 17,401.70. HDFC soared 4% to end as top Sensex gainer, followed by PowerGrid, Sun Pharma, Tata Steel, Tech Mahindra and Bajaj Finserv. ICICI Bank and Axis Bank were among the top losers.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: General Atlantic appoints Mastercard's ex-CEO Banga as Vice Chairman
text: Private equity firm General Atlantic has appointed former Mastercard CEO Ajay Banga as its Vice Chairman. Banga will advise on strategic matters for the firm, its investment teams and its portfolio of more than 165 growth companies around the world, General Atlantic said. Banga, who started his career at Nestle India, has also served as CEO of Citigroup Asia Pacific.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Current vaccines likely protect against severe COVID from Omicron: BioNTech CEO
text: German company BioNTech's CEO Uğur Şahin has said the current generation of COVID-19 vaccines will likely still protect against severe illness in people infected by Omicron variant. "Our message is: Don't freak out, the plan remains the same: Speed up the administration of a third booster shot," he added. BioNTech and Pfizer made one of the first vaccines against COVID-19.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Mahindra shares poster of film named 'Omicron', says 'someone beat me to writing script'
text: After COVID-19 strain Omicron was identified, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra shared the poster of a 1963 Italian film titled 'Omicron'. "And after my last tweet, a school buddy sent me this...someone already beat me to writing a script titled Omicron," he tweeted. The film was about an alien taking over a man's body to learn about Earth.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Who is Vineeta Agarwala, new Twitter CEO's wife & adjunct Stanford professor?
text: Vineeta Agarwala, wife of Twitter's new CEO Parag Agrawal, is a physician and an adjunct clinical professor at Stanford School of Medicine. She's also a General Partner at Andreessen Horowitz (a16z) where she leads investments for the venture capital firm's bio fund. Vineeta holds a BS in biophysics from Stanford University and MD and PhD degrees from Harvard Medical School/MIT.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I spend an hour per day with 5 employees to hear them out: Cognizant CEO
text: Cognizant CEO Brian Humphries told AP that he spends "an hour every day with five employees to hear them out". "What's on their minds, what's working, what's not, how do they feel about our communication...etc," the Nasdaq-listed global IT major's chief explained. He added the next generation of workers "really want to work for a company that has a purpose".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: $50 'Cyberwhistle' sold out in hours after Musk's tweet, reseller lists it for $2,250
text: Tesla's 'Cyberwhistle', which costs $50 (₹3,750), appeared to have sold out within hours after CEO Elon Musk tweeted about its launch. Resellers have already been listing the item on eBay at high prices of up to $2,250 (₹1.68 lakh). Earlier, world's richest person Musk referred to Apple's $19 'Polishing Cloth' as "silly" and asked people to buy the 'Cyberwhistle' instead.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Virtual land sells for ₹32 crore in most expensive 'metaverse' property sale
text: A virtual land in The Sandbox metaverse has been sold for $4.3 million (₹32.2 crore), marking the biggest metaverse property sale, The Wall Street Journal reported. Republic Realm, which invests in and develops virtual real estate, made the purchase. Last week, Metaverse Group had set a record by purchasing a patch of digital land for $2.4 million (₹17.8 crore).
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Musk mocks $19 Apple Cloth as 'silly' as Tesla launches $50 'Cyberwhistle'
text: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared on Twitter that the automaker has launched a 'Cyberwhistle', whose shape is inspired by its upcoming Cybertruck. "Don't waste your money on that silly Apple Cloth, buy our whistle instead!" he wrote. Apple's 'Polishing Cloth' costs $19 each, while Tesla's 'Cyberwhistle', which is made from medical-grade stainless steel, costs $50.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella sells half of his stake in the company
text: Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella sold half of his stake in the company in multiple tranches by offloading about 8,40,000 shares for over $285 million. He sold the stake for personal financial planning and diversification reasons, Microsoft said. This comes ahead of the impending implementation of capital gains tax law by Washington, which attracts 7% tax on stock sales over $2,50,000.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India exports its best test taking talent: Zoho CEO on many India-born CEOs in US
text: After Parag Agrawal became Twitter's CEO, Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu explained why many large US tech companies have India-born CEOs. "India has specialised in exporting its best test taking talent," he tweeted. This talent pool will excel in a system like US that's "too focused on metrics", he added. "Is there a more competitive test than IIT JEE?" Vembu asked.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: SpaceX faces 'risk of bankruptcy', Musk reportedly tells employees
text: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk reportedly told employees that the company faces a "genuine risk of bankruptcy if we cannot achieve a Starship flight rate of at least once every two weeks next year", CNBC reported. In a companywide email sent the day after Thanksgiving, Musk wrote, "The Raptor production crisis is much worse than it seemed a few weeks ago."
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: SpaceX going bankrupt in severe global recession not impossible: Musk
text: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in response to a report on him telling staff that SpaceX could face "genuine risk of bankruptcy", said, "If a severe global recession were to dry up capital availability/liquidity while SpaceX was losing billions...then bankruptcy, while still unlikely, is not impossible." "The magnitude of the Starship program is not widely appreciated," he added.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: LPG cylinder for commercial use becomes costlier by ₹100 from today
text: The price of a commercial LPG cylinder has been increased by ₹100 from Wednesday. A 19-kg commercial cylinder now costs ₹2,101 in Delhi, while the price rose to ₹2,051 in Mumbai. In Kolkata, the commercial LPG rate surged to ₹2,174.50, while in Chennai, it'll be available for ₹2,234.50. On November 1, the price was hiked by ₹266 per cylinder.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: GST collection in November at ₹1.31 lakh crore, second-highest ever
text: The government on Wednesday said that ₹1,31,526 crore gross GST revenue was collected in November 2021, registering the second-highest amount collected since GST's introduction. The revenues are 25% higher than the GST revenues in the same month last year and 27% over 2019-20. In April, the government's GST collection stood at around ₹1.40 lakh crore, making it the highest ever.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Zara Co-founder's 37-yr-old daughter Marta Ortega to lead the parent company
text: Marta Ortega, the 37-year-old daughter of Zara Co-founder Amancio Ortega, has been named the next Chairwoman of Zara's parent company Inditex following a "generational handover process". Spanish retail giant Inditex owns high street chains Zara, Bershka and Massimo Dutti. Marta Ortega, who's been with the firm for 15 years, will take over as Chairwoman of Inditex from April 1, 2022.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: SC to sentence Mallya for contempt on Jan 18, says 'can't wait forever'
text: The Supreme Court said it can't wait "forever" for fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya and has fixed January 18 as final date for deciding quantum of sentence against him in the 2017 contempt of court case. "It's up to Mallya to appear in person," the SC added. Mallya was found guilty of contempt for transferring $40 million to his children.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Amazon under-reported COVID-19 cases contracted at work: US labour group
text: Amazon has been accused of under-reporting COVID-19 cases contracted at work by American labour group Strategic Organizing Center. "How is it possible for the company to say it had 20,000 cases and only 27 were transmitted at work? That defies science and logic," its Health and Safety Director said. The group has called on the federal government to investigate Amazon.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Cathie Wood's ARK buys 1.1 mn Twitter shares after Dorsey steps down
text: Cathie Wood's ARK Investment Management bought 1.1 million shares of Twitter, a day after Jack Dorsey stepped down as the CEO of the platform. ARK acquired the shares worth $48.9 million at Tuesday's closing price of $43.94, according to the firm's daily trade report. Shares of Twitter jumped up to 11% on Monday as Dorsey's stepping down news broke.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: China plans to ban loophole used by tech firms for foreign IPOs: Report
text: China is planning to ban companies from going public on foreign stock markets through variable interest entities, Bloomberg said. It is among changes included in a new draft of China's overseas listing rules that may be finalised as soon as this month. Companies using the VIE structure would still be allowed to pursue IPOs in Hong Kong, subject to approval.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Tesla's China factory on track to make 5 lakh cars this yr: Report
text: Tesla's Shanghai factory is on track to meet its goal of making five lakh vehicles this year, Chinese think tank EV100 reported. The Shanghai factory has localised more than 90% of its supply chain. Earlier this week, China's Beijing Daily newspaper reported that Tesla plans to invest around $188 million to expand the factory's production capacity.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: ₹500 cr undisclosed income detected after raids on Jaipur-based group
text: The Income Tax Department has detected undisclosed income of over ₹500 crore after it raided a Jaipur-based group, involved in manufacturing and export of jewellery and coloured gem stones, the CBDT said. Out of the total, ₹72 crore was admitted by the group entities as undisclosed income, CBDT added. Jewellery worth ₹9 crore and ₹4 crore cash was also seized.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Jhunjhunwala backed-Star Health's IPO subscribed 12% on Day 1
text: The ₹7,249-crore IPO of Star Health and Allied Insurance, backed by Rakesh Jhunjhunwala, was subscribed 12% on the first day of bidding. It received bids for 53.19 lakh equity shares against an IPO size of 4.49 crore equity shares. The portion set aside for retail investors was subscribed 0.64 times, whereas that of non-institutional investors was subscribed 0.01 times.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: SC allows Yes Bank to vote in Essel Group-owned Dish TV's AGM
text: The Supreme Court has stayed criminal proceedings against Yes Bank by Uttar Pradesh Police and allowed the bank to vote in Essel Group-owned Dish TV's AGM. UP police had frozen Yes Bank's voting rights in its stake held in Dish TV. "We cannot permit police officers sitting in Gautam Buddha Nagar to freeze voting rights of a shareholder," SC said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India's manufacturing PMI hits 10-month high in November at 57.6
text: India's manufacturing sector activity grew at its fastest pace in 10 months in November, according to a private survey. The IHS Markit India Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) rose to 57.6 in November, remaining above the 50-mark threshold, that separates expansion from contraction, for the fifth straight month. This figure was at 55.9 in October.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India's GDP likely to grow more than 9.5% in FY22: SBI Research
text: India's GDP is likely to grow over 9.5% in financial year 2021-22, an SBI Research report said. In first half of FY21, India exhibited a real GDP loss of ₹11.4 lakh crore due to complete lockdown in April-May and partial lockdown in June-September, it added. However, in first half FY22, the real gain was around ₹8.2 lakh crore, it said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Eight core sectors' output rises by 7.5% in October
text: The output of India's eight core infrastructure sectors grew by 7.5% in October, government data showed. During the month, the production of coal, natural gas and refinery products increased 14.6%, 25.8% and 14.4%, respectively. However, the production of crude oil declined by 2.2% year-on-year in October. The output of the eight sectors had contracted by 0.5% in October 2020.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Tega Industries' ₹619-cr IPO fully subscribed within 1 hour of opening
text: The ₹619.23-crore initial public offering (IPO) of Tega Industries was fully subscribed within one hour of opening for subscription on Wednesday. As of 12 pm, the portion reserved for retail investors was subscribed 3.28 times. The firm has fixed a price band of ₹443-453 per share for the IPO, which will remain open till December 3.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: India's April-October fiscal deficit at 36.3% of Budget estimates
text: India's April to October period fiscal deficit is at ₹5.47 lakh crore or 36.3% of the Budget estimates, as per data released by Controller General of Accounts. The deficit figure was 119.7% of the Budget estimates in the same period last year. Last month, the deficit was at ₹5.26 lakh crore or 35% of the estimates.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Jack Dorsey steps down as Twitter CEO, Parag Agrawal to replace him
text: Twitter co-founder and CEO Jack Dorsey has stepped down from his role and the company's Indian American CTO Parag Agrawal has been named as his replacement. "I believe the company is ready to move on from its founders. My trust in Parag as Twitter's CEO is deep," said Dorsey in a statement. Agrawal was unanimously appointed CEO by Twitter's board.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: How much salary will Twitter's new CEO Parag Agrawal receive?
text: Twitter's new CEO Parag Agrawal will receive an annual salary of $1 million, plus bonuses, the company informed the US Securities and Exchange Commission. He'll receive restricted stock units valued at $12.5 million that'll vest in 16 equal quarterly increments, starting February 1, 2022. In April, the IIT-Bombay graduate will get performance-based restricted stock units valued at $12.5 million.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 6 US tech giants now run by Indian-origin CEOs: Stripe CEO on Twitter's new CEO
text: Patrick Collison, the CEO of world's third-largest unicorn startup Stripe, said it's "wonderful to watch the amazing success of Indians in the technology world" after Indian-American Parag Agrawal was appointed as the new CEO of Twitter. "Google, Microsoft, Adobe, IBM, Palo Alto Networks, and now Twitter run by CEOs who grew up in India," Collison said.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Several old tweets by Parag Agrawal go viral after he becomes Twitter CEO
text: After Parag Agrawal became Twitter's CEO, many of his old tweets resurfaced. One such tweet read, "Whatay headline: Woman's boyfriend nearly died when she suffocated him with her enormous breasts." Another tweet that surfaced read, "On women's day, Pakistani bowlers learn that length does matter." A 2010 tweet read, "I've been a vegetarian since I got to India...I've been vegetating."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Meta ordered to sell gif-sharing platform GIPHY by UK regulator
text: Facebook's parent Meta has been ordered to sell gif-sharing platform GIPHY by the UK's Competition and Markets Authority (CMA). The deal could harm social media users and UK advertisers, the CMA found. "It has already removed GIPHY as a potential challenger in display advertising market," it added. "We disagree with this decision," Meta said, adding that it's considering all options.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Indian CEO virus, a pandemic we're proud of: Mahindra as Agrawal becomes Twitter CEO
text: After Twitter named Indian-American Parag Agrawal as its CEO, Mahindra Group Chairman Anand Mahindra wrote, "This is one pandemic...we're happy and proud to say originated in India." "It's the Indian CEO Virus...No vaccine against it," he tweeted. Mahindra was replying to a tweet on Indian-origin persons leading some of the world's top tech companies, such as Google and Microsoft.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Twitter's new CEO Parag shares e-mail to Dorsey, says 'grateful for your trust'
text: Twitter's new CEO Parag Agrawal in an e-mail to outgoing CEO Jack Dorsey said, "I'm grateful for your continued mentorship and your friendship." He added, "I'm grateful for the service you built, the culture, soul, purpose you fostered among us and for leading [Twitter] through really significant challenges. I'm grateful for the trust you've put in me...for your continued partnership."
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Great moment for India's depth of talent: Billionaire Adani on Twitter's new CEO
text:
After Twitter appointed Parag Agrawal as CEO, India's second richest person Gautam Adani wrote on Twitter, "Another great moment for India's depth of talent and USA's meritocracy system." 
"Congrats...You'll do Twitter and Jack Dorsey proud," the billionaire said. He added, "After Microsoft, Google, IBM, Adobe, Flex, VMware and more, yet another Indian rises to lead the digital world."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: 37-yr-old Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal becomes youngest CEO in top 500 US firms
text: Twitter's new Chief Executive Officer Parag Agrawal is now the youngest CEO in the S&P 500. Agrawal is 37 years old, the same age as Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg, who held this youngest CEO tag earlier. Twitter didn't disclose Agrawal's birthday due to security reasons, but confirmed that he was born later in 1984 than Zuckerberg's May birthday, Bloomberg reported.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Anil Agarwal congratulates Parag Agrawal; tweets chart of Indians heading global brands
text: Billionaire Anil Agarwal, the Executive Chairman of Vedanta Resources Limited, on Tuesday congratulated newly appointed Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal. "Indian managers are the best in the world," he tweeted while sharing a chart of 'Indians heading global brands'. It included Google CEO Sundar Pichai, Microsoft CEO Satya Nadella, IBM CEO Arvind Krishna and Novartis CEO Vas Narasimhan among others.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Yearbook photos of 6 billionaires including Elon Musk, Jeff Bezos, Bill Gates go viral
text: A collage of yearbook photos of six billionaires shared by a journalist has gone viral on social media. It includes photos of Apple Co-founder Steve Jobs, Apple CEO Tim Cook, Google Co-founder Larry Page, Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates, Tesla CEO Elon Musk and Amazon Founder Jeff Bezos. Musk replied to a fake image of Warren Buffet with a laughing emoji.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Musk's Starlink stops taking internet services bookings in India after govt warning
text: Elon Musk-led Starlink has stopped taking bookings or pre-orders for its internet services in India after warning from the Department of Telecommunications. "Starlink is not yet available in your area but as we launch more satellites, we continue to expand our coverage area," Starlink's site stated. The government had said Starlink isn't licensed to offer internet services in India.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: US benefits greatly from Indian talent: Musk after Parag Agrawal named Twitter CEO
text: After Indian-American Parag Agrawal was appointed as the new CEO of Twitter, world's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk wrote on Twitter, "USA benefits greatly from Indian talent!" Musk was responding to a tweet by Stripe CEO Patrick Collison, which said, "Google, Microsoft, Adobe, IBM, Palo Alto Networks, and now Twitter run by CEOs who grew up in India."
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Dorsey shares 3 reasons for stepping down as Twitter CEO in last e-mail to staff
text: Outgoing Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey in an e-mail to his team conveying his decision to step down, said, "I'm really sad...yet really happy." He said Parag Agrawal was a reason he could step down, saying Agrawal was behind 'critical decisions' that turned Twitter around. Board Chairman Bret Taylor and the team's "ambition, potential" were the other two reasons, he said.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: New Twitter CEO's old tweet quoting 'Daily Show' joke on white people goes viral
text: Hours after Indian-American Parag Agrawal became Twitter's CEO, his decade-old tweet quoting a joke made on 'The Daily Show with Jon Stewart' went viral. Twitter users and Republicans criticised the tweet about how treating all Muslims as terrorists was analogous to treating all white people as racists. "I was quoting Aasif Mandvi from The Daily Show," Agrawal said in 2010.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Previous cryptocurrency bill reworked, new bill to be introduced soon: FM
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman has informed the Rajya Sabha that the government will introduce a new bill on cryptocurrency once Cabinet clears it. "Last time there was a bill proposed...that's been reworked...[into one] that's far more recent," Sitharaman said. Earlier, Lok Sabha's list said the bill seeks to prohibit private cryptocurrencies with some exceptions to promote underlying tech.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: Twitter's m-cap surges $4 bn on news of Dorsey stepping down, later erases all gains
text: Shares of Twitter jumped as much as 11% on Monday as the news of CEO Jack Dorsey stepping down surfaced. That amounted to a gain of $4.2 billion in market capitalisation, before trading was temporarily halted. However, the stock later erased its entire gain and ended nearly 3% lower. Indian-American Parag Agrawal was named as the company's new CEO.
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: I dropped out of Stanford after I was raped: Fraud-accused Theranos Founder Holmes
text: During her fraud trial, US blood-testing startup Theranos' Founder Elizabeth Holmes testified that she was raped while studying at Stanford University and that's what led her to dropping out. "I decided I was going to build a life by building [Theranos]," she said. Holmes added her ex-boyfriend and ex-Theranos President Ramesh 'Sunny' Balwani "forced me to have sex with him".
author: Kiran Khatri

headlines: India's GDP grows by 8.4% in Q2 of FY22 against record 20.1% growth in last quarter
text: The Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation on Tuesday said that the country's GDP grew by 8.4% during the second quarter (July-September) of 2021-22 compared to 7.4% contraction in the second quarter of 2020-21. India had posted a growth of record 20.1% in the first quarter (April-June) of 2021-22.
author: Arshiya Chopra

headlines: Twitter missed US tech rally: Zerodha Co-founder after Dorsey steps down
text: Zerodha Co-founder Nikhil Kamath commenting on Twitter's stock after Jack Dorsey stepped down said, "What's happening at Twitter, Twitter. I personally see a lot of traction, but the stock has totally missed the US tech rally." Shares of Twitter jumped up to 11% on Monday after Dorsey's news broke, adding $4.2 billion in market capitalisation, but ended nearly 3% lower.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Bitcoin surges as much as 3.4% to rise above $58,000
text: Bitcoin rose as much as 3.4% to trade around $58,266 on Monday. Several other cryptocurrencies, including Dogecoin and Polkadot, also bounced back. The development came after cryptocurrency prices fell on Friday amid concerns regarding the new COVID-19 variant, Omicron, found in South Africa. Bitcoin saw its value decline 20% from the record high it hit earlier in November.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: 8 cases of crypto-related fraud under probe by ED: FM Sitharaman
text: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman told the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday that eight cases related to cryptocurrency fraud are under investigation by the Directorate of Enforcement (ED). Calling cryptocurrencies a "risky area", she said attempts have been made to create awareness through RBI and SEBI. She also informed that a new bill on cryptocurrency will be introduced once Cabinet clears it.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: A lot has happened in 8 years: Elon Musk on SpaceX staying private
text: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk said "a lot has happened in 8 years" after a Twitter user shared a 2013 email from Musk on why he wanted to keep the space-exploration company private. Musk wrote in the email that SpaceX was valued at $4 billion to $5 billion at the time. SpaceX hit $100 billion valuation last month after secondary sale.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Snapdeal to file for ₹1,875-crore IPO in next few weeks: Report
text: Snapdeal is planning to file draft papers for an initial public offering (IPO) to raise as much as ₹1,875-crore ($250 million) in the next few weeks, Bloomberg reported. The e-commerce startup is aiming to go public in early 2022 and may seek a $1.5 billion valuation, it added. Its largest shareholders, including Alibaba and SoftBank, reportedly won't be selling shares.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Elon Musk says he will return for Tesla's next earnings call
text: Tesla CEO Elon Musk in tweets discussing Cybertruck revealed that he will be attending Tesla's next earnings call, saying, "This year has been such a supply chain nightmare & it's not over! I will provide...updated product roadmap on next earnings call." Earlier, Musk had said he might not attend future earnings calls unless he had something important to say.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: SC gives Amazon 2 weeks to put case before CCI in Future dispute
text: The Supreme Court has granted two weeks more to ﻿Amazon﻿ to argue before the CCI in its dispute with Future Group. Earlier, CCI had declined adjournment of hearing in a case related to revocation of approval given to Amazon's investment transaction with Future Coupons. The Delhi HC on November 16 had asked CCI to conclude the case within two weeks.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Go Fashion shares list at 90% premium over IPO price of ₹690
text: Go Colors brand operator Go Fashion made stock market debut with a premium of 90% at ₹1,310 per share on the NSE as compared to its IPO issue price of ₹690 per share. Its shares were trading at ₹1,316 on the BSE. Go Fashion raised ₹1,014 crore via share sale through initial public offering (IPO) which closed on November 22.
author: Aishwarya Awasthi

headlines: Delhi govt starts TV show to help school children pitch startup ideas to investors
text: The Delhi government has launched a TV programme to allow Class 11 and 12 students of government-run schools to present their startup ideas to investors and obtain investment capital. Under the 'Business Blasters' initiative, the show will include students' business ideas, shortlisted from 51,000 entries submitted by 3 lakh students. Each participating student will receive ₹2,000 as seed money.
author: Shreyasi Banerjee

headlines: Crypto named 'Omicron' surges over 900% as WHO gives name to new COVID variant
text: A relatively unknown cryptocurrency called Omicron (OMIC) shot up by over 900% since the WHO gave the same name to the newly-discovered COVID-19 variant. The crypto token, which was priced at around $65 (around ₹4,880) on November 27, touched a peak of $689 (around ₹51,730) on Monday. This came even as the crypto market tumbled after the variant's discovery.
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Concerned about India's policies backing rival RuPay: Visa in complaint to US govt
text: Visa complained to the US government that India's promotion of its local rival RuPay hurts the US payments major, according to memos seen by Reuters. Visa said it remains concerned about "India's informal and formal policies that appear to favour the business of NPCI", that runs RuPay. It said India promotes RuPay over other domestic and foreign electronic payments companies.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: After Airtel and Vodafone Idea, Jio hikes prepaid tariffs
text: Reliance Jio on Sunday announced new unlimited plans and a hike in its tariffs with its lowest plan now starting at ₹91 instead of ₹75. The new plans will be available from December 1 of this year for its customers. Jio's tariff hike announcement comes days after Airtel and Vodafone Idea (now Vi) announced a 20-25% hike on prepaid plans.
author: Pragya Swastik

headlines: RBI supersedes Reliance Capital board citing defaults, appoints administrator
text: The RBI on Monday said that it has superseded board of directors of Anil Ambani-owned Reliance Capital due to the defaults of the company in meeting various payment obligations to its creditors. The board hasn't been able to address serious governance concerns effectively, RBI added. It appointed Bank of Maharashtra's former Executive Director, Nageswar Rao Y, as the firm's administrator.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: No proposal to recognise Bitcoin as a currency: Finance Minister Sitharaman
text: The government has no proposal to recognise Bitcoin as a currency in the country, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman told the Lok Sabha. She also informed that the government does not collect data on Bitcoin transactions. Bitcoin is a digital currency that allows people to buy goods and services and exchange money without involving banks, credit card issuers or third parties.
author: Apaar Sharma

headlines: Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey to step down: Report
text: Twitter co-founder and CEO Jack Dorsey is expected to step down from his executive role, CNBC reported, quoting sources. Twitter's stock, meanwhile, jumped more than 10% in early trading on Monday on the report of Dorsey stepping down. The 45-year-old had, in his last tweet on November 28, said, "I love Twitter".
author: Sakshita Khosla

headlines: Govt panel seeks more data from Serum Institute on Covovax: Report
text: An expert panel of Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO) has sought additional data from Serum Institute of India (SII) on its COVID-19 vaccine Covovax, according to reports. It also noted that Covovax hasn't yet been approved in the country of origin, reports added. In October, SII sought permission from DCGI to manufacture Covovax for restricted use in emergency situations.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Govt has provided no additional favours to RuPay: Former NPCI CEO
text: NPCI's former CEO AP Hota told Moneycontrol the Indian government has provided no additional favours to RuPay apart from inclusion in Pradhan Mantri Jan Dhan Yojana. Hota's comments come after Visa reportedly complained to US government that India's promotion of RuPay hurts the US payments major. "Visa need not get scared. They should focus on what India needs," Hota added.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: We categorically deny any intent to bid for BT Group: Reliance Industries
text: Reliance Industries on Monday said it "categorically denies" any intent to bid for the UK's biggest telecoms company BT Group. The company's statement came after The Economic Times reported that Reliance could make an unsolicited offer to buy into BT Group or even stake a claim for a controlling stake. Reliance said the report was "completely speculative and baseless".
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: COAI asks govt to cut 5G spectrum base price by more than half: Reports
text: Telecom industry body COAI  has asked the government to reduce spectrum base price by more than half, especially for 5G services, according to reports. In March, government offered 2,308.80 MHz of spectrum in seven bands at a reserve price of nearly ₹4 lakh crore. However, airwaves in 700 MHz and 2,500 MHz bands went unsold due to high base prices.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: MicroStrategy buys Bitcoin worth $414 mn, total holding valued at $7 bn
text: American business intelligence company MicroStrategy has acquired an additional 7,002 Bitcoins for over $414 million in cash, its Founder and CEO Michael Saylor announced on Monday. The new tokens were acquired for an average price of $59,187 per Bitcoin, he wrote on Twitter. This takes MicroStrategy's total Bitcoin holding to 121,044, worth nearly $7 billion as of Monday.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: Amazon urges CCI to revoke nod for ₹24,713-cr Future-Reliance deal: Report
text: Amazon has written to the Competition Commission of India (CCI), urging it to revoke the approval for Future Retail's ₹24,713-crore deal with Reliance Industries, according to a letter seen by Reuters. The approval was a "nullity in the eyes of law", Amazon said. Amazon had won an injunction against the deal from Singapore arbitrator but CCI later cleared the deal.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Nissan to spend $17.6 bn in 5 yrs to 'accelerate vehicle electrification'
text: Nissan has said it will spend $17.59 billion over the next five years to accelerate vehicle electrification. The Japanese automaker added that it will introduce 23 electrified vehicles by 2030, including 15 electric vehicles (EVs). The company also said it wants to reduce cost of lithium-ion battery by 65% within eight years and introduce all solid-state batteries by March 2029.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Amazon's counsels walked out of CCI hearing: Future Retail
text: Future Retail (FRL) has said that Amazon's counsels walked out of a Competition Commission of India (CCI) hearing last week. This came after CCI said that the hearing cannot be postponed to give Amazon further time to make oral submissions, FRL added. "The conduct of Amazon smacks of arrogance...CCI should deal with this conduct of Amazon appropriately," it said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Paytm shares fall after it reports a net loss of ₹474 crore in Q2
text: Paytm parent One97 Communications' shares fell on Monday after the company reported its Q2 results. Paytm's shares slumped 5% in early trade to reach an intraday low of ₹1,700. The company reported a net loss of ₹474 crore during the July-September quarter as against ₹437 crore in the year-ago period. Its revenue from operations grew 64% year-on-year to ₹1,090 crore.
author: Hiral Goyal

headlines: ₹52,000 crore GST compensation due to states as of Sept: MoS Finance
text: Nearly ₹52,000 crore of GST compensation was due to the states as of September 2021, Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary informed the Parliament. Over ₹1.10 lakh crore and ₹1.59 lakh crore was released to the states as back to back loan in FY21 and FY22, respectively, he added. COVID-19's economic impact led to higher compensation requirement, he said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: I may be kidnapped once again and taken to Guyana: Mehul Choksi
text: PNB scam accused Mehul Choksi said, "I may be coerced and kidnapped once again and taken to Guyana, where there's a strong Indian presence." The fugitive diamantaire, who is currently in Antigua, added his poor health doesn't allow him to move anywhere. "My lawyers are fighting cases in...Antigua and Dominica and I've...faith that I shall emerge victorious," Choksi said.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Protestors in Lebanon block roads, burn tyres amid economic crisis
text: Protestors in Lebanon blocked roads on Monday by burning tyres in Beirut, Tripoli and Sidon to protest against looming economic turmoil in the country. The protests come as the value of the Lebanese pound sank to over 25,000 against the US dollar last week. The turmoil, which erupted in 2019, has pushed more than three-quarters of the population towards poverty.
author: Disha Jana

headlines: Tuticorin plant facing severe corrosion, needs maintenance: Vedanta to SC
text: Vedanta has informed the Supreme Court that its Sterlite Copper plant in Tamil Nadu's Tuticorin is facing severe corrosion and faces threat of total structure collapse. In its affidavit, Vedanta urged the court to urgently hear its plea for granting it access to the plant to carry out essential maintenance work. The plant has been shut since May 2018.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: LIC gets RBI nod to increase stake in Kotak Mahindra Bank to 9.99%
text: Kotak Mahindra Bank said the RBI has granted its approval to Life Insurance Corporation of India (LIC) to increase holding in the bank to up to 9.99%. The approval is valid for a period of one year, it added. LIC has 4.96% stake in the bank as of September 30 and is its fifth largest shareholder, according to Refinitiv data.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: MSCI’s decision to drop us from climate change indices disappointing: Adani
text: Adani Ports and Special Economic Zone (APSEZ) said it is disappointed by MSCI's decision to drop its stock from four climate change indices. MSCI said it will drop APSEZ from the indices following its link with Carmichael thermal coal project in Australia. APSEZ said it had clarified to MSCI that it never had any shareholding in Carmichael mine.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: DGTR recommends continuation of anti-dumping duty on Chinese tiles
text: The Commerce Ministry's investigation arm Directorate General of Trade Remedies (DGTR) has recommended continuation of anti-dumping duty on Chinese tiles for five more years. In its probe, it concluded that the product continues to be exported to India at prices below normal value resulting in continued dumping. DGTR recommended duty of $1.87 per square meter tonne.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: SEBI as a regulator doesn't get into IPO valuations: Chairman
text: SEBI as the regulator doesn't and shouldn't get into IPO valuations, its Chairman Ajay Tyagi said. Start-ups getting listed in India provides an opportunity for domestic investors to participate, he added. "SEBI has to make sure...investor interests are protected and...there isn't over-regulation so that companies don't get discouraged to list here," Tyagi said in interview to Business Standard.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: PNB puts up MP-based steel & agri firm for sale to recover ₹200-cr dues
text: State-owned Punjab National Bank (PNB) has put up Madhya Pradesh-based National Steel and Agro Industries for sale to recover its outstanding dues of nearly ₹200 crore. The bank has fixed the reserve price (on cash basis) for the sale process at ₹95 crore. The lender has set December 8 as the last date for completion of due diligence exercise.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Religare's NBFC arm all set to restart business in Jan: Chairperson
text: Religare Enterprises Chairperson Rashmi Saluja has said that the company's NBFC arm, Religare Finvest (RFL), is all set to restart its business from January. "The company has put on block ₹600 crore NPA and it is at an advanced stage," she added. RFL has been barred from undertaking fresh business as it is under RBI's corrective action plan since 2018.
author: Krishna Raj

headlines: Sovereign Gold Bond to open for subscription on Nov 29 at ₹4,791/gram
text: The eighth tranche of Sovereign Gold Bond Scheme 2021-22 will open for subscription on Monday. The RBI has fixed the issue price at ₹4,791 per gram and a discount of ₹50 per gram will be given to investors applying online and making the payment through digital mode. The tenor of the bond will be for a period of eight years.
author: Krishna Raj
